Coconut Development Board Road, Pasikuda 30410 Sri Lanka
text: This place is geared for older retirees. The beach itself is excellent, the pool was too warm in my opinion. The rooms are clean but just ok. Very nice people. Food was buffet style and average. The music playing during dinner was a nice effort but the songs are all western oldies.
title: Good for retirees, but thats about it.

placeInfo/address: Coconut Development Board Road, Pasikuda 30410 Sri Lanka
text: It was nice. Food could improve. Nice hospitality. Great view. Overall great hotel. Nice staff. Nice pool. Nice hotel room. Nice bathroom. Nice avurudu event. everything is nice except the quality of food. Desert section could improve and the pasta and some othwr food items taste BLAND WITH LESS FLAVOUR. Please consider. Thanks
title: Daughter's Birthday and awrudu celebrations

placeInfo/address: Hatton Road, Lethant 22000 Sri Lanka
roomTip: Avoid rooms on the left hand side of the bungalow - they are near a noisy road
text:
We had the highest expectations for our stay at Ceylon Tea Trails but for reasons that we still do not understand we were moved without notice from the Summerville Bungalow to the Tientsin bungalow which seems to be a spill over location. We paid extra for a garden suite which was useless as there is busy and noisy road just below the garden so unless you like traffic noise and radios it’s best avoided. The bungalow is also nearly an hour away from all activities ( e.g. kayaking) but if you don’t mind not moving it’s a peaceful location.
On the positive side the food and bungalow itself is magnificent and the staff are really fantastic. They cannot do enough to help and are always friendly and welcoming.
title: Sadly not what we booked or expected

placeInfo/address: Hatton Road, Lethant 22000 Sri Lanka
text:
We spent 3 nights at Ceylon Tea Trails Castlereagh bungalow  in Feb. It was a nice stay but an underwhelming experience after the big build up in the promotional videos. 

On the positives 

The property is very pretty with an old world colonial bungalow set in a beautiful  English styled garden with stunning views of  the lake

The service was excellent and the staff are wonderful and go out of their way as they do in all the hotels we have stayed in of Sri Lanka 

The food was good - we had some delicious meals cooked by Chef Ravi but also some average ones when he went on leave

On the downside 

The property is difficult to reach and if you don’t fly in via a chartered  seaplane  it takes ages ( in our case 6 hours from Ulagalla and then an hours wait for the boat transfer as it was doing a picnic cruise ). It also makes it a very long journey if you want to visit any of the neighbouring attractions.

The hiking trails are nice but very steep in places. They pass through many villages housing and unfortunately can have quite some trash lying around. 

There is not too much to do at the hotel and there is a very limited variety of flora or fauna or bird life compared to Ulagalla and other parts of srilanka given all the forests have been cleared to grow tea

Most disappointing for us was the “luxury” room in castlereagh which we were assigned instead of the garden suite we had booked. This was due to a misunderstanding as our preferred room  wasn’t available on the  first day. The luxury room has no privacy with gardeners staff and guests constantly passing within a few feet of the window and the room is dark and stuffy if you draw the blinds. It also has no access to the garden which is half the charm in the hills. 

The hotel appears  to  cater to people who enjoy or want to relive the experience  of the old colonial lifestyle - butler’s and staff waiting on you , call bells in the room to summon staff, butlers who bring you tea in bed in the morning … 

I am sure that’s fine for  some,   but was not our cup of tea.  

We preferred our stay in Ulagalla which was equally if not more luxurious, very beautiful with a variety of flora and fauna and just felt more authentically Sri Lankan with excellent service, delicious food and the wonderful hospitality that this beautiful country has to offer
title: Very pretty but underwhelmed

placeInfo/address: Hatton Road, Lethant 22000 Sri Lanka
text: Our second visit to Tea Trails and Castlereagh Bungalow, some aspects of which are sublime luxury.  The location, on the Dilmah Tea Plantation, the grounds, the accommodation, general ambience and the cuisine are all 5*.  The outstanding chef, Samantha, and the superb waiting staff skilfully led by Ajith, make the dining experience something special.  However, we experienced 2 very negatives features.  Having reserved the Palmer Garden suite for its private garden and summerhouse, we were appalled to find that a gang of men were sawing up a tree (by hand!) adjacent to our suite (actually in the staff quarters!).  The noise and disturbance were awful.  We complained to the Butler who said he would ‘sort it’.  He did not and it continued until dark.  The following morning before 7.00 am it started again and then another, even larger, tree was felled, very narrowly missing the summerhouse where we were sitting and showering everything with dust and debris – potentially very dangerous and extremely frightening!  We eventually ‘erupted’ at 2.00pm and Ajith was able to stop the disturbance which the ineffectual Butler could not.  An expensive day plus was totally ruined!  Also, we were told by our driver that it was no longer possible to drive to the bungalow as the road was so bad and that we would have to travel by boat from another Bungalow.  OK, but for the fact that the steep access on both sides was very slippery and uneven.  If the hotel wants guests, it needs to sort access or else warn guests of the problem beforehand, so that they can wear suitable footwear.  Not at all good!
title: A very costly, but mixed experience of Castlereagh Bunglaow

placeInfo/address: Hatton Road, Lethant 22000 Sri Lanka
text: Arrived by train, 30$ charge for 20 min drive from station. Whatever.  Summerville lovely, overlooking a man made lake, astonishing view. Iphone hooked into a Bose speaker playing Englebert. No one else staying at the 5 suite house, Chicken lunch. ok. but for the hefty all inclusive price? Silence. Except for the Englebert. Our "butler" suggested the tour of the tea factory. Sure. Can you change the music? Alcohol included in the all inclusive, unlike the drive from the train station, and they are not shy about offering it to you in waves, as if in apology for there not being a whole heck of a lot to do. The room well appointed, mosquito nets and large bathrooms. Woken with tea. Tour fine. Lunch at the Castlereigh, (smaller, less charm). Kayaked back.  A mistake, as neither of us knew how to kayak. Drinks. Children ran up behind us in the land rover waving and yelling "bats!'. I asked our guide why bats are important to children Someone who stayed here bought 10 cricket bats and dispersed them at random to the children.A sweet gesture, yet now the ones not lucky clamour to all guests in the rovers the need to be treated equally, to have bats too. More gentle sipping, whiling the aft away, watching the clouded sky, the beautiful emptiness of the lake. Dinner was fish, competent but. We decided to forego the 3rd night. The service was immaculate throughout, all employees were kind, attentive and well trained. We left contented sure, but with that small gnawing feeling of ...
title: Pretty Vacant

ownerResponse/text:
Dear Andreas,  I'm sorry that Tea Trails fell short of your expectation. I don't think the comparison with regular hotels is fair. We are not a “5 star” hotel - we do not compete in that mainstream category, hotels you mention have 100+ rooms and is what many of our guests seek to escape from. 

The focus is on service and I am glad that you acknowledge this is superior. The rooms deliberately don’t have TVs, minibar and conventional hotel amenities as we do not seek to be a conventional hotel. Instead we have a butler call bell, scenery and hopefully conversation!  

Tea Trails seeks to offer a boutique experience fully inclusive of gourmet meals, all beverages, laundry, the tea experience and pretty much anything that a guest would ask for. At a regular "bed & breakfast hotel" these "extras" can exceed the room rate. The range of premium spirits include malt whiskeys but since this is served off a butler trolley we don't have a 50ft bar as a large hotel may.  Our food is highly rated and our chefs are fully equipped as attested by guest feedback over the years. We do not offer massive buffets, everything is a la carte, made to order.  

My apologies about the most unusual weather in August, something obviously beyond our control but nevertheless I fully understand your frustration and how it may have impacted your stay at Tea Trails. We are seeing weather extremes in many parts of the world and Kerala in neighbouring India has been devastated by floods - we have been subject to the same unseasonal weather pattern which is now clearing.  

None of the three resorts in the Resplendent Ceylon collection exceed 40 rooms and our new developments will follow a similar course - original resorts offering a “non-hotel” experience.  Once again, my apologies that we disappointed you.   

Warm wishes, Malik
placeInfo/address: Hatton Road, Lethant 22000 Sri Lanka
text:
We stayed at Tea Trails two nights in August 2018 at the Summerville bungalow. When rating the experience at Tea Trails the price must be the point of departure. We paid USD 1015 for each night (they also had rooms twice the price of that). In comparison we paid approx USD 350 per night at VERY good 5-star hotels in Tangalle (Anantara) and Sigiriya (Jetwing). Tea Trails was 3 times that price, i.e. USD 650 more per night. Can this price difference be justified? We think clearly not:

1. Service: To be fair, the service was really good. You get a lot of attention. This was better than other 5-stars hotels.

2. Rooms: Nothing you would not expect from any 5-star hotel. In fact, the rooms did not have TVs and no minibar, and also lacked other amenities you would expect to get in a 5-star hotel.

3. Breakfast: Nothing you would not expect from and receive at any 5-star hotel, inclusive in the rate.

4. Lunch, afternoon tea and dinner: This was inclusive in the price. Except from free laundry cleaning and free bar this, however, was the only thing which you would have paid for at a regular 5-star hotel, but which was included in the rate at Tea Trails. The food was good, but not that impressive really. We had much better food at the restaurants at other 5-star hotels. So the food inclusive in the rate clearly cannot justify the extra USD 650 per night.

5. Wine: they served cheap red wine, you could choose between 3 types (2 of them with screw caps). This was truly disappointing. The second night we wanted to buy a wine from the menue, but it turned out that they did not have ANY of the red wines on the list. In a 3-star hotel that would be entirely fine. But not in a 5-star hotel charging USD 1015 per night.

6. Drinks: all drinks were free, but they did not have a huge selection. And let’s be realistic: how many drinks can you really have each day?

7. Laundry: This was for free. Very good service. But clearly this add-on cannot justify the price.

8. Activities: Nothing you would not expect from any 5-star hotel. The best activities you had to pay for.

9. Shared areas: Consist of a rather small living room, a garden and a pool. The shared areas are clearly much better at a regular 5-star hotel.

10. Concept: Tea Trails have 5 bungalows, but they are quite far apart. Hence, most of the time (if not all) you will stay in your bungalow, which have 5 rooms. The space feels somewhat limited. Also, each bungalow has its own kitchen and chef. Probably, this explains why the food was not that excellent. Indeed, it will be difficult for such a small hotell to have 5 state-of-the-art kitchens and chefs.

11. Climate: It was raining a lot, all of the time we were at Tea Trails. We have the impression that this is often the case, except from December to March. Hence, you are well advisded to check the climate for the period you will stay at Tea Trails before booking.

All in all: had it been a regular 5-star hotel with regular 5-star hotel prices we would have been very happy. Even if the price had been USD 500 per night, that would have been fine. USD 1015, however, is outreagous. Unless you get a massive discount on the price, I would only recommend Tea Trails to extremely rich people that do not at all care about the price (who, however, surely can find something better elsewhere).
title: Questionable cost benefit

placeInfo/address: Hatton Road, Lethant 22000 Sri Lanka
roomTip: Bungalows (and rooms) are very different. Plenty info online to choose carefully.
text:
We enjoyed our stay and depending on the bungalow where you are staying: the scenery is spectacular, BUT it is a crazy amount of money (for Sri Lankan standards). 

On the positive side:
- Great location, nice views and very friendly and helpful staff.
- Great concept to be able to have a meal at the other bungalows
- Nice to be able to cycle and kayak between the bungalows (at this price point, the kayaking should be included)
- Very tasty food, especially the local curries, nicely presented. I liked the desserts too.
- Nice walking routes, although short distances
- It is nice to see how the tea factory is set up and the mission to help provide better circumstances of living for the working people

A few critical remarks:
- Surprisingly there's no white tea served for the afternoon tea. When asked, it was said it is not an option to serve this.
- How the concept works is not well (at all) explained, but this could as well be due to our arrival time after 11pm.
- Although the meal options are discussed every day with the cook, they try to steer into the same direction/courses for all the guests. They seemed surprised at our request to mainly eat local dishes instead of the Western dishes they often recommended, like risotto, pasta, etc. The vegetarian pasta is not so interesting
- We met the general manager only in one of the bungalows where we stayed.
- The staff seems to be trained minimally and is not used to offering the services you'd expect at this price point/luxury standard this hotel tries to be. You have to ask for a lot of things, which are happily provided, but the staff seems a bit shy. Surprisingly, they did offer to clean and dry our shoes are a muddy/rainy walk.

If you decide to go: carefully check which bungalow to book yourself into. The locations and scenery vary quite a bit. You can find enough information about this online.

We were picked up by car at the Colombo airport, but travelled back by train, departing in Hatton and staying overnight (for two nights) in Kandy before continuing to Colombo. This works very well and was quite an experience. We ran into a staff member at the train station who was asked to assist us there on his day off. Very kind!

We are both vegetarians and don't drink alcohol, so not sure whether I would stay here again at this all inclusive rate for meals and all drinks.

All in all, if you're a luxury traveller you may be disappointed.
title: Staff is trying hard, but if you're a luxury traveller you may be disappointed at this price point

ownerResponse/text: I'm sorry that we disappointed you, although your comments seemingly refer to another resort.
placeInfo/address: Hatton Road, Lethant 22000 Sri Lanka
text: The setting is good if not far from everything else you'll visit while in Sri Lanka. You can take a sea plane which makes it easier though I don't know the cost. Other than the setting, the hotel leaves a lot to be desired. Services and amenities are lacking and it's far from offering the services you'd expect when a hotel boasts luxury standards (and prices). The lack of training leaves you feeling bad when you ask for a glass of water and since they don't naturally refill you feel even worse. Linens and towels are ok, turndown doesn't tidy the room, water isn't offered during outings or boat transfers, butlers don't offer to iron, dirty plates at elect on empty tables, bathroom amenities are not luxurious, there's no management present etc. Privacy is limiting given the small house and grounds.  it feels more like a good Hilton and unless you plan to spend a lot of time there (not much to do) it's hard to justify the distance you'd travel to get there. I'd recommend nuwara eliya and the Amans or even jetwing hotels when down by the coast. And if you do. go and drive be sure not to go directly to your bungalow without asking first if that's the most comfortable wag to get there. Roads aren't great. Meh.
title: If you're a luxury traveler you're likely to be disappointed

placeInfo/address: Hatton Road, Lethant 22000 Sri Lanka
text:
We stayed in the Shutterworth suite of the Summerfield villa, for a few nights. 

The property is beautifully located on a lake surrounded by tea plantations. Staff are very helpful and service is fantastic. Food is very good. All staff were trying hard to make our stay enjoyable and full marks to all of them.

What makes this property 4 star instead of 5 is the accommodation. The common area, ie lounge/dining room and terrace have no ceiling fans. This maybe authentic but applying 1850 standards in the 21st century is a bit of a stretch. There is hardly any wind in the evenings and it was consistently uncomfortable, stuffy and suffocating in these areas taking away from the ambiance. And yes it is cooler in the mountains but still warm indeed and a ceiling fan should be a minimum requirement. 

The rooms are equally below par. Tea Trails define them as luxury rustic giving a new meaning to the word. The furniture is old, worn out, very basic and uninteresting in a dark room. The mattresses are Spartan and of course there is no television. There was no ceiling fan in our sitting room (thus warm) although our bedroom had one. Problem is there is hardly any draught in the rooms making them stuffy and uncomfortable.  

Accepting management's advertising that no airconditioning was needed we expected all would be "cool". The result for us was an uncomfortable restless sleep tossing and turning and the conclusion that the mountain "coolness" was not working for us. Surely luxury accommodation purported to be close to 5 star like the Tea Trails should give customers the choice to select their own "coolness" standards rather than one dictated by management. The lack of airconditioning in the bedrooms is painful and for us a deal-breaker....

All in all an unique experience, great staff in 4 star accommodation.
title: 4 Star accomodation; staff trying hard.

placeInfo/address: Hatton Road, Lethant 22000 Sri Lanka
text: Amazing setting in the middle of the tea plantation, however room in Norwood Bungalow needs a bit of renovation. Place is very relaxed and laid back but overrated for Sri Lanka standard and related services. Private butler? Not really .. Average service as any normal hotel employee. Very Good chef and attentive but you expect something more for this price.
title: Very nice location but overrated

ownerResponse/text: I'm sorry that we did not live up to your expectations. Your comments about the staff at Tea Trails are generally obnoxious and incorrect. Your reference to "tension" is news to me and is a pre-conceived notion. Tea planters bungalows at a 5000 feet elevation do not have or need air conditioning. I notice that all your past hotel reviews offer 2-3 stars and complain about staff. I wouldn't usually respond to a review of this nature but need to defend the hard working Tea Trails staff who would be justifiably grieved at your allegations.
placeInfo/address: Hatton Road, Lethant 22000 Sri Lanka
text:
Considring that the hotel is MEGA EXPENSIVe, the staff was NOT as good as it should be. It was a big deal to ask if they could clean my muddy shoes (it was raining) and the "butler" just said "NO". I mean I had to due it in the tub! not to get the room dirty. If you dont ask for everything they just dont do it. BAD BAD attitude of the staff. The COOK is amazing. The views are beuatiful, try to visit the othr house for lunch... The clothes were washed (we had been traveling for 2 weeks wenn we got there) but you could tell they DId NOT do it with much love!!!! They were just lazy to iron..

Really not ok for the price of the hotel. No air conditionen. maybe a fan in the ceiling. All staff singalese you feel the tension with the Tamils that live in the area, the look down on this people.  Visit the tea factory. But like said, you have to almost "ask for your rights" if not the staff does not care. Dont stay for more than 3 nights. You will get bored. They need to get higer chairs for the tea tables... to high the table to low the chairs. 

Sometimes you have the feeling that the staff is spying on you!
title: Great Food, beutiful place, staff has to improve a lot

placeInfo/address: Hatton Road, Lethant 22000 Sri Lanka
roomTip: All the rooms had lovely garden views, beautifully planted.
text: Getting to the Tea Trails is an exciting experience.  A sea plane picked us up near Galle and landed us (30 minutes later) in the lake at Castlereagh.  The scenery is spectacular.  Sheer hills planted with tea bushes.  The colourful "pickers" in their saris taking just the tips of the plants.  It was a world of colonial architecture and the haves and seriously have nots.  We stayed in Tientsin which was a 40 minute drive through hairpin turns and switchbacks...missing buses and tuk tuks by inches!  The rooms were charmingly reminiscent of 1850 but it is time to update some of the fabrics!  It is an all inclusive hotel as there is NO WHERE else to eat!  The food was good and the chef very very accommodating. The wine list could use some work!  The staff, like everywhere in Sri Lanka, are most attentive!  They know your drink preference immediately, and are there to make sure you have a wonderful time.  It's a great place to unwind, enjoy the scenery, have a nice walk and chill.  Two days was plenty for us.  Congratulations to the Sri Lankan owners who wish to preserve this bygone era of very elegant and easy living, at least for some people!
title: Magnificent scenery from a soon to be bygone era

ownerResponse/text: I'm so sorry about the services snags. You are quite right in saying that at the level we aspire to maintain, that this is unacceptable. The team at the new Dunkeld bungalow had a few hiccups which have since diagnosed and resolved. My sincere apologies, we deserved your brickbat.
placeInfo/address: Hatton Road, Lethant 22000 Sri Lanka
text:
We stayed at the new Dunkeld bungalow for 2 nights and looked forward to the services advertised. First problem, no room safe, second problem no coat hangers in wardrobe. We were welcomed and shown our room which was fabulous, and the 'butler bell' and services explained. We looked forward to our bed tea experience the following morning.                      

The bell/switch was rung and we sat in bed like lemons waiting for our tea for 20 mins, and gave up. We mentioned this to the staff and received a blank look, neither apology or explanation.

The location is fabulous overlooking the reservoir, and the food was exceptionally good.

The garden was being planted during our stay, but I can accept this due to the recent opening. I have dropped a star for lack of services and a second for the lack of either an apology or explanation regarding the lack of bed tea or room safe. Tea trails claims something special, but it made mistakes and for some reason could see fit respond to the issues when or after I raised them, that is totally unacceptable at this level.
title: Service elements missing

ownerResponse/text: Hi, I'm sorry you didn't like the vegetarian options at Tea Trails. We cater regularly for vegetarians without complaint but it was only when you arrived at the Bungalow that we became aware of your stricter Jain vegetarian preference. We had to scramble to adapt our usual vegetarian options. We have asked our sales team in future to probe further at time of booking as to any specific types of vegetarian diet. My apologies once again that we did not anticipate this issue at time of booking and hope that you will return one day. To clarify the child rate - this is for an extra bed and all meals, juices, soft drinks & snacks.
placeInfo/address: Hatton Road, Lethant 22000 Sri Lanka
roomTip: Opt for lakeview
text: Tea Trails is all about awesome location, great staff but may not be value for money, especially the options available for vegetarians and amount that they charge (e.g. USD 79 per day per child). Be aware of misspelling at time of booking when you are assured of vegetarian food but end up at a place where there are very few options.
title: Vegetarians - Be Sure Before YOu Book

ownerResponse/text:
Dear Tanagan

I am glad that you enjoyed the service, dining and location at Ceylon Tea Trails.

I sincerely apologize for the issue with brown coloured water in your bath. We experienced torrential rains, which even caused major landslides in some areas and our main water line was damaged. I am extremely sorry about the inconvenience caused, the issue has been rectified after it was brought to our attention by you.

The bungalows do indeed attempt to recreate the ambiance of a working estate bungalow. We will weed out the out of place items that have crept in. There is no excuse for the tear in the window screen and gap under the door. This will be addressed immediately.

Our apologies once again and thank you for your constructive comments.

-Ceylon Tea Trails
placeInfo/address: Hatton Road, Lethant 22000 Sri Lanka
text:
Looking for a special Sri Lankan tea plantation experience for our holiday, my girlfriend and I settled on Ceylon Tea Trails, a collection of four historic bungalows nestled in the heart of the country’s highlands. What we found was a unique accommodation experience that lived up to its reputation and superb reviews for world-class service and dining amid a splendid setting high up in the plantations. 

Many luxury hotels these days make noise about their personalised service and ‘butlers’, but Ceylon Tea Trails lives up to the marketing. We stayed in the Tientsin bungalow, and we were treated by highly attentive service from the staff who made us feel welcome and sought to respond to all of our requests. 

Even beyond the service staff on the ground, I found an impressive culture of service while dealing with reservations. I made inquiries about purchasing teas ahead of our visit and the manager I was e-mailing suggested that they could send up any teas that I want up to the bungalow all the way from Colombo should I wish. There is definitely a personalised attentiveness here and impressive desire to please. There is no question that this is top-notch, 5-star service and we had absolutely no complaints in this area. 

A special feature of Tea Trails is its focus on fine dining. Full-board meals are included in all rates and we were treated to amazing, delicious, world-class cuisine for breakfast, lunch, afternoon tea and dinner. Indeed, the biggest problem at Tea Trails is learning to say no as it is far too easy and tempting to over-indulge! The meals are mostly European/Continental, but you can also have delicious Sri Lankan cuisines as well (best daal I’ve ever had!). Seriously, we’ve never eaten as well over several days at any point in our lives. 

The bungalows are all located apart from one another and generally require a car service or a long bike ride to visit the others. Tientsin is the highest in altitude of the four, surrounded by working tea plantations. It was a special experience to stay in this historic old villa amid this beautiful location. Tientsin also includes a nice new pool (though we didn’t use as it was a bit rainy and cool during our stay). 

Activities include walking trails in the plantations, mountain biking and a complimentary tea factory tour. 

The one area which unfortunately did not live up to our expectations though was the fit and finish of the room, which was closer to rustic than luxury, as advertised on the website- it certainly was not 5-star nor in line with the high quality of the dining and the service. I understand that the management is going for the authenticity of a working plantation bungalow, but somehow I just don’t feel that they were able to capture the right balance between this and ensuring a high quality fit and finish. The screens for the windows were poorly installed and had tears, much of the furniture was not authentic to the period of the bungalow’s construction and included bric-a-brac such as an out of place shag carpet, modernist loveseat and 1970’s-era lamps. The bathroom door also had a large 2-3 inch gap at the bottom which limited the privacy of the toilet. What was especially disappointing was that for one night there was only luke warm water for the bath and for another night the bathwater came out brown (no exaggeration). We mentioned this to the staff and they tried to fix it, but it still came out slightly brown the next day. Considering how much the hotel makes of its morning bath service, It was very unfortunate that we couldn’t truly enjoy the large claw-footed bathtub and it just seemed to reflect a lack of focus on the physical quality of the room. 

All in all, we liked Tea Trails but just could not understand the divergence between the amazing service and dining and the rustic, lower quality room. If they can really nail the room by bringing it up to true 5-star standards, this could easily be a world-beating hotel property.
title: Top Notch Service, Dining and Setting at this Unique Property, Too Bad About The Room

placeInfo/address: Hatton Road, Lethant 22000 Sri Lanka
roomTip:
Avoid the Jeffrey suite in Norwood
Tate suite in Castlereagh is a good value for money
text:
We have just returned from a 5 day blissful stay at Ceylon Tea Trails. We stayed there fro 5 nights in all with 2 nights at Norwood and 3 nights at Castlereagh.

We were promptly picked up from our other Hotel in Colombo and drove through a scenic drive through the mountains to arrive just afternoon. The first big disappointment was the Jeffrey suite, which was small with a rest-room like long corridor. The room had no views with the door opening in the verandah having the views blocked by a barricade. This barricade was apparently created following feedback received from other guests of lack of privacy due to constant movement of staff carrying foods and drinks to the new restaurant.  Whilst the barricade has cut down the disturbance it makes the room look dull and boring. This was the only bad side of staying at Norwood. The best part was the sumptuous food served by the executive chef who was attentive and paid a lot of attention to detail to serve food that hit all the right notes on our pallet. The staff at Norwood were always proactive to all our needs before we had to ask. This set up very high expectations for the remainder of our stay at the other Bungalow. The views from Norwood give you a 360 degree view of the mountains and the Tea estates. We are aware that Norwood is undergoing a renovation this week to fix few of the issues that were noted with regards to the lack of views from Jeffrey room and the suggestion would be to avoid this room till it gets fixed. 

We moved to Castlereigh on the 3rd night and checked into the Tate Suite which had excellent lake views. But unfortunately that is where the good things at Castlereagh ended. The high expectations on service we had noted at Norwood was totally missing. The Chef at Castlereagh is under confident.  Second serving requested of any curry or dish would result in either  the gravy becoming too watery or too much salt being added. The staff at Norwood would ensure we would be served with accompaniments for the meals however at Castlereigh we would only get what we ordered. The chef did improve towards the end of the trip with a good Sphagetti. The presence of the hotel assistant manager seemed to have pushed the staff to perform better on the last night. The property has an excellent pool with scenic views.

We also used their guide services for the Adam's peak hike. The pick-up vehicle sent was an older model van with a poor aircon and bad shocks which made our hour long drive to the mountain a bumpy and uncomfortable experience. Our guide Vasan was a gem of a person, totally hands on and professional. He went out of the way to assist us during the difficult climb up the mountain. We would advise against doing this hike unless the purpose of your stay is not relaxation. Utter waste of time.

We did a 2 hour Tea Experience tour with their onsite planter Andrew. It was fun to understand the processes involved in Tea making and tasting, however the tour was a too long and should have ideally included a walk through a tea plantation with the plucker's rather than 2 hours within the noisy factory. Again the vehicle given for the drive to the tea experience was an older model van. Please ensure you ask for a proper new vehicle to avoid the uncomfortable journey.

The massage service at Tea Trails are expensive and average at best. Wouldn't recommend. 

To sum it up, despite a few hiccups we would definitely recommend Tea Trails for the breath taking views and some amazing food from the executive chef at Norwood+. A few blemishes else I would gladly rate in 5 star.
title: Pride and Prejudice

ownerResponse/text: Thank you for your candid feedback on Tientsin Bungalow at Tea Trails. Of the four bungalows at Tea Trails, this is located nearest to a temple. We had previously spoken to the trustees of the temple and they agreed to co-operate with us by reducing the sound level during their festive days. But in March, the month when the Hindu workers on tea estates have their annual pooja (worship), there was a new priest at the Temple who was pandering to the local community and had increased the sound levels, which caught us by surprise. We have spoken again to the Temple and are confident that they will not disturb the peace again. We will be working closer with the Temple ahead of festivities to ensure minimal disturbance. I apologize that your stay at Tea Trails was disturbed and thank you for your comment that everything else was perfect.
placeInfo/address: Hatton Road, Lethant 22000 Sri Lanka
roomTip: Try to avoid hindu festival times !
text:
We stayed at Tientsin for 2 nights in March, so I will only speak about that place, as “Tea Trails” does not exists but is in fact 4 independent bungalows situated quite far away from each other, especially if you are staying in Tientsin.
The look and feel of the bungalow was ideal. The views of the surrounding area was superb, with tea plantations stretching for miles over the mountains and hillsides.
The food was excellent, the all-inclusive really all-inclusive and the level of customer service exceptional. Everything was perfect in every way except for one issue. 
The bungalow sits right above a small village and right below a hindu temple. From morning to evening the temple would blare music that could be heard even from the inside of our room. The village was also noisy, but not on such a regular basis. Still there was some moments when one could enjoy a stereo effect of hindu music…so much for peace of mind.
The owner of Tea trails answered to a similar post about noise in December that “We attempted to tone down the sound but the results were limited”. I believe that the gentleman has been much influenced by British understatement culture, as I cannot imagine that there has been any perceivable result. In the same answer he also said that “Tientsin is usually tranquil”, which I have difficulties to evaluate, as someone had this problem in December and we in March.
So I give 3 stars for Tientsin, which is a shame. A mean between 5 stars for the bungalow and all its fantastic achievements, and one star for the aggressive, disturbing, noisy environment that will probably keep me from coming back to a place that could be top level world class.
title: Try to avoid hindu festival times

ownerResponse/text:
Thank you for your review of Ceylon Tea Trails. I apologise profusely for the unusual disturbance to the serenity of the tea country during your stay at Tientsin bungalow. Tientsin is usually tranquil, like the other bungalows, but the last year-end festival in the village was significantly louder than usual. We attempted to tone down the sound but the results were limited. We are in discussion with the authorities to control this better during future festivals.

I take this opportunity to thank you for acknowledging the commitment of our team and sincerely hope that you will have an overall positive memory of your stay with us.
placeInfo/address: Hatton Road, Lethant 22000 Sri Lanka
text:
We stayed at Tiensin for 3 nights in December over the holidays.  The look and feel of the bungalow was ideal.  The views of the surrounding area was magnificent, with tea plantations stretching for miles over the mountains and hillsides.  You can sit on the veranda and watch the ladies picking the tea.  A visit to the tea factory; a highlight of our stay to be sure.  Andrew gives a fun and informative tour and we learned much about the tea business.

We fell ill during our stay.  We felt the hotel staff's concern was genuine and they went to great lengths to make sure we had a doctor's house call and all the warm soup we needed.   In sickness and in health, the staff doted on us and made us feel very special.  Clearly management of Tea Trails sets high expectations for their staff and in our experience, the staff achieves the highest level of customer service standards.   

Everything was perfect in every way except for one issue.  I have considered omitting this comment because the bungalow is so appealing and the staff were wonderful.  However, I want to be honest in my opinion and especially due to the cost of the stay.  I wish I would have known in advance that the location is not serene. It seems it should be tranquil.  And one longs for it to be quiet, but it just is not.  The bungalow sits right above a small village.  And throughout the day and evening a speaker system would randomly blare music which echos right up into the bungalow.  Loud booms also go off every now and again, as if fireworks were being set off.  This went on each night we were there until after midnight.  I understand that the hotel as no control over the noise pollution of the surrounding area.  But the loud speakers, road traffic with horns honking, late night booming and feral dogs fighting in the night were disruptive to my enjoyment.  Tiensin's serenity, sadly, is affected greatly by the surroundings.

If I were to make the trip again, I will inquire to find out of one of the other bungalows might be more quiet.  And for this point alone, I would not make a return trip to Tiensin, which is otherwise completely lovely bungalow with it's outstanding staff.
title: Tiensin bungalow mixed experience

ownerResponse/text:
Very disappointed to read your feedback....although Tea Trails rates are higher than most properties in Sri Lanka, feedback on these pages and elsewhere acknowledges that we offer very good value and a unique product. With gourmet meals and drinks (including spirits and wines) included, I believe you would be hard pressed to find better value.

Having gone into details of your stay, I understand you were unhappy with the costs of a taxi from Tea Trails to Galle and white water rafting on your way down from Tea Trails. Both requests were made only on arrival at Tea Trails, and we helped arrange with third parties. The butler spent several hours making arrangements. We advised you against hiring a local taxi for a 6 hour drive, due to safety concerns but bowed to your insistence that it was cheaper than our usual service provider and that you were on a tight budget.

Both the white water rafting company and the taxi later complained to us that you had short paid them.

Considering our isolated location, which is a key part of Tea Trails's attraction, it is critical that travel arrangements are made in advance. If you do choose to visit us again, we are always happy to help plan your trip to and from Tea Trails so that there are no surprises.

I am sorry we did not meet your expectations.
placeInfo/address: Hatton Road, Lethant 22000 Sri Lanka
text: Not good value at all. YOu could stay in the Ritz, Savoy in a top hotel in NY, Paris, London for this price. Food very nice but certainly not appropriate for most children. Kid over 12 adult prices. Paid for 3 adults and squashed into a twin room with a lounge chair in the middle of the room.. Not easy to relax and undwind as a small place sharing a tv and lounge area. Stayed in other places similar for much better value, better food and made you feel truly at home and welcome and not that you were infringing on someones space. Will cost you more with drivers as its so isolated.
title: Extremely overpriced in all aspects. Stayed in many equally as beautiful surroundings for 1/3 of price.

text:
The suit and location were excellent, and we had high expectations for our stay. However, we were disappointed with the food, which didn’t match the luxury experience we expected.

We were hoping for dishes like steak or lamb, but the menu featured biryani, grilled fish, and vegetarian pasta, which felt out of place. Unfortunately, the taste was underwhelming, with the biryani and high-tea items and even the rice and curry needing improvement. To add this, soup served cold.

We hope the menu will be enhanced to include more premium dishes and better reflect the overall standard of the property. While the location and comfort deserve an 8/10, the food was a 2/10. That said, we’re willing to give it another try in the future and hope for an improved dining experience.
title: Great Stay but Disappointing Dining Experience

text:
The hotel in itself is very nice. The staff is overbearing which was a real pity. Once they realized we would not participate in any paying activities , they hovered around us. Normally I have no problem in tipping at the end, but when staff follows into the room when we check out definitely puts me off. Constant reminder that they are leaving and won’t see us again is more than a hint. 
The breakfast lunch and dinners are preprogrammed and most are very good. 
What really annoyed was that our driver had to wait at the gate for one hour although the staff knew we were waiting g for him.
title: Great Hotel but staff is overbearing

placeInfo/address: No. 947,Uduwela Road, Udugama West,, Kandy 20000 Sri Lanka
text:
My wife and I stayed for one night on 19th February. The 2 miles journey from Kandy is rather  slow and a bit tortuous with the poor winding road but we had an excellent welcome at the hotel. It is situated high in the hills with glorious views from the restaurant/terrace. It was lunchtime and we had a drink and an excellent lunch. After lunch we went to the pool and we’re disappointed that the sun had gone round by 4pm so we went to our excellent lovely room with a sheltered courtyard which had plenty of sun. My evening meal was very good but my wife’s was a disaster. We asked for a simple piece of fish on the basis that it should have been a safe choice . However because guests are required to pre order a few hours in advance they didn’t have available fish available to offer and insisted my wife had a steak which came massively rare. By thus time she was past eating anything so not a great evening ! This was compounded by the very limited wine choice and the Cabernet Sauvignon we ordered which was very cheap and pretty dreadful.

Breakfast was fine and I should say that the staff are excellent. However this place is overrated.
title: Overpriced and overrated but with potential

placeInfo/address: No. 947,Uduwela Road, Udugama West,, Kandy 20000 Sri Lanka
text:
A very mixed bag.

First the positives. The location is stunning about 35 minutes above Kandy with lovely views to the Knuckles and a quiet location. The bungalow is a lovely building with 9 rooms and very nicely laid out common areas. Dining is on a very nice veranda with an excellent view across the valley.

The bedroom was very large and very well appointed. A very large and comfortable bed, plenty of storage and very good aircon.

The bathroom was nicely appointed with an excellent shower, good pressure hot water and plenty of towels.

Housekeeping was excellent and the place was spotless. 

But there are problems. First we had a problem with a major flood of our bathroom on our first morning when a valve apparently failed. It was sorted out promptly while we were out but it wasn't great paddling around in litres of hot water. And no one in authority ever said sorry.

Second the food. We found it indifferent. The western breakfasts reminded us (for British readers) of Little Chef bordering on the unpleasant. Dinners were simply dull ranging across a range of cuisines.

The service was chaotic. Orders for drinks were forgotten, food took an age to arrive despite being asked to specify dinner times in advance. There seemed to be no one in charge to make sure that serving staff, some of whom were very pleasant,  were coordinated and looking after guests in a timely manner. Worryingly the one competent member of the service team was leaving.

A range of guest activities are offered. We enjoyed one excellent long hike but a booking for an afternoon/evening nature walk was simply forgotten and the alternative offered was a poor experience.

We were annoyed to be woken up one morning by another guest's child playing the grand piano in the main lounge loudly and badly at 6.30am. No action was be taken to stop this.

We stayed 4 nights. I found it very odd that I kept being asked by various members of staff on days 2 and 3 if I was leaving the next day. Surely they should have some system so that everyone knows how long guests are staying. On the receiving end it just felt a bit rude.

None of this should be difficult to fix needing some decent and visible on site management. What is deeply annoying is that this is probably the most expensive hotel in the area. They need to do much better at this price.
title: A very mixed bag

placeInfo/address: No. 947,Uduwela Road, Udugama West,, Kandy 20000 Sri Lanka
roomTip:
When taking walks alone be aware of stray dogs. They seem friendly at first but get aggressive later. 
Do take leech socks.
text:
We had such high hopes for W15 Hanthana after seeing so much of it through influencers and the marketing of the property but it honestly didn’t meet our expectations. 

Reservation - The person (think his name was Udith) who helped with the reservation was excellent and even organized our transport. He made sure we were picked and dropped on time and was extremely responsive and accommodative. He was on leave on the days we were at Hanthana but he always responded via whatsap and even took all our calls.

Once we arrived though I couldn’t help but feel things were not running smoothly. To start off with we didn’t know where to check in from. There were no staff in sight to welcome us leave alone tell us what the check in process was. Once our driver went in to inquire we were greeted by our own butler. 

We were escorted to our suite fairly quickly. The room itself was lovely and cosy. It had all the luxurious amenities and we were quite content. 

Menu - We thought the menu was quite
limited and just not exciting during our stay. While some meals were good, others were average. Not what you expect from a luxurious space like W15. Pls visit places such as Ulagalla/ Wallauwa/ Thotalagala to gauge the kind of food we expected. 
Food also took quite long. One morning we sat around waiting for more than 15 minutes for a menu to be brought (This is after informing our butler the night before our choices for breakfast) The butler was missing and so was our breakfast. None of the other staff even knew and it was all sort of an utter mess. 

Safari - This was something we really enjoyed and our guide was good and seemed quite knowledgeable. We booked the safari for 11am (again the booking was done the day before) but 10 minutes before he tells us he can’t do it at 11 as he had another group and he can only take us at 12pm. We rushed through the late breakfast we were served, planned
our day around doing the safari at 11 and were honestly quite annoyed we had to change plans. In order to not stress the staff out we complied but I did call the front office person who took our reservation and complained. 
He immediately said he would look in to it and from there onwards we were given better service. 
There were only 2 service staff members (Thusitha and Rohan) catering to all the guests and the bungalow was quite short staffed. Thusitha and Rohan however tried their best to accommodate all requests but it was not humanly possible to not fall short. We honestly felt bad for them as they were like 2 headless chickens running around. 

W15 lacked good management and quality of service. There seemed to be a huge disconnect between staff, communication and guest expectations. It’s such a pity as the location is stunning, amenities were great but it lacked good leadership.
title: Stunning location, not such a great experience.

placeInfo/address: No. 947,Uduwela Road, Udugama West,, Kandy 20000 Sri Lanka
text: Really enjoyed our hike, bike & Jeep ride with Sarath - an outstanding naturalist. The room was excellent and the property can boast some excellent views. Now for the weeds. The vegan options are thin at best (suggestion: simply add a choice of protein to each item on the meat-heavy menu). There is usually only one entree item that is close to vegan, and it was repeated on the lunch and dinner menu on one day. One of the staff members challenged us as having already had the high tea, when in fact we hadn't!!!! "That don't fly, son!" Overall, this property has great bones, but execution beats lofty ideas, and there is room for significant improvement on this issue.
title: Mixed Feelings

placeInfo/address: Goyambokka Estate., Tangalle 82200 Sri Lanka
text:
The property surroundings are really beautiful lots of trees, plants and flowers. Some monkeys in the trees and peacocks on the grass. It feels really peaceful and luxurious. 

On arrival you get welcome music and dance which was great. Check-in was fine but you immediately feel that the focus is on making more money. They try to sell you upgrades right away. The rooms are beautiful the only downside is that our room had a unpleasant smell from the high humidity. We were disappointed in the sea view it should have said restricted sea view on the website. We were on the middle floor.  Our room was cleaned daily by Prasanna who did an outstanding job. 

The breakfast was amazing. So much choice. Lots of fruit smoothies and freshly baked dosa and hoppers. The staff at breakfast were really friendly and client oriented. Special thanks to Ranil who went out of his way to make our breakfast and tea experience the best. The other food was OK. We had much better food during our time in Sri Lanka. They have lots of Asian dishes but they are quite western focus and not as authentic and/ or outspoken as we used to.  That said there was always a lot of choice and it tasted OK. 
The beach and pool are great. The sea is a quite wild in front of the hotel but if you like the sea a 2min walk to the next beach for a swim is a good option. 

We had a few room hosts during our stay in Sri Lanka and they were wonderful so we thought it would be similar in Anantara but unfortunately that was not the case. Our room host was not always professional in her answers and she was very slow to respond. Everything we asked was a NO or in some case she just gave us the wrong answer like when we booked the restaurant at 6:30 but they open at 7:00 so we went back to the room again to wait another 30min.  After a few days we did not want to contact her anymore so we just called the mainline if we needed something (much faster, more pleasant and professional). I think if we had a different room host our experience would have been much better overall.
title: Beautiful Hotel but not everything 5* service

placeInfo/address: Goyambokka Estate., Tangalle 82200 Sri Lanka
text: This is a nice property, immaculately kept, and the food was always good.  The standout excellence are the staff, who are all absolutely superb, combining professionalism, competence and friendliness.  We also received an unexpected and beautiful room upgrade on arrival, which was much appreciated. So why only three stars when many people give five?  We opted to upgrade to “all inclusive”; as even a small bottle of water was $6 ands a cocktail $20 and only buffet dining is included as standard, so this seemed to make sense.  Even though we were on their “premium all inclusive” (with negligible differences from the standard) package it was penny-pinching and filled with mind-numbing exclusions and rules.  Shortened menus, almost all drinks excluded (local spirits only allowed) and time restrictions meant the package was anything but all inclusive.  Couple that with the fact that wines available were the ones normally seen on discount in the local convenience store and not what you expect from Anantara, left a very bad impression.  In recent years we have generally used all-inclusive packages and never experienced this level of meanness.  When we complained they simply reassured us that these were the rules and that now we could include Gordons gin. Interestingly, across a six day stay, we never saw any senior management or saw any management interaction with other guests, marking the Anantara out from all other hotels at which we have stayed. A final observation – the hotel has a very “international” feel, as though one has left Sri Lanka behind at the gates, something that can be considered positive or negative depending on what one is looking for.
title: Not expected from an Anantara

roomTip: If you need to stay in touch with planet earth… don’t rely on the WiFi or internet at this hotel… it’s woeful.
text:
Firstly, no way is this hotel 5 star.
The bad:
1. WiFi and internet service is terrible. This is 2025 not 1995 !!
2. TV needs rebooting constantly.
3. Cord on hairdryer too short, so impossible to dry hair in front of a mirror.
4. “Adult pool” not really adults only. It’s just not got a lifeguard but children can still use it. 
5. Evening meals in the restaurants were OK but nothing special and very expensive.

However, the room (Ocean view) was excellent. Breakfast was the best we had in Sri Lanka. Staff were excellent too.

If the hotel fixes the minor but irritating issues and updates the WiFi and TV service, then the hotel would be well worth a 5 star rating.
title: Not 5 star but good anyway.

However, we also acknowledge your concerns and feedback on various aspects of your stay. Your observations about the design, branding decisions, and some operational aspects have been duly noted. We take such feedback seriously as it helps us continuously improve our offerings and services.
We regret any inconvenience caused by design elements in the room, such as the bathroom lighting and the absence of hand towels. Your comments on the dining experiences and cocktails are also appreciated, and we will certainly review our offerings to enhance the overall guest experience.
Regarding the pool, we understand that the experience did not align with your expectations. We strive to create a peaceful environment for all our guests, and we'll look into ways to improve this aspect.
We are pleased to hear that you enjoyed the beach, despite the rough sea conditions, and that the staff made a positive impression. Your compliments on their resilience and service will be shared with the team.
Regarding your host, we apologize for any miscommunication or inconvenience caused. We'll review our processes to ensure that future guests have a more personalized and satisfying interaction with their hosts.
Your feedback is valuable to us, and we appreciate your consideration of returning for the palms, beach, and the staff. We are committed to making improvements based on your comments to provide an even better experience for our guests.
If you have any additional comments or suggestions, please feel free to share them with us by emailing our Assistant Front office manager Sayuri via email on sayperera@anantara.com. We hope to have the opportunity to welcome you back in the future and create a more positive and memorable stay for you.
Warm regards,
Roberto Simone- General Manager
placeInfo/address: Goyambokka Estate., Tangalle 82200 Sri Lanka
roomTip:
Avoid the pool if you want peace
You can swim in the sea if you don’t go too far
text:
The location of the Anantara Peace Haven is its best asset. Its second best asset is its warm and friendly team.

Beyond this, Anantara Peace Haven is a mixed bag. There are some really nice things but there’s also some corporate brand decisions which jar, some good quality materials and construction but also some poor design. 

Anantara is the creation of Minor Hotels, a Thai-based organisation that opened its first hotel in 2001. Anantara is Sanskrit for “without end.” 

It is therefore a pretty new brand and has recently expanded into Europe with city hotels and a few resorts. 

The Peace Haven hotel was built in 2015. With Covid keeping it closed between 2020 and 2022 and the economic crisis suffered in Sri Lanka, it has therefore probably only had four proper operational years since opening, so it is also pretty new. Worth mentioning that the Amanwella down the road opened in 2005, some ten years before the Peace Haven was built.

The gardens of the hotel are lovely and extremely well maintained. Rows of naturally growing palms, green, well-watered grass, plump bushes and beautiful flowers here and there. So lovely that a multitude of birds, including crying peacocks, can be heard day and night throughout, which is one of the genuine luxuries of the place. 

It is also set far back from the road on a long private drive, unlike Amanwella, and this gives Peace Haven a wonderfully private feel. 

The hotel has rooms and villas. As I was on my own, a villa would have been silly, so I was in the main hotel block (room 431). You access the hotel block from the gardens behind it. The stairwells have a disturbing multi-storey car park feel and the lifts are absolutely awful. I took the stairs every time. 

The room I had was an Ocean View Deluxe, a corner room with a decent balcony and a view of the sea through the palms. You could hear the violent waves crash throughout the night with the doors ajar, which was wonderful. 

The bed is comfortable. The linens are fairly good quality. The furniture is relatively characterful for a large property, the best pieces being the bits of rattan here and there. The ceiling fan is a nice touch as the AC isn’t the quietest.

The bathroom has a privacy screen that rises to allow more natural light from the room into the space. However, it is impossible to have any main lights on in the bathroom without the toilet extractor fan being on as well - bad design, making for a noisy experience every time you use it, whether you are using the toilet or not. 

There are no hand towels next to the sink, which is inconvenient. 

The hairdryer cord is tightly wound and not long enough to allow you to use it easily in front of a mirror without pulling the plug from the socket. 

The restaurants in the hotel include a buffet place, Journeys (who thinks of these awful names?) which is the default for breakfast and a choice for other meals and those on all inclusive packages. Personally, I believe that any hotel offering a buffet beyond breakfast is not a genuine luxury establishment. 

The other restaurants include Verala, a pan-Asian restaurant with sushi, teppanyaki and Sri Lanka curries and Il Mare, an Italian restaurant with everything that suggests - antipasti, pasta, pizza. There’s a bar just after the lobby which is a bit of a nothing space and as it is where you do the check in process, never ever quite feels like a bar space. 

El Vino is a private dining space, which doesn’t look like it is used that much, and its name sounds like a cheap wine bar in Surbiton.

These restaurants are heavily themed and branded, much like a cruise ship, which detracts from the natural beauty you are surrounded by. 

Food quality is good at breakfast, with a large spread of European, English and Sri Lankan choices. I never had lunch at the hotel but did eat at Verala on one occasion. It was quiet as many were on the all-inclusive package at Journeys. I had some sushi, which was decent and a very messy Mud Crab curry, which was a Sri Lankan dish but not the highlight. The tinned music was a disappointment, cheap Muzak (think Chinese instrument versions of “Danny Boy”). 

Cocktails here are not very well made. They are adequate but not good enough for the $15 you pay. Ropewalk in Galle Fort is one of the top bars in Sri Lanka and their cocktails run at about $11. Mixology training is needed in many hotels in Sri Lanka, as they seem intent on putting ice cubes in a Dry Martini. 

The pool is a disaster I didn’t go near. It’s attractively placed and well designed but rammed with families so there is absolutely no peace. Instead, I opted to go for the furthest loungers on the beach, which was wonderful when you want to have a moment with a book. 

The sea is very rough and they advise not to swim in it - there’s a red flag every single day - but it’s not terrible if you time your entry and re entry properly. It’s actually very refreshing and thrilling at the same time. 

The gym is adequate but for a hotel this size, very small and I was lucky that most fellow guests wanted to lie in during the early mornings. 

The staff are wonderful. Smiling, helpful, thoughtful. They’ve been through a lot in the past four years and it doesn’t even show. Resilience is a great quality. 

Fellow guests are a mix of older couples - more the suburban crowd than metropolitans - and families with young children. There was a smattering of honeymooners too.

Would I go back? Maybe. For the palms, the beach and the staff. Wouldn’t be too excited to dine here again though.

I had a host I never saw who sent me everything by WhatsApp - daily activities, menus etc. He did manage to get ice sent to my room a couple of times so it is a useful service but he was too busy to ever meet me so I’m not sure what the point of him was.
title: A beautiful natural space polluted by poor branding

text: Underluxury. Wrong address for looking for luxury. Another disappointing member of Anantara family. Apart from brilliant location, quite good spa, quite efficient buttler and sincerely hard trying (but seriously undertrained) staff it is a underluxury for not that cheap rates. Cheap and poorly upkept throughout - from no sound insulation in the rooms to broken equipment in the gym, poor (to say the least) internet - the list can be endless - one can feel this hotel has little to claim its 5* status (and definitely it is way below comparable properties in Asia). It seriously downgraded Sri Lanka’s claim as a luxury/quality seaside destination in my eyes.
title: Underluxury

text:
This was our fifth visit to Anantara 'Peace Haven' for 17 nights at over $8000

The location and nature is very special indeed, based around a perfectly formed beach.
The long standing waiters and  pool area and Beach staff are beyond excellent 
and nothing is a problem, chef Singh, Suresh, Ranil and Gresham to name just a few!
From the first night we had requested the noisy generator of the villa be turned off during the evening period for a peaceful sleep. this simple request was clearly an issue for the 4 different butlers over the 2.5 week period - via WhatsApp and was not carried out efficiently despite many repeated requests! and having managers asking on a daily basis if our stay was comfortable ?
We have just returned to find a email on 1st March from the resort manager - based in Maldives, to say that due to this complaint we are to be 'blacklisted' and no longer welcome at the hotel, to say that we are shocked at the conduct and insensitivity of their actions would be understated !
 we are hugely offended by this and clearly would choose never to revisit or direct family and friend here as we have done over the past seven years.

best wishes to all the Anantara staff that do a great job, and big thank you NP
title: With Regret

roomTip: Unless you very fit and strong swimmer avoid the ocean. Restaurant and Spa prices very high, you get so much better outside.
text: I have to start by saying that I base this review on our experiences and that could well be very different for someone else. Overall it just did not work out for us as planned and if we had to do it again will probably choose another area and hotel. But first have to highlight the many positives the hotel offer. The grounds and rooms are fantastic and we had an amazing sea view. Most facilities are well maintained and great and offer something for everyone. The staff we encountered are great, and would like to mention Sayuri that really tried to make our stay as comfortable as possible. We mostly used room service (will get to food experience later) and food quality was good. Now for some items that made it an average stay for us : On night one we had a very bad experience at Verala restaurant and whilst it is in a beautiful setting, the incident put us off. The Chef did apologise next day and we excepted but could not go back. It is also very expensive in relation to what other hotels, area and country offer and we found for example that $20 for a breakfast box per person if you go on a trip, or $40 for the buffet per person fairly expensive. You can get 8 to 10 pizzas for the same price. The pool was busy, screaming kids and kids naked or in nappy in the pool.  Nothing the staff can do but very inconsiderate guests. The sea is rough, very rough and be careful. My wife and I (our own stupidity) went into the sea and was knocked over by waves when we were ankle deep and pulled back by the very strong streams, we not the best shape or swimmers but believe if a guest did not help us it could have been worst. The lifeguard did unfortunately not see the incident but helped us when we got back with some ice and cream etc. The hotel offered medical services but we did not think anything required and did not want to take anything at that stage but when we got home my wife went for X-rays and actually fractured her arm. As I said this is not the resort’s fault but it did put a massive damper on our experience.  This is the first time we used the Anantara Group and we believe based on our own experience it is not for us. Overall a beautiful resort and great staff, but overpriced and we expected a more exclusive, adult like experience and maybe some warnings at the beach. From other reviews and people at the resort it is evident that there is a market out there that really enjoy this type venue… just make sure it is for you and you will have a great time. If in doubt, you may walk away wondering if you could have done better.
title: Was maybe just not for us

text:
The Good 
- [ ] Grounds of the hotel - visually very nice and well maintained, lovely views and nature all around you
- [ ] Pool area / Loungers were good
- [ ] Italian and Asian restaurant great service and good food (what you expect from a 5 star hotel)
- [ ] Yoga in the morning 
- [ ] Gym well equipped and well supervised
- [ ] Spa facilities good and great selection of treatments 
The bad 
- [ ] Breakfast- slow with tea and coffee regardless if busy or not, drinks often came after we finished food
- [ ] The buffet area did not enforce the required dress code so quite often people were walking around in tracksuits whilst their children were screaming and running around. Not what you expect for being in a 5 star resort. Whilst I appreciate the resort can’t control children however putting some family time slots would help resolve this and actually make it more enjoyable for guests without children- in the end we were advised to come down to breakfast at 7am to avoid the onslaught of chaos
- [ ] The buffet food itself started of great but as the hotel became busier the quality of food become less 
- [ ] Poolside lunch area; food very good but service was more often than not painfully slow and on most occasions they ended up serving me with the wrong drink
- [ ] The lobby / bar area: went for drinks several times and can honestly say only on one occasion were the drinks served effectively and timely. On another evening waited over 1 hour, as no staff could be found and the resort quite. Also there is no atmosphere here, some light background music on a evening would help
- [ ] General comment about the waiting staff in these areas- every bill comes with a service charge (which I have no problem in paying) however the service you receive is not 5 star more 3/4 and it seems unless you tip on top of this your lucky to get the basic service and acknowledgment. I understand the hotel have a lot of new staff however they need better training to begin with. I did check that the staff do receive the service charge from the bills and they confirmed they did- so I question just how badly are the hotel paying them to begin with?
- [ ] Little to no entertainment on the night however when it comes to their own staff party music blaring out across the resort and strobe lights to go with it 
- [ ] Cleaning of the room: typically still not done by lunchtime and whilst a basic clean round was done there was no nice finishing touches i,e decoration on the bed etc. On the occasions we did leave money out for the cleaner, the room was cleaned to a slightly higher standard but again not what you expect from a 5 star resort 
Quick wins 
- [ ] There is a lovely bar next to the Asian restaurant overlooking the beach - open it during the day to serve lunch and drinks 
- [ ] More restaurants onsite otherwise if your here for any length of time it is inevitable you end up in the dreaded buffet 
- [ ] Decide whether you market the resort as a family or adults only resort as the the moment it doesn’t work having both - if a more family vibe then put on some entertainment which will hopefully reduce the number of screaming children about the place in evenings - also have a family pool area ( there is enough space )
title: Over priced and not 5 star

text:
For a hotel that is pretty much on the beach there is a lot of industrial noise - from gardeners strimming lawns or blowing leaves to service buildings chuntering away, air-conditioners switched on by cleaning staff and left running unnecessarily throughout the day and staff driving around the grounds in tuk-tuks and forcing pedestrians off the narrow footpaths. All of this - for me - detracted from the wonderful bird calls and encounters with peacocks, langurs, monitors, hares, sunbirds and egrets. 
My biggest criticism though was how difficult it was to find vegetarian food, or Sri Lankan dishes. The buffet was an array of flesh and very few vegetables. When we asked about vegetarian options they managed to produce a few next day, but I feel strongly that this should have been provided as a matter of course.
title: Stunning location but not as eco as it claims - not great for vegetarians

It’s was a okay sort of an experience, expected a 5 star experience but it didn’t live up to it. Suppose the promotional rates has it showing on the buffet spread though the restaurant staff tried to provide my table with some complementary dishes but I expected a different league of Anantara.

text:
Pro's - Well maintained property with a nice landscape & view of the beach. When you are at the property, the staff are super attentive & will go out of their way to make sure that you have a memorable stay! All COVID protocols in place as well.

Con's - We had requested for a drivers accommodation to be sorted out by the hotel itself as due to COVID, the hotel cannot staff the drivers. (This was requested 
  via phone call & email with all 3 meals & A/C for a friend of ours who was also our driver).However the spot arranged had been a very dingy spot that was not humanly possible to stay at. As guests we knew we had to incur the cost for the drivers accommodation. It was quite inconvenient as the driver had to drive up to the hotel to collect his food pack for the 3 meals. There was no prior briefing for the drivers saying about the timings for the food collection, our driver had arrived at 8.30AM to collect his breakfast pack but turned back saying breakfast was over & that he should have come by 7AM. Would appreciate a bit of humanity when treating our drivers as well. If you are planning to head their with your driver, please make sure clear instructions are given & that the hotel looks into it.

Room for improvement - The buffet spread for dinner was quite disappointing but however breakfast was quite satisfactory.
title: Our Stay at Peace Haven, Tangalle
