placeInfo/address: Goyambokka Estate., Tangalle 82200 Sri Lanka
text:
The staff and service here, as well as the villas, are superb.  That said, it is a large chain hotel geared to providing meals, facilities, etc., to numerous guests at a time.
The coffee shop/buffet restaurant is satisfactory, but quite busy, since many guests opt for the half-board basis.  We did have one very good meal from the ala carte menu.  We found one of the other restaurants, Il Mare, to be overpriced and understaffed, resulting in waiters rushing to and fro, and a red snapper filet which can best be described as mediocre.
The villa rooms are lovely and spacious, each with its own pool, and given the restaurant quality, we opted for room service on more than one occasion.
Having stayed at both the Anantara Peace Haven and the Anantara Kalutara in Sri Lanka, our preference is definitely Kalutara for its more personal service and better food quality and ambience in its restaurants.
Our thanks to our villa staff for providing wonderful service and help throughout our stay.
Room Tip:  Book a villa.
NB
title: Excellent Staff and Service for Large Chain Hotel, Restaurants Need Improvement

ownerResponse/text:
Dear Ztrel0cK,

Thank you so much for taking the time to visit us recently and for writing such a positive review of your experience.    

We are all happy to read that you enjoyed the superb location that we are blessed with, amazing array of wildlife, spacious and comfortable rooms, good quality of evening buffet, and overall you enjoyed your holiday. However, please accept my apologies that your stay was clearly not flawless and that there were many small issues that lead to disappointment. The idea of having a Resort Host is so that guests have a one-stop point of contact that they can simply send a whatsapp to make requests such as preferred timing for room cleaning, dietary preferences, if they would like any information or a private tour, restaurant bookings, tour bookings, or if they have any concerns that they would like to share with the management so that we can help rectify them. This generally works very well and makes communication easy and convenient. All our facilities, restaurants, activities, and general resort info is highlighted in our Newsletter which is on the writing table in every room, the resort compendium, the guest key card packet, our website, resort TV, and on multiple standing posters displayed all throughout the resort. We also have dedicated Concierge, 24 hour reception, and Resort Host service should our guests have any enquires or be looking for inspiration on what to do during their time with us. We are all disappointed to learn that you both did not depart truly happy and I am sorry that we let you down. If your travels do bring you back to the South Coast, then please let us know, as we would love to have you back again so that we can ensure that your next experience is perfect.   

With warm regards,    

Ross Sanders  
General Manager 
rsanders@anantara.com
placeInfo/address: Goyambokka Estate., Tangalle 82200 Sri Lanka
text:
We have just returned from a 12 nights stay (a couple with a 3.5y.o.) and have very mixed feeling about the Hotel.
On a good note:
The location is just superb. Great scenery, nice landscape, totally amazing wild life that always keeps you entertained. The rooms are quite specious and well planned (although the finishing is below the other Anantara properties we have stayed). Very decent buffet in the main restaurant for dinner,
On a not so good note:
The food: the selection for breakfast never changes (ok, I've noticed 2 times of ham rotating, that's it) with the fruits selection being extremely basic (to say the least). The selection for lunch on the set menu (if you go HB or FB) in the Italian restaurant is just a disaster - only one non-vegeterian main dish is really sad (how often can you have a carbonara for lunch?) To add to this, most of the times few dishes where not available, and while I can understand the lack of Tuna, but not having mozzarella for all this time is surprising. The service is incredibly slow and not really friendly (which doesn't match at all with the restaurants' ambitions). The fusion restaurant is slightly better but one would expect something more impressive at this price point (and not to mess up with the number of ppl that reserved the table). The pool-side bar has a decent menu (comparing to others) but not having an AC at lunch time is close to unbearable this time of the year. Ah, and the prices for food/drinks in the menu are as if you are visiting a 2* Micheline restaurant in Provance...
The service:
I guess this was the biggest disappointment of the stay. We have arrived late at night and while our reservation clearly stated 3 ppl there was no extra bed available in the room - so after the flight and the 4h drive we had to stay up an extra hour till 4am until it was sorted. 
Having the host idea is splendid, yet it would be great to train them first. I have never seen my host in all my stay - only used whatsApp and frankly I have managed to solve most of my needs quicker by walking down to the reception. So this didn't really add-up to the experience.
While the hotel area is great, we have never had an overview of what's there around (or where we can dine) - we had to find it all by ourselves, mostly looking at reviews and instagram (that's how we found out about the nice farm animals area and the fusion restaurant). Just accidentally we've found out that they serve a great tea in the lobby terrace and only at the last 2 days we've found that they serve shisha there as well - both only when we asked for this. No one ever approached us while we where sitting there offering a menu etc. There is a guided tour talking about animals/plants every morning at 9:30am but you've got to have great luck finding about it (we just bumped into the group) and surviving the heat - we gave up in 15 minutes (so did many others). It most definitely has to be an early morning/late afternoon adventure.
The room service was totally dependant on luck - one shift was superb and extra-attentive, the other was average to say the least. I wonder how often/careful they wash the floors as the feet would suggest something close to "very rare". I get it that the hotel was at 100% occupancy but not having room service until 3-4pm is extremely disappointing (one needs towel at least when he gets back from the pool).
Facilities: I would like to understand what audience is the hotel targeting at - for the kids there is absolutely nothing to do. The kids club is very basic and the only staff there is not really trained. The pool would be OK but there isn't even a lifeguard there and the rules of the pool forbid inflatable devices and "playing" in the pool. The beach is not children friendly at all (if you were planning to buy the any children toys/diapers or whatever else in the hotel - don't, there is nothing).
At the same time, the situation for adults is even worse as the "adults" pool is occupied by children and, again, there is nothing else to do (apart from few yoga/fitness classes), specially in the evenings.
One of the most annoying things - the club-cars/tuk-tuk's in the hotel area. One can't enjoy a nice walk from the lobby to the beach without being asked to move out at least 3-4 times. Each time. And if you have a stroller - well you either move to the grass or feel the pressure from the drivers to speed up. Why can't they use dedicated routes or just make the pathways wider?

All and all, we managed to have a good holiday - but because of the nature itself and outside tours rather then the hotel. A lot of issues are definitely below the standard of a reputable 5* hotel, specially with such a brand.
title: Great location and wiled life, not so great the rest

placeInfo/address: Coconut Board Road, Kalkudah 30410 Sri Lanka
roomTip: Don't get ripped off with room minibar. Get your own drinks and snacks outside and put them in the room fridge if you can.
text:
Our stay at Uga Bay was unfortunately marred by a significant payment issue. We were charged twice, which not only took funds away that could have been used during our holiday but also required us to spend a considerable amount of time proving that the payments were taken from our account. This resulted in us spending time on the phone and messaging the hotel, which was not the best start to our stay. This experience was a source of great disappointment and affected our mood, lingering throughout our stay at Uga Bay.

Despite these issues, the overall experience was pleasant, with a clean environment and beautiful surroundings. The hotel is fantastic, situated right on a private beach with a large pool and beautiful ocean views. We felt very secure with guards at all entry points, including the beach. The room, located on the first floor with a sea view, was clean and comfortable. Breakfast was a la carte, which felt limited, but the waiter, Munas, ensured we were satisfied, offering additional options. Although the lunch and dinner menu was limited, the staff was attentive and accommodating. However, prices in the restaurant and minibar were quite high, with the minibar prices being particularly excessive (i.e. a small beer can $6 + 10% service + VAT, or cioccolate bar $10+...). Overall, a good stay with room for improvement in the pricing and payment process.
title: Not sure I would recommend it

placeInfo/address: Coconut Board Road, Kalkudah 30410 Sri Lanka
roomTip: Buffet
text:
Having visited several resorts in Pasikudah, including Malu Malu, Amaya Beach, Anantaya, Clam, and Amethyst, I was eager to experience Uga Bay Resort. However, my stay left me somewhat disappointed compared to other options in terms of value for money.

On the positive side, the beachfront location of Uga Bay Resort is excellent, providing picturesque views and a serene atmosphere. The overall ambiance of the resort is pleasant, contributing to a relaxing stay.

Unfortunately, the main letdown was the buffet and food offerings. Compared to other resorts in the area, the quality, variety, and taste of the buffet fell short of expectations. There was a lack of options for children, and the restaurant staff seemed indifferent to addressing this issue. Even the Sri Lankan cuisine lacked authenticity and flavor, leaving much to be desired.

Despite these shortcomings, other amenities at Uga Bay Resort were satisfactory. However, the overall experience was overshadowed by the subpar dining experience.

In conclusion, while Uga Bay Resort boasts excellent beachfront location and satisfactory amenities, the disappointing buffet offerings detract from its overall appeal. Potential guests should consider alternative options in the area for a more satisfying culinary experience.
title: Mixed Experiences at Uga Bay

placeInfo/address: Coconut Board Road, Kalkudah 30410 Sri Lanka
text:
I really wanted to be able to review this hotel much higher but I’m going to be honest. I’ve struggled to give this a 3* , only based on location can I offer this. 

We had come from Uga Jungle which is simply amazing so my expectations were the same and we were excited for this stay. However it’s not what it seems. 

On the eye it is beautiful, the beach is lovely! 

Pros
Beach, rooms you must request at the front of beach, swimming pool

That’s where it ends! 

Cons
Staff service poor, this isn’t their fault , there is a poor communication between the management and staff. Only one staff member impressed- Robinson! 
Food - simply awful. It’s a buffet , very poor choice, uncooked food served to us at beach bar and no quality. We are big foodies and considering how good Uga Jungle is I was shocked. 

Let me take you through.
Check in - messy & confusing 
Rooms - lovely we were allocated 46 & 44. Luggage came quickly. We had a plate of fruit delivered, only to be followed by a request for Trip Advisor review - I absolutely hate this kind of direct request. We were told that we had a special dining that night - we turned up for dinner and nothing , in fact it was all messy. No drinks poured for us, no explanation on dining or menu offered. Food was cold and tasteless. We are in Sri Lanka after all and expecting spice and flavour. I had pre booked spa before we arrived, I kept receiving mixed calls to the room from reception regarding this. 
Breakfast again very bland and absolutely no atmosphere in restaurant. 
Beach bar menu is ok and we managed to pay for lunch. But unfortunately we received uncooked food. 
I did at this point have a conversation with one of the managers and highlighted our concerns & experience. They agreed to arrange a beach dinner for us. The chef was going to create a special menu for us. 
We were looking forward to this. Despite taking any dietary requirements at check in these were ignored by the chef - this was particularly important as one member of my family is pregnant. The setting was nice but the food was not. Nothing local or special, warmed up pasta, meat that was not edible and very basic. A complete let down.

We went to bed early and the next day I made the decision to check us out early and head to our next hotel in Kandy.

I expressed my concerns to the general manager and other management, however they didn’t like to accept this. 

I feel the hotel is trying to cater for international guests and getting it so wrong. I have my own travel business and I honestly couldn’t send any guests here. They tried to say we were treated like vip and that wasn’t what I wanted , I want to enjoy an experience that I can be sure my clients would receive. 

In closing this is the most expensive hotel in the area and simply not worth it. I wouldn’t return and won’t be recommending.
title: Poor service and terrible food

placeInfo/address: Coconut Board Road, Kalkudah 30410 Sri Lanka
text: The Christmas Gala dinner was unexpectedly horrible. During the booking the hotel promised for a buffet Gala dinner; however, all of a sudden they changed to a  set menu which shows their lack of consideration towards the guests. The turkey meat in the main course wasn’t fresh which thereby led to a terrible taste. This obviously ruined our appetites and expectations about the Gala. Furthermore, the cheese platter that followed afterwards was unfortunately tasteless. Most of the cheese had a bland, disgusting flavour to it which was quite unpleasant with the combination of the soggy crackers. In other words this dinner was a disappointment. But, the DJ was pretty good and the servers did try their best, and though it was unsuccessful it was appreciated.
title: Uga Bay X-Mas Gala Dinner & Hotel Stay

placeInfo/address: Coconut Board Road, Kalkudah 30410 Sri Lanka
text:
The location and beach was beautiful. The service was hood on the whole and the food was awful. I did not like my room location and they kindly accommodated by moving me one room over for a slightly better view. 
The massage ladies were exceptional, and extremely kind, as was a waiter in the bar area. The service in dinning room was good, everyone was doing their best. The manager was kind and stood by his staff regarding my missing money. After mentioning how bad the food was,  the management did do a lovely gesture of a special meal on the beach, which was delicious and sincerely appreciated. The rooms are fine and the property is well maintained.  The chairs on the barely there patio were not comfortable for reading or sitting. 
I stayed at 4 properties this company owns. This one was fine for the money, but the food could of been better. However, it may just be me and the buffet was better than I am giving it credit for. 
I had a nice time and the beach was lovely. I think the rooms should have activities listed like snorkeling etc but shampoo etc is all provided. All in all a good time was had.  Also, the Uga office did upgrade my meal plan at my next property stay and provided me dinner as well… an exceptional gesture that did not go unnoticed. 

Linda 
Texas, USA
title: Could of been better but enjoyed my stay

placeInfo/address: Coconut Board Road, Kalkudah 30410 Sri Lanka
text:
We stayed here for 6 nights from the 20th October. The entrance to the hotel was really breathtaking drawing your eyes from the pool directly to the golden sandy beaches. The lady manager at jungle beach, Trincomalee where we were coming from had already mentioned to the management of Uga Bay that we were arriving and hence was met by Roshan the manager at Uga Bay. It is worth paying a bit extra to get the first floor ocean view rooms and Roshan gave us the best sea view rooms (front left side with closest beach access). We could see the ocean from the balcony and also had a great view from our bathroom. The pool is very well maintained and warm (almost jacuzzi like) and the view across to the beach was great. 

Having said that, I feel that I have had to rate this as only 3 stars due to the quality of the food which was poor. We had dinner on the first 2 nights at the resort and this was substandard for a hotel of this status. The food lacked flavour and the curries were watery. We also tried the western a la carte menu which was difficult to stomach (catch of the day was particularly disappointing). The seafood and vegetables were certainly not fresh which is such a shame given the great produce available in the region (we had the sense of mass catering and food recycling). The pastries at breakfast were stale and hard, yet huge quantities were served on large trays - my advice would be quality over quantity! Same menu for breakfast, lunch and dinner is just not acceptable for a resort of this stature. They had 1 buffet breakfast which was the best they served. We were told that they don’t do the food stations as it was the off season. It is not really an excuse to serve poor food in off season - simply quantities need to be adjusted downwards. As a result, we had to unfortunately leave the hotel to have dinner outside (and many other guests did the same). We were lucky to find hotel Vasuki on trip advisor which served fresh, authentic food cooked to high standard. The quality of the food is probably the only downside to this hotel and let it down. 

We used their entertainment suit to watch the football Chelsea vs Man United game on the big screen on our first night. The games room with table tennis, carom and chess boards was well maintained and had great views of the sea. 

Staff were really friendly and made us very welcome, albeit a number were very young and felt inexperienced and not that knowledgeable about details. There were a lot of staff in the restaurant just waiting around and at loose ends - potentially overinvestment in front of house rather than the engine room of the kitchen! The beach is lovely but the service is not that well coordinated (I.e. no cold water, lack of attendants providing towels etc.). 
Overall we enjoyed the pool and the beach although the food here needs significant improvement!
title: Stunning Beach Resort but needs Improvement in the Food served

placeInfo/address: Coconut Board Road, Kalkudah 30410 Sri Lanka
roomTip: Ocean rooms upstairs -  concrete stairs poorly lit at night.  Beach rooms - small decks overlook lawns with a view of the beach.
text:
Arrival was marred by confusion with rooms  (another family seemed to be having the same problem when we checked in). Had expected rooms overlooking beach but had very mid-range upstairs rooms at opposite ends of block at the back of the resort (Ocean rooms). Rooms were swapped on second night which gave us adjoining ground floor rooms (Beach Rooms), with deck overlooking lawns and beach (middle row of blocks). Nice views but couldn't have sheer curtains open as everyone walking past would have had an equally view into our room! No idea why they have floor to ceiling windows with wooden blinds in ground floor bathrooms!? Bathrooms need some work - smelly drain in shower.
Hotel gave us a slightly later check out on one room and then kindly offered a room for us to shower and change after a last swim as we had a late flight. Disappointing that the room they use for this is so grim - it leaves you with a very poor last image of the hotel! Very basic room with barely any furniture and odd items being stored. Horrid shower room - 2* hotel standard. Surely in such a large place they could find one decent room to use or have a shower/changing room as part of the gym?
Nice staff, who try hard but need more support and training - service was very slow - drinks at main bar took forever and cocktails were not worth the wait.  
Beach bar food is good - seafood skewers delicious. Buffet dinner was better than expected and they offer Sri Lankan dishes every night alongside "Asian night", "Western food", "Italian night" etc. Restaurant area on terrace is cramped in the evenings and the breakfast (served in buffet room) is very over crowded.  Don't sit near the cooking stations on the terrace in the evening!
Beach is beautiful but too hot to sit out when we were there. Lovely beds under palm trees were great and Pool/Beach Man was very helpful. Pool is nice but only 4' deep - is this a weird regulation in SL?
title: Could do better!

ownerResponse/text:
Dear Debbie307,

Thank you for taking the time to give us your feedback, we have spoken to the GM and investigated this matter. I have since learned that upon departure a late checkout was requested and since we were running on full house we were unable to accommodate your request.  Instead of leaving our guests without accommodation for the rest of the stay, the staff kindly offered you the former resident manager’s quarters to change and relax prior to departure as a gesture of goodwill. Please note that these rooms are not sold to any guests, but was given on complimentary basis as a place to rest until  departure instead of being forced to say at the lobby as would be the norm.

Our restaurant does have an outdoor area, however as the sun is quite strong during the daytime, we arrange space outside where guests can have the Breakfast if they wish. Apart from this, we do keep some extra covers in the main bar area if preferred. All bed and breakfast basis guests are free to dine at the beach bar or choose from our a la carte menu if not satisfied with the buffet dinner provided. 

Unfortunately, as we are not an isolated property, but just one of the many hotels on the stretch, we cannot control the number of Jet ski’s or limit their operation, we can, however, assure you that boundaries are clearly demarcated so that swimmers are safe at all times.

I do hope we have shed some light on the circumstances around this complaint, I do hope you visit us again in future.
placeInfo/address: Coconut Board Road, Kalkudah 30410 Sri Lanka
text:
We didn’t really love Uga Bay
The restaurant was particularly disappointing, unattractive and offering very little outdoor space. The buffets at breakfast and dinner gave the restaurant a down market cafeteria feel.
The hotel is quite unattractive, built in grey concrete.
The jet skis could be very noisy, sometimes there were as many as 6 out at any one time.
The room we were given to change in after our sea plane was really not very nice at all
The staff were obliging, even if the service was slow.
We would not return or recommend the hotel 
In our view Uga Bay is an average 4* hotel not 5*
title: An average 4*

ownerResponse/text:
Dear Guest,

Thank you for choosing to dine with us during your stay at our neighbouring hotel. we are happy to hear that you enjoyed the beer and snacks at our Beach Bar. Regret to learn that the bottle of wine was not to your liking. We would have gladly offered you a different wine if you had mentioned your displeasure at the time of presenting the wine for tasting prior to purchase.  Since you proceeded to purchase the entire bottle and consume it during your meal we presumed it was to your liking. Both the wine and the sea food special are very popular items on our menu and we regret it was not to your preference. 

Thank you
placeInfo/address: Coconut Board Road, Kalkudah 30410 Sri Lanka
text: Staying at an adjacent Hotel, we decided to come over for lunch. The beer was well chilled and some of the snack were excellent. The sea food special which includes fish, a few prawns and half a tired lobster together with a indifferent bottle of white wine well on its way to becoming vinegar, was best forgotten.
title: The restaurant by the beach was disappointing

ownerResponse/text:
Dear Malith, 

We are glad to hear that you enjoyed the service, Pool, Bar, cocktails and the beautiful beach at Uga Bay. In regard to your feedback on the buffet, we make sure to incorporate different themes each night at our buffet so that guests enjoy an array of cuisines during their stay. We do offer sea food items everyday on our ala cart menu with our catch of the day  as well as  many other seafood and meat items for you to choose from. 

Thank you for taking the time to give us your feedback, we hope to welcome you again to Uga Bay in the near future.
placeInfo/address: Coconut Board Road, Kalkudah 30410 Sri Lanka
text: Place is wonderful and the staff is so helpful and willing to serve guests at any moment. Pasikuda beach is nice on season. there for go there only @ the season. unless is will be a useless. nice pool , pool bar quite good. cocktails are awesome unless they do not use blender :P .  as  a drawback : Please use fruit juice for make cocktails. less meat & sea food items on buffet.  they said seafood night on Thursday. excuse me? do you want me to go back home and come on next Thursday ?  we came to a bay and they say no seafood ! grow up Uga Bay
title: Nice gateway for a couple

ownerResponse/text:
Dear Georgie,

Thank you very much for choosing Uga Bay,  and for taking the time to share your experience with us.

Our aim is to provide all our guests exceptional service and a memorable experience, and I regret to hear that this was not the case during your stay. 

Maintenance and cleanliness of our guest rooms a priority to us and we are in the process of refurbishing each room with modern fixtures and amenities..

Complimentary late checkouts are subject to availability, and we had back to back bookings on the day of your departure. However as we wished to accommodate this request, we attempted to reallocate some rooms and offer  an complimentary 1.5 hour extension and any additional hours would be at a small charge as per the norm and industry standard when faced with high occupancy. 

Please be rest assured that your comments have been addressed with the team and we shall work harder to ensure the comfort and convenience of all our guests
placeInfo/address: Coconut Board Road, Kalkudah 30410 Sri Lanka
title: Resort

placeInfo/address: Coconut Board Road, Kalkudah 30410 Sri Lanka
text:
Staying at another hotel close-by we went to Uga Bay hotel a couple of times to have lunch at the beach bar or a la carte dinner at the restaurant. The hotel and beach have nice and clean facilities, everything well maintained. Quality of the food and drinks is very good, although pricey and unlike other hotels around Uga states the net price in the menu and 29% service charge and taxes still apply. So don’t be fooled when comparing. One star deduction for that. 
What falls short of our expectations and experience at the restaurant is the service at the beachfront bar. The team seems very disorganized and it takes a long time until orders are taken and delivered. The kitchen calls several times for ready meals to be collected, but the food is getting cold before it’s finally served. This needs to be improved! Another star deducted.
title: Rating for the F&B offer only

placeInfo/address: Coconut Board Road, Kalkudah 30410 Sri Lanka
text: I just went to the beach bar.The cocktails were good.The lay out of the hotel is very good.The architectural design is very good.The beach bar service is  poor.The reception was very good by the management staff.
title: Beach Bar

placeInfo/address: Coconut Board Road, Kalkudah 30410 Sri Lanka
roomTip: Get a room as near to the beach as possible so you might have a chance of a good view of the sea.
text:
This hotel is, as other people say, very stunning to look at - the grounds and beach really are beautiful and the staff were really lovely, super helpful and very attentive. However, I thought the was food terrible, certainly not that of a 5 star hotel, and the cleanliness and general state of the room was also lacking and not of a five star standard. Also, despite their claim that you get "unparalleled" views of the ocean from all rooms you most certainly do not - we could not even see the sea from the first room they put us in. The management tell me they are having their literature re-printed to remove this claim - hopefully their website will also reflect the changes.
Evenings are somewhat boring as there is not really anything to do and, other than the bar off the reception area, there is nowhere to go within the hotel either.
title: Too much about the view

ownerResponse/text:
Dear Guest,

Thank you for staying at Uga Bay and taking your time off to review us. 

We regret to hear that you did not entirely enjoy your time at the resort. While many of our guests are very pleased with the service we offer though out their stay we understand you did not share a similar experience. Your concerns on the service levels at the beach bar and spa has been discussed with the team and necessary action has been taken as we continuously concentrate on improving our standards.

While we wish you had a pleasant stay at our resort, we hope you will find an opportunity to stay with us again.

Regards,

Ramli Ghaffoor
Director/CEO
placeInfo/address: Coconut Board Road, Kalkudah 30410 Sri Lanka
roomTip: Check air conditioner, ask if the room has a view
text: This is a hard one to review.  But it lies somewhere between 3-4 star on average.  This is because some of the staff are 5* plus.  Some are 1 star.  This is targeted at the Beach Bar staff.  Terrible attitude, gets orders wrong, bad service, drinks were inconsistent on what they actually put in them.  Very strange.  The resort is in an isolated area so if you are an active person and want to see some culture of Sri Lanka this isn't for you. There are some bikes to borrow however I had to try 4 before one was ride-able.  This place is for R&R with some expensive eating and drinking.  The food would be between 3-4*.  They try but just don't hit it, especially because of their pricing. Rooms are 4* but do require some maintenance or ours did anyway.  We did have a view or the beach.  The beach on water is gorgeous.  They do have chairs set out on the beach however these are old and not 5*.  We didn't use them as it was way to windy.  Checkin and check out were good.  They did ask over and over again how everything was.  However if you did state there were some things which were worth addressing they then started to blame the local staff or or or.  In short don't ask if you don't want to hear and don't make excuses. Gardens were impeccable.  Had a massage and the masseuse was about the most unfriendly person there.  It was like how dare I be there.  It was suppose to be for an hour but it was 45 minutes.  She didn't smile once. Would not recommend a massage. Air conditioner in room was very loud.  Had to turn it off to sleep.  Choice of sweating or not sleeping because of the noise.  Chose the later.
title: 3-4* on average

placeInfo/address: Coconut Board Road, Kalkudah 30410 Sri Lanka
roomTip: well, not all rooms have a sea view.....
text: Visited with a bunch of friends, with a lot of booze to start with. We were there sharp at 2.00 pm, and they couldn't prepare the room until 2. 40 pm, pathetic considering the standards and the price point.Location was awesome, staff was friendly,beach was fine,rooms are specious and amenities were fine and both bars were offering great service but used local ingredients for cocktails although prices were not up to the quality of drinks, pool was fine, unfortunately the night buffet was awful felt like a 2 star hotel to start with and the breakfast buffet was mediocre and lacked options. Compared to Uga Jungle beach which offered a great Al caret menu, it felt like they were not used to catering buffets...
title: Mixed Feelings

ownerResponse/text:
Dear Guest,

Thank you for staying at Uga Bay and we are pleased to hear that you liked the ambiance of the room and the overall layout of the hotel. However we regret to hear that you were not fully satisfied with your stay. Each of our hotels are unique and offer an authentic experience of its own. Uga Bay being a modern beach hotel, is designed for a more relaxed beach experience and is less traditional compared to the other hotels in our chain. As you may have noticed Uga hotels are designed to accommodate the atmosphere, culture and architecture around it. 

The level of service extended by our staff is usually highly appreciated, while we thank you for bringing to our notice your concerns. Same has been discussed with the team at Uga Bay. 

The buffet we offered during your stay had a mix of a Sri Lankan corner as many of our guests prefer to have a local experience, and a wide spread of internationals dishes also served separately.

placeInfo/address: Coconut Board Road, Kalkudah 30410 Sri Lanka
text:
Having stayed at Ulagalla, i was so excited of my stay at Ugabay. It was a first time i traveled to Pasikuda area. Hotel looked very nice as we enter. Its quite a big property. our room was quite spacious and i like the fact there are two entrances to the room and they have kept water pots in both ends so we can wash our legs before coming to the room.
I thought there will be something special and exiting gestures like you get in Ulagalla so i was bit disappointed. its a beach hotel. Staff are nice but not really professional. they need more training. and would have been nice if they speak and understand english cause there were few misunderstandings in communication.

I didnt like the buffet. there were lot of sri lankan items in the menue even though there  are many foreign nationalities. very few international dishes. we were on Full Board so the dinning was not very exiting. 

Its a shame that they close the pool by 6.30 cause its very hot over there and would be been nice if they at least allow us to swim till 8 pm may be. maximum hight of the pool is 4ft.
title: Perhaps I had high expectations

placeInfo/address: Coconut Board Road, Kalkudah 30410 Sri Lanka
text: I have mixed feelings about Uga Bay; it's biggest problem is it's hard not to compare it to other Uga hotels. We had arrived from The Residence and Ulagalla, which are both unique and offer a lot of attention to detail to their guests. Perhaps if we came to Uga Bay first we wouldn't have had such high expectations. The hotel itself is nice and one of the nicest on this beach in our opinion, but the beach is lifeless and lacking activity. The sea is ok, but not particularly enticing. The restaurant serves good food, but the setting is uninspiring, lacks ambience and is always closed in with plastic blinds. During our stay the hotel offered no daily activity or entertainment, so unless you go on a tour there is nothing to do. The spa is also very unappealing located in a bunker under the pool. We left after 3 nights although in our package we had paid for 5.
title: Nice hotel if you need to switch off

ownerResponse/text:
Dear Guest,

Thank you for staying at Uga Bay and taking your time off to review us. 

We are very pleased to hear that overall, you are happy with your stay at our hotels and that your time at Uga Bay was a pleasant one.  
We appreciate you bringing up your concerns on the breakfast and the ambiance. Since we were running almost full house, we had buffet on both the days during your stay. The culinary experience we offer is usually highly appreciated but we understand that you did not share a similar sentiment. 

We do hope that you will find an opportunity to stay with us again in the future.

Thank you!

Regards,

Ramli Ghaffoor
Director/CEO
placeInfo/address: Coconut Board Road, Kalkudah 30410 Sri Lanka
text: While our stay was lovely, there were certain minor lapses in details that left us slightly surprised. This was more a reflection of how Uga Bay compared relative to the other Uga hotels we have stayed at and the service levels we had come to expect. Food was alright - breakfast was identical 2 days in a row (perhaps this was because we travelled in the off season!). The pool area needs a bit of maintenance and care. Overall the hotel looked/ felt a little tired.
title: Not at the level set by the other Uga hotels

placeInfo/address: 27th Kilometre Post Pulmoddai Rd, Kuchchaveli 31000 Sri Lanka
roomTip:
Wenn Sie einen Schönen Strand suchen dann sind sie hier fehl am Platz. 
Der Sand ist überwiegend Schwarz!
text:
Staff fünf Sterne
Küche fünf Sterne 
Ambiente es wurde jetzt alles weiß getüncht. ( nicht mehr so wie in der Wernung)
Uns hat das nicht gefallen. Drei Sterne.
Strand : Das Hotel ist das einzige an diesem Strandanschnitt das den Strand pflegt .Strandspaziergännge waren nicht möglich (total vermüllt)
Außerdem ist der Sand überwiegend schwarz. 
Nur einen Stern!
title: Mehr Schein als Sein

placeInfo/address: 27th Kilometre Post Pulmoddai Rd, Kuchchaveli 31000 Sri Lanka
text:
L’hotel est joli, installé dans la jungle au bord de mer.
la plage est nettoyee tous les jours donc impeccable, sur la portion de l’hotel. Mais elle n est pas blanche avec de l eau transparente comme les photos (mensongeres) du site internet le laisse imaginer. Aucun snorkling possible sur place. 
Les activités sont interessantes mais hors de prix. 
Le personnel est adorable de gentillesse mais d’une lenteur terrible. 
Les chambres : la literie est bonne mais elles sont vieillottes. l’air conditionnée vous tombe dessus ce qui est desagreable, et la salle de bain est de son coté non climatisée avec des vitres partout ce qui fait qu’il y fait 10 ou 15 degrés de plus que dans la chambre, un vrai sauna. 
Les restaurants (un a la piscine l autre a la plage) sont mauvais. Quasi aucun plats locaux, que de la tres mauvaise cuisine internationale malheureusement, à des prix dementiels. (Le petit club sandwitch est le seul plat mangeable, a 16$ hors taxes) 
Point positif : beaucoup d’oiseaux, d ecureuils geants, de molitor, etc qui donnent un peu d interet au lieu.
Au global, le probleme de cet hotel vient de son positionnement prix : totalement deconnecté de la realité et la qualité des prestations. C’en est vraiment choquant. 
A eviter, d autant qu il est tres excentré.
title: Tres mauvais rapport qualite prix

placeInfo/address: 27th Kilometre Post Pulmoddai Rd, Kuchchaveli 31000 Sri Lanka
text: The beach itself is beautiful and it felt like being in paradise. I highly recommend the mango juice! However, it felt too remote to explore the main parts of Trincomalee - which is fine if you just want beach time and no culture. The service in the restaurant is awfully slow considering how much you are paying and how much staff is visible. We would not stay here in the future.
title: Stunning beach and that's it!

placeInfo/address: 27th Kilometre Post Pulmoddai Rd, Kuchchaveli 31000 Sri Lanka
roomTip: Bring flip flops …. The sand will burn your feet!
text:
We were sold this lovely place based not only on the location - which is stunning, but also on the activities which were available! 
We had pre booked a catamaran trip which was great but we were promised that the hotel could arranging diving, jet skiing, kite making, Sri Lankan cookery course / demo… NONE of that was available. We asked three times. There were not even masks and snorkels or boogie boards to borrow. 
The food was good? But a bit bland. The people were nice but just seemed bored. 
Also the drinks were an outrageous price! It was costing us - a family of 3, over £100 per day on cokes, smoothies and 2 G&Ts
title: Over priced drinks and not a lot to do if you don’t want to over eat and fry yourself on the beach.

ownerResponse/text:
Dear Mr. Hiran,

Thank you for taking the time to share your experience at Uga Jungle Beach. We appreciate your feedback and would like to address your concerns.

We understand the importance of providing efficient and comfortable dining options to our guests, and we apologize for any inconvenience caused by the limited seating capacity during peak times. Rest assured, we are currently taking measures to provide alternative dining space options to ensure all our guests have a comfortable and enjoyable dining experience.

As a tropical destination, the weather in our region is generally hot and humid. We have designed our dining spaces to allow for optimal air circulation and to seamlessly blend with our natural surroundings. However, we apologize for any discomfort caused by the temperature and appreciate your understanding.

We strive to ensure the comfort and satisfaction of our guests, and our team is always available to address any concerns or issues you may encounter during your stay. We encourage our guests to reach out to our front office or F&B Manager for any assistance required.

We are delighted to hear that you enjoyed our hotel garden and appreciate your positive feedback. However, we regret that our culinary offering did not meet your expectations. We are committed to continuously improving our standards and will take your feedback into consideration to enhance our dining experience.

Thank you for choosing Uga Jungle Beach, and we hope to have the opportunity to welcome you back for a more enjoyable stay.

Ramli Ghaffoor
Director | CEO
Uga Escapes Management Limited
placeInfo/address: 27th Kilometre Post Pulmoddai Rd, Kuchchaveli 31000 Sri Lanka
text:
There should be more space allocated to the restaurant and the tables need to be expanded since there is very little space for 4 member family to have a relaxed dinner. And the restaurant set up was not child friendly. (There were very steep areas without any protection)

Not enough feeding chairs for children.

Main pool needs to be more cleaned and attractive where the pool base and surroundings seems to have a mud patches all the way.

Rooms floor was slippery (My eldest has slipped 3 times during our stay)

The food is average, and waiters are very friendly and caring.

The hotel garden is brilliantly designed with an ample touch of nature. the beach area was superb and it was the best beach experience i ever had.
title: Superb Beach Experience

ownerResponse/text:
Thank you for taking the time to share your experience with us. We aim to provide all our guests with exceptional service and a memorable stay, and your constructive feedback allows us to accomplish the same.

We sincerely apologize for the lapse in service. From the feedback we generally receive from our guests, our associates are known to be attentive and efficient. Rest assured that we will take this matter seriously and improve our service levels. 

Thank you for contributing to keeping our beach clean. We have recently received our new stock of glass water bottles, and these are now in service. As we aim to impact the environment positively, we will limit and, where possible, discontinue single-use plastic. 

Once again, thank you for your valuable comments, and we look forward to welcoming you again!
placeInfo/address: 27th Kilometre Post Pulmoddai Rd, Kuchchaveli 31000 Sri Lanka
text: Depending on what your reason for being in Trico is, this resort is about 30 minutes north of town. The accommodations are nice, beach beautiful and deserted, however, the service was severely lacking.  The food was good, tuna salad and grill seafood however, it would often take in excess of 20 minutes to even get water much less a cocktail or juice.  At one point I ordered a margarita and it took 35 minutes for them to tell me it wasn’t available. I asked to relook at the drink menu and never received it so …. Maybe if you are on full board, it is better. We only did bed and breakfast. Breakfast was great with lots of options.  We stuck to basic options (scrambled eggs) given all the other food issues we had.  Additionally, they ask you to help pick up trash on the beach as you walk, which I happily did, however, then they only give you plastic water bottles which, to me, defeats the purpose. With a few adjustments, this could be a good place to stay.
title: Nice place to stay, service needs to improve

ownerResponse/text:
Dear Chathini,

thank you for your kind comments, and we are so happy to hear that you enjoyed your stay at Ulagalla. please accept our apologies as the hotel was at Full capacity during your visit, we usually do not offer buffets as a meal option, but due to our occupancy level and personal request of the majority of the inhouse guests, we overlooked our usual practice. however, please do let us know your preference if you do choose to visit us again and we will make sure you receive a carefully curated meal similar to that experienced at Ulagalla. 

yet again, thank you for your patronage and i do hope we see you again at Uga Escapes in future
placeInfo/address: 27th Kilometre Post Pulmoddai Rd, Kuchchaveli 31000 Sri Lanka
text:
check in - It was really easy. We were so tired after a long trip, and the check in was really quick. But they didn't brief us about the facilities, the tours or whatever the extra things that we could have done in the hotel. 

Room - Spacious and properly organized. but not luxurious like Ulagalla. And the personal touch is missing. There were no coffee in the room, so I had to ask some coffee for the room (not Nescafe). 

Food - Their cocktails are superb, but not the buffet. I had to ask the staff to refill some dishes. 
Hotel was pretty crowded, so that must be reason. We don't really like the big buffets. And the space was not enough for dining. Once we got a table in a corner, had to bend and go there every time. 

Service - Again, I am sorry to compare Jungle beach with Ulagalla. But there is a huge gap between Ulgalla and Jungle Beach. 
So as a conclusion we were not happy there.
title: They can improve - I would give 3 stars out of 5

placeInfo/address: 27th Kilometre Post Pulmoddai Rd, Kuchchaveli 31000 Sri Lanka
text:
As a single this is not the type of holiday I usually take but circumstances had me book several nights holiday in beach accommodation in Eastern Sri Lanka for a wedding. 

After the atrocities experienced in Sri Lanka at Easter I was unsure what travelling around would be like. Im happy to report that apart from increased security checks including Police checkpoints stopping vehicles especially at night, it was very relaxed. It was also very quiet with very few tourists.

Firstly please learn from my mistake and either take a car and driver if you have plenty of time or, fly Cinnamon Air to access Trincomalee (and the Jungle Beach resort). The overnight train from Colombo is only for those sound sleepers with the good luck to only encounter healthy travellers...if you catch my drift!

Accommodation at the JBR is great! Large rooms with high ceilings (c/w ceiling fans) and a/c, big comfy bed, private veranda under a small shade cloth, large bathroom and best of all, a private outdoor shower!! 

The beach was about 50m from the resort restaurant and my room and the water was calm and refreshing. Coming from the Middle East I really appreciated the increase in humidity and temperatures in the high 20s/low 30s. June is a great time to visit the East Coast as it’s the dry season, while at the same time it’s the wet season on the West Coast. 

I had included my food restrictions when I booked however these had not obviously been passed on to the kitchen. That said the chef did a great job making sure I had gluten free bread and personally checked my every food order to ensure I didn’t get anything that would cause me problems. 

Food wise I would say that if I was doing the same trip again I’d bring some Gf/df snacks with me. The only snacks the resort offered that I could eat were peanuts roasted in palm oil...which I left untouched for ethical reasons. 

I tried the Spa which was nice enough although rather expensive (Dubai prices) for what was provided. However, when I came to check-out the resort had given a USD100 spa voucher (unbeknown to me up to that point) to everyone booking beachside accommodation. It would have been nice to have known that prior to booking the treatment. Also, the spa experience would be greatly enhanced by mood lighting, some incense and the offer of a healthy tea and snack afterwards. 

Staff at JBR deserve a mention. They were lovely. Note to those training staff, one person asking if a guest’s meal is good is welcome; three, especially one after the other, is a little much!

Overall, the resort is rather let down by the lack of maintenance around the property. Guests being charged resort prices in USD don’t really want to see thatching that needs patching, holes in bed covers, light fixtures with wires hanging out. It’s a pretty easy thing to get right - and make the right impression on guests. 

As I’m someone who likes to do stuff on holiday I would have appreciated some sunrise yoga sessions or kayaks to paddle around the bay...just an idea for the future. 

Be aware if you are coeliac that here in Sri Lanka they sell a ‘cider’, that is actually beer mixed with apple juice...
title: Relaxing beach holiday c/w gf/df options

placeInfo/address: 27th Kilometre Post Pulmoddai Rd, Kuchchaveli 31000 Sri Lanka
text:
I’m sad to say that we didn’t love Jungle beach. The location is fairly remote so you have limited/ no options once you arrive there, you’re kind of stuck. The beach is nice but the plastic pollution  either side is utterly depressing. The pool area is disappointing (tiny for the number of cabins and rarely gets the sun) if you want to sunbathe the beach is your only option. There is another pool which is shown in the pictures on the website but seems shut off from the public (which I found misleading). We started off in a lagoon cabin which was thoroughly disappointing. It was damp and in desperate need of a refurb (evidence of roof leaks in bathroom). The are also two storey so if you are downstairs all you can hear is people banging around upstairs mixed with the noise of the road out front. We upgraded to a beach cabin which was a much better experience. 

Meal times are totally chaotic, no front of house, staff seemingly without a set routine. You can easily wait 20 minutes for your drink order to be taken and the next course and the next. That being sad, as with anywhere in Sri Lanka the staff are absolutely charming and polite, they just need some management to help them coordinate better. For a chain of hotels you would think they could manage this. The food is delicious. Absolute highlights were the tempura prawns (enormous) at the beach bar (which was under construction - another slight annoyance which had been temporarily put together out of some corrugated iron which my husband and no doubt countless others had cut themselves on which waiting). The other disappointment was the relative lack of seafood options given that the resort is on the sea and right by a big fish market in Trincomalee. The food and drink is also unbelievably overpriced. The taxes are not included in the price so everything is +27%. Also check your bill because the restaurant chaos invariably spills into the bill side of things. 

Unfortunately I wish we had swerved this part of our trip and spent longer in the beautiful interior.
title: Disappointing

placeInfo/address: 27th Kilometre Post Pulmoddai Rd, Kuchchaveli 31000 Sri Lanka
text:
We stayed in Jungle Cabin and had a huuuuge bed and outdoor shower. 

Gorgeous beach and swimming pool (for when it's too hot for the beach). 

Basic air-con gym was good. 

Nice stay overall, but food was a bit unimaginable and service slow (even for a pre-cooked breakfast).
title: Nice pool and beach, slow service.

placeInfo/address: 27th Kilometre Post Pulmoddai Rd, Kuchchaveli 31000 Sri Lanka
text:
As others have mentioned, this hotel is fabulously laid out and sits back from its own beach. We stayed in a beach chalet with a private pathway to the beach. 

So it should have been 5-star bliss

But it’s not. Again, as others have said, the service at times was painfully slow. Yes, friendly enough, but does it really have to take 25 minutes to prepare two fruit juices? Food service as well was too slow for comfort. On barbecue evening, the meal “started” at 7pm, but food wasn’t available until after 8pm!

If only the service matched possibilities, this would be an easy 5 star review. 

Oh, and they double booked our spa treatment, and were resistant to a sensible compensation. Also missed the 15% discount on our third massage. And no Ayurvedic spa treatments - in Sri Lanka?? Very disappointing

Such a pity
title: So good, and yet ....

ownerResponse/text:
Dear Chris_Sin_Ch,

Thank you very much for your feedback. 

We are pleased to note that your overall experience was enjoyable and you liked the resort and its setting. 
Your constructive feedback is appreciated and areas highlight would be looked into so we continue to improve on our standards and services. We are sorry for the inconvenience caused due delayed service and we do regret this very much. 

Once again, thank you for taking time to provide us feedback and we sincerely hope we would have an opportunity to serve you better in the near future and look forward to welcoming you back.
placeInfo/address: 27th Kilometre Post Pulmoddai Rd, Kuchchaveli 31000 Sri Lanka
text:
This hotel is nice, peaceful, the setting in the jungle is very pleasant. But is doesn‘t compare to other Uga hotels in terms of service and standard.

Service is very friendly, but at times very very slow, especially at  the restaurants. There is no service at the beach, although you can order at the beach bar and they will bring you your food and drinks. The jetski was not working for the entire 3-day stay and no one seemed to bother to try to repair it. The wifi was not working for part of the stay and when it was, it was extremely slow. The flip-flops in the room had footmarks from previous use, and some towels had holes. These are all details, but show a lack of care. This was confirmed by the fact that no one bothered to ask how our stay was upon departure.

A security issue is the fact that there is a life guard at the beach, however instead of acting as a life guard, he has several other jobs, including handing out towels and taking care of deck chairs, and often disappears for longer periods of time, likely taking care of some other jobs. One can only hope that no accidents ever happen.

I would like to commend the staff at the beach restaurant though. One night, my fish was not good (which they could not help). I was immediately offered a different fish, which was excellent. The next night I ordered a steak medium done, which came to the table blue. Again, I was immediately offered a new steak and a free desert, along with an apology and a friendly smile. I really appreciated that service, because I felt the manager of the restaurant cared a great deal about his guests.
title: Nice - but not a 5-star hotel

placeInfo/address: 27th Kilometre Post Pulmoddai Rd, Kuchchaveli 31000 Sri Lanka
text:
It’s an absolutely beautiful location set in the east coast of SRI Lanka - untapped, unpolluted and serene. 

Jungle beach is set up quite great, removed from the town and true to its name, nearly all jungle - with a bit of wild too! 
The service by the staff was pretty great- check in was a breeze and the staff is resourceful and incredibly nice - that’s something I’ve noticed about people on the east and the north. 

The negatives of the place is that the rooms and amenities, despite being expensive, are very basic . The shampoo and other items in the bathroom were labeled by hand (??!!) , the A/C kept turning on and off and made a terrible noice, the breakfast menu could be better - atleast alternating on days - cos it’s all the same everyday . 

Overall, I suppose I would still go back just for what the place is - but they’d need to refurbish the place just to make sure it’s comfortable enough
title: Mixed Feelings about the place

ownerResponse/text:
Dear Mr. Stewart, 

Thank you for taking the time to give us  detailed feedback on your stay and brining your concerns to our attention. 

As a resort based in the jungle, we are subject to insects however, we have a pest control program in place and will increase our efforts to control this issue as much as we can. We do offer insect repellents at public areas in the form of a spray as candles are not suitable in open areas due to the large fans and winds. Our humble apologies for the delays in service, our unique breakfast concept takes approximately 60 – 70 minutes to complete, I can assure you the delay was not an attempt on our part to secure beverage sales, but a lack of efficiency and I will personally take this up with the team. In regard to your feedback on our sunbeds, unfortunately the 68 beds are on first come first serve basis we can assure availability if they are vacated during the day. 

Thank you again for bringing these points to our attention, we hope to welcome you again to an Uga Property in the near future
placeInfo/address: 27th Kilometre Post Pulmoddai Rd, Kuchchaveli 31000 Sri Lanka
text:
We arrived here on Friday 8th June after touring some of the usual places and came here to do nothing.
Being well traveled we do have high expectations  and always end our holiday with a 5/6 day beach stop.
On arrival I wasn't really impressed and just coming from Uga ullagalla which was 5 stars I was hoping for the same here seeing they are part of the same chain.

Room- decent Aircon, no Aircon in bathroom which is strange as you have a shower then are sweating straight away afterwards. WiFi is ok in room but patchy at best around resort.
The cleaners don't shut the doors properly so have found alot of bugs in room.
The outside space is in the shade so you cannot sunbathe if you chose to do so.
If you order room service they take a long time to pick plates back up.

Restaurant- sit on the far right hand side away from the pool and ponds as that side is full of flies and mosquitos landing on your table/food.
Do not sit in the drop down part in middle of restaurant this is full of flies.
Service is so slow breakfast and dinner can take 2 hours and is really dragged out trying to make you order more drinks maybe?
If you want to upgrade to a la carter from half board with a set boring menu you have to pay full price rather than the difference in the cost which is what I was expecting.
Half board menu is very limited and if you don't like sea food can be even worse.
No insect repellent candles etc which would make sitting here and eating a bit more comfortable.

Pool- 
Didn't bother using as is covered in shade full of mosquitos

Beach side bar - Had couple meals here, check your bill before you sign as drinks were on there that we never had.
Food was ok just took a long time to come.
Needs some sort of insect repellent here also.

Beach- There is rubbish on the beach not loads but if you walk past the boat area you see quite a bit of rubbish.

Don't leave your sun bed!
Don't leave your sun bed! 

We went to our room to avoid the midday sun for one hour and our towels had been removed so we have to go to the far side of the beach. The only reason for this i think is there are not enough sun beds for how many rooms they have here!
There isn't a proper waiter service on beach either which is standard in any 5 star resort I've visited.

Staff seem friendly enough I just don't think the management or the owners perhaps know what is expected especially from a place that is expensive. 
Abroad you expect to be mugged off a little perhaps but for what the staff get paid to what we pay to come here it doesn't make me want to recommend to anyone.

With a bit of a re- shuffle this could be 5 star stay but a long way off that mark at present.
title: Average

placeInfo/address: 27th Kilometre Post Pulmoddai Rd, Kuchchaveli 31000 Sri Lanka
text: A typical beach hotel without anything special. The Beach Chalets are somber inside with the exception of the bathrooms which are luminous (outdoor shower). The food is good and the staff is friendly. The cocktails were good one night and not the next. All in all this hotel is way overpriced and not worth going out of your way. This is not an environmental friendly hotel.
title: Please clean the beach! Too much garbage all along the beach.

placeInfo/address: 27th Kilometre Post Pulmoddai Rd, Kuchchaveli 31000 Sri Lanka
text:
This hotel is extremely expensive for what they offer.
We stayed in one of the villas with a “private pool” (top category). The small private pool is shared in between 3 villas and there’s no security so other guests use it as well.
Food is good but very expensive.
The beach is dirty, full of plastic bottles, light bulbs, syringes, dead animals and other rubbish that is dumped from vessels offshore.
If you are looking to relax or for a beach holiday, I would recommend you to go south to Galle or Bentota. Don’t waste your time travelling to Trincomalee.
The Spa is very simple but the 2 Balinese masseurs are very good. Those 2 ladies are real professional masseurs.
title: Overpriced and disappointing

placeInfo/address: 27th Kilometre Post Pulmoddai Rd, Kuchchaveli 31000 Sri Lanka
text:
We stayed here having been seduced by the amazing website which it promises everything it delivers to be fair. Perhaps one of the top of the range places to stay around these parts, great little gym, rooms by lagoon spacious and very conscientious staff. 

I found the food disappointing with very few healthy alternatives to fried dishes, the drinks and food top prices also. 

Please ask for no straws with your drink unless
You really need ine. They put straws in all the drinks and the beach is full of them. 

A tour to pigeon island that was cancelled due to the weather was expensive and we found a much more enjoyable cheaper option away from this hotel.

No yoga.
No boutique
And the spa seemed soulless so we didn't bother.

To be fair we are out of season somaybe this is the case. Weather and staff are very good, and they are all a bit too eager to please, so perhaps if you go in a busier time you won't have them following you around.

This place lacked character for me, and the staff overly attentive which made me feel uneasy most of the time.

Amazing pool lagoon style and if you like all the services and being waited on hand and foot this is your place.

If you prefer more soul go somewhere else we really liked Amanta less than 4 Km6 away.
title: Wasn't our thing yet super place otherwise

placeInfo/address: 27th Kilometre Post Pulmoddai Rd, Kuchchaveli 31000 Sri Lanka
roomTip: One where the air conditioner doesn't blow on your head at night
text: The price and reviews says it is a great resort. We have been to far better. The service in the restaurant is very good but overall, not great service. There were small bugs in the bed at night which they sorted out mainly one night but still some were there in the morning. The rooms are reasonable however they are aged and need refurbishing. The air conditioning system was so poorly placed that it was hard to adjust so that it was not blowing much on your head at night. The beach area is reasonable but would go to Nilavelli or Upavelli instead.
title: Disappointing

placeInfo/address: 27th Kilometre Post Pulmoddai Rd, Kuchchaveli 31000 Sri Lanka
roomTip: Check the photos!
text: To be honest I did not bother to look on trip advisor before we came out here. We let "dial a flight" organise our honeymoon, we helped chose what we wanted to see on our Sri Lanka tour and had a fantastic driver/tour guide  from "walkers tours" and had a crazy busy 5 day tour and the hotels they had picked were all off the beaten track and really nice and quiet. The last two Cinnamon Citadel and cibnamon Lodge were more "resort" with swimming pools and big restaurants but we didn't have time to relax by the pools there and even wondered "why would you come here and sit by pool when there is so much to see and you could be any where by the pool?" We were really looking forward to our Luxury Beach end of honeymoon relaxation but before heading home and straight back to work after waiting 9months due to work commitments for our honeymoon. I was expecting another middle of nowhere hotel but sadly it is right on the main road, granted all the rooms/apartments are in the forests but sat by the pool could hear constant traffic and building works. The pool itself is not warm sunny and clear blue like the ones you imagine and the ones we had seen at the other hotels, it's green, cool and sheltered by trees. I was longing to sit in the pool with a drink from the bar and enjoy the sun but I haven't wanted to as it's not warm as sheltered by trees not relaxing or quiet. Tomorrow we will try the beach. It's lovely and windy so was hoping the "beach adventure/activities" would allow me to sail or windsurf but they have one jet ski (another noose!) and some masks and guns for snorkelling. Maybe we will go for a scuba expedition. The beach has a bar/BBQ restaurant which is £50 per person, we will wait and see if it looks like a feast to be worth it as we have half board and This is not included and we are yet to have a meal. The room looks big and spacious but the "balcony" is a concrete plinth with a wooden table and chair that has a jungle/bush view. Would be nice to sit in sun but that would be upgrade to beach hut apartment maybe. I WILL relax on my honeymoon after my rant! Just not what i had been looking forward to sadly.
title: Not what I expected

ownerResponse/text:
Dear Guest,

Thank you for your stay at Jungle Beach and taking time off to review. We are happy to hear that you were satisfied with the ambiance of the hotel, the setup of the Villa,  the fine culinary experience offered and the staffs’ service level. 

However, it is unfortunate that you did experience some flies at the bar. This is very seasonal. Although we have an in-house resident pest controller, at times due to the seasonality there can be a very rare occurrence. 

Our transport rates to Trincomalee is very much inline with the industry standards for the service we offer which also includes a tax component. Also please be assured that service charges and government taxes are based on the standard rate of 23.04% and not 46%. 

Your comments on the music and the breakfast service is well noted and same has been communicated to the resort.

We thank you once again for your feedback and we do hope that you will find an opportunity to stay with us again in the future.

Regards,

Ramli Ghaffoor
Director/CEO
placeInfo/address: 27th Kilometre Post Pulmoddai Rd, Kuchchaveli 31000 Sri Lanka
text:
Don't get me wrong this is a lovely hotel, amazing beach, great food, lovely setting for all villas, great wildlife, but we found the hotel didn't really have much substance to it, something missing, Je ne sais quoi 

So onto...

Positives:- 
1. Lovely beach, amazing beach, with snorkelling available and a jet ski, secure as well, no hawkers.
2. Villas are all lovely, well presented and aircon is good. Nice bathrooms. 
3. Lovely pool by the bar 
4. Good gym for Sri Lanka 
5. Lovely staff, well mannered and helpful 
6. Food was nice, a bit fancy for Sri Lanka and I get what they were trying to do, but a deconstructed tuna salad... In Sri Lanka? It's fine if the menu actually tells you what it is properly and how small it is and you'll be starving in an hour! Curries were nice and we had room service and it was good. 

Negatives:-
1. The flies at the bar area, now I know it's the "jungle" but having just come from a villa complex of 8 in the real jungle with all sorts of living things, there were no blue bottle flies, which means the tables in the bar area weren't clean ( I'm sure the manager will dispute this) but all they need is to turn on all the fans and put some candles out all day, you just couldn't sit at the bar. 
2. The service, lacked consistency, especially at breakfast. The menu was good, but at breakfast you were given everything on a tray, all I wanted was muesli and coffee and that took an age, at one point my omelette came before the dry muesli. It seems if you go off the "tray" service the waiters go into meltdown. The dinner service was the same, and lunch, I had a tuna salad, which doesn't mention its raw and asked for it to be pan fried, dear god, you would think I had asked them to go out and catch the tuna? 20 mins later it arrives back. 
3. £55 dollars to the airport in their hotel car? What? My fault I should have planned ahead and kept our driver for another two days but really £55 in Sri Lanka is a fortune.
4. Service Charge and VAT or hotel charge, equates to 23% so when I ordered a prawn cocktail and a tuna salad, they came on a separate bill while the water was separate too, so I paid 46% service charge or hotel charge! Then we had three bottles of water later on the beach, another service charge although I took them back to my lounger. What! 
5. Place is in the middle of nowhere so if you want snacks or water you have to buy it from hotel, and again the service charge looms! 
6. The new beach bar had banging loud techno music at lunchtime, the demographic for this hotel is mid 30's not 18 year olds in Ibiza. Also, on the beach no one comes near you to ask if you want water or anything. Although, 7 people asked me if I wanted dinner at the beachbar, how strange! 

I repeat that this is a lovely hotel, but they will loose business if they keep thinking, their so high end that it doesn't matter how you treat customers or how deep their pockets have to be. This is a great place for honeymooners, and anniversary, if you were a big family it could get expensive.
title: Form over Substance

placeInfo/address: Wildlife Tourism Zone, Palatupana, Yala National Park 82600 Sri Lanka
text:
J’ai séjourné deux nuits dans cet hôtel et je souhaite partager une expérience nuancée.

Les points positifs :
Le personnel est un vrai atout : serviable, souriant et très professionnel. Les huts sont magnifiques, spacieuses et impeccablement propres. La piscine est superbe et très agréable. La restauration est correcte, bien que j’aurais apprécié davantage de spécialités sri-lankaises à la carte. Mention spéciale au guide et au chauffeur, très compétents et attentifs.

Les points négatifs :
L’emplacement est extrêmement isolé : comptez environ cinq heures de route depuis Colombo ou Kandy. La plage, bien que proche, est non baignable et potentiellement dangereuse. Il n’y a rien à faire aux alentours, et l’unique raison de venir ici est l’espoir d’apercevoir un léopard. Malheureusement, si ce n’est pas le cas (comme pour moi), l’intérêt du séjour devient très limité.

J’ai participé au safari à 6h du matin. Après trois heures, je n’ai aperçu que quelques oiseaux, un crocodile, trois éléphants, des buffles domestiques… et des dizaines de 4x4. Beaucoup de bruit, peu de faune sauvage visible – l’effet d’un tourisme de masse ? Aucun léopard, pas d’ours. J’ai d’ailleurs vu bien plus d’animaux en dehors du parc, sur les routes environnantes.

En résumé :
Le site ne justifie ni l’isolement ni le prix, que je trouve excessif, voire indécent, au vu de l’expérience globale. Il serait plus juste d’en demander deux à trois fois moins. Sans la garantie (impossible, évidemment) d’observer un léopard, le séjour perd tout son attrait.
title: Un séjour contrasté : entre confort et déception

placeInfo/address: Wildlife Tourism Zone, Palatupana, Yala National Park 82600 Sri Lanka
text:
Stayed for 2 nights and went on 2 safari drives. We came here largely for the safari experience - particularly to see leopards and also elephants, sloth bears, mongoose, etc in their natural environment. We have done a couple of safaris in South Africa and Botswana, and hoped this would be similar in terms of animal spotting. Unfortunately, for us, the whole experience didn’t live up to what we hoped. The safari vehicles are limited to driving on roads (unlike other parts of the world where they can go off-road) that hundreds of other jeeps/trucks of tourists were on, leading to lots of dust and few animal sightings (other than the water buffalo, peacocks and birds that are all over). Our guide explained that the animals go inside the bush away from the cars/roads (understandably). We had planned to do a 3rd safari drive, but after the first two, we cancelled the 3rd.  Of course, the hotel can’t control the crowds or ensure we saw a leopard, but having come here for the animal experience, we were disappointed with the experience. In hindsight, this was an expensive and time consuming (3 days/2 nights) part of our trip for a safari experience that for us was underwhelming. 

The hotel itself was nice, but lacked some special touches to make it truly exceptional/5 star. For example, cold towels would be a nice gesture to offer guests when they return from game drives - it’s dusty and hot out there and would be nice so we could clean our hands. The restaurant needed better ventilation/a/c - though there are a few wall a/c units and some fans, it still was very hot during lunch. Also, some fans seemed to be broken as when we asked if they could be sped up, the staff said they could not. Food itself was fine.  One time we also found that the bathrooms by the restaurant were both out of soap even though it was just 10am.  We asked the front desk for soap, but he said it would “take some time” so we instead walked back to our huts to wash our hands before returning to our breakfast. 

Staff is kind and friendly.
title: A bit of a let down

ownerResponse/text:

We are pleased to hear that you enjoyed our spectacular location, breathtaking ocean views, and the hard work of our dedicated and professional team. It's wonderful to know that you found joy in the beautiful beach dinner arrangements and the expertise of our safari rangers.

At Uga Chena Huts we recognize the importance of providing an experience that aligns with our guests’ expectations.
