CEO | Director
Uga
placeInfo/address: Wildlife Tourism Zone, Palatupana, Yala National Park 82600 Sri Lanka
text:
After over 40 years of traveling, from ultra-luxurious five-star hotels to charming two-star surprises, we embarked on a three-week journey through Sri Lanka, staying at some of the country’s best properties. Wild Coast Tented Lodge? Outstanding. Eraeliya Weligama? Outstanding. Ceylon Tea Trails? Fantastic. Then came UGA Chena Huts—an experience so underwhelming it left us wondering how on earth this place maintains its high rating.

This is not a five-star resort. It is, at best, a three-star establishment charging luxury prices while coasting on its location and reputation. The owners have clearly decided that “good enough” is the standard, rather than investing in what could be a truly exceptional experience.

THE POSITIVES:

✔️ Spectacular location with breathtaking views over the Indian Ocean.

✔️ Kind and professional staff—they are trying their best despite what they have to work with.

✔️ Food is decent—not exceptional, but not terrible either.

✔️ Nice sundowner setting—a moment of peace before the reality of the resort kicks back in.

✔️ Beautiful beach dinner arrangements—a rare highlight.

✔️ Decent open-air bar area—nothing special, but at least functional AND OPEN …

✔️ Excellent safari rangers—if only the resort matched their level of professionalism.

THE NEGATIVES:

1. DATED, DATED, DATED.

The entire property screams neglect. This isn’t “rustic luxury” or “understated charm”—it’s just old, tired, and uninspired.

2. The Huts? Large but Utterly Soulless.

Yes, they are spacious. But space means nothing when it’s filled with boring, outdated furniture and zero atmosphere. Staying here feels more like being in a forgotten timeshare unit than a luxury retreat.

3. The Plunge Pools? A Complete Joke.

I cannot stress this enough—the so-called private plunge pools are an atrocity. Small, cheap plastic tubs, with tiny, worn-down decks that wouldn’t even be acceptable in a low-budget roadside motel. How anyone thought this was an acceptable feature for a luxury resort is beyond comprehension.

4. The Main Pool? An Absolute Misery.

Instead of using the stunning ocean views to create an infinity pool masterpiece, they’ve hidden it in the bushes. No atmosphere, no view—just an uninspired, lifeless pool area that feels like an afterthought.

5. No Proper Pool Bar – Just a Slow, Overworked Server on a Bicycle.

Want a drink by the pool? Be prepared to wait an eternity. There’s no real bar—just a lone staff member who has to bike over to fetch your order. If you’re lucky, you’ll get a beer or soda. If you want anything more complex—good luck.

6. The Dining Room? A Glass Prison.

Whoever designed the main restaurant must have hated nature, because instead of making the most of the setting, they shoved it inside a glass aquarium with AC. You can technically dine outside, but space is ridiculously limited. It’s a total mystery why a resort that markets itself as an “immersive nature retreat” has such an unwelcoming, uninspired dining experience.

7. The Food? Decent, but Laughably Boring.

For a so-called high-end resort, the lack of imagination in the menu is astonishing. And the ultimate insult? The ice cream selection: Vanilla and Chocolate. That’s it. In a country famous for tropical fruits, that’s all they could come up with?

FINAL VERDICT: A LUXURY RESORT IN NAME ONLY

Would UGA Chena Huts ever be a real five-star resort? Yes—IF the owners actually invested in it.

• The dining area? Rip out that dreadful glass box and open it up to the surroundings.

• The main pool? Move it, make it an infinity pool with ocean views, and give it a proper bar. Surround the bar and the “ new Dining area “ with an infinity pool ! Just copy what they have masterfully done elsewhere - like The Wild Coast Tented lodge 5 minutes away.

• The huts? Renovate them with actual luxury in mind, instead of letting them rot in outdated mediocrity.

• The plunge pools? Tear them out and build something worthy of the price you are  charging.

Right now, this place is a a bit of a joke. Upscale travelers aren’t stupid—they know when they’re being overcharged for mediocrity. If you want to throw your money at a subpar three-star resort disguised as a five-star experience, be my guest. But if you’re looking for true luxury, look elsewhere.
title: 5 Star Price Tag for a 3 Star resort - issues that could so easily be fixed with money and more imagination.

placeInfo/address: Wildlife Tourism Zone, Palatupana, Yala National Park 82600 Sri Lanka
text:
My husband and I decided to celebrate my 50th birthday at this luxury resort, hoping for an unforgettable experience. Unfortunately, the reality fell short of our expectations, especially considering the exorbitant price tag attached. For the same price, we could have enjoyed five days at equally stunning hotels across Sri Lanka.
From the start, things were off to a rocky start. Arriving at the resort was complicated, and surprisingly, there was no provision for a transfer to the hotel. We had to request one upon our return, which added unnecessary hassle to our trip. In a luxury establishment, such basic conveniences should be anticipated, not merely accommodated upon request.
As for the birthday celebration, the only acknowledgment we received was a predictable cake with a candle. While a nice gesture, it hardly lived up to the expectation of making the day truly special. We expected more thoughtful gestures and personalized attention given the occasion.
The food at the resort was decent, albeit limited to a fixed menu rather than à la carte options. Breakfast was the highlight, offering a variety of delicious options. However, the lack of flexibility in dining choices was disappointing for a luxury establishment.
We opted to go on a morning safari from 6 to 9 a.m., expecting an immersive wildlife experience. However, the three-hour duration felt excessive, especially when the animal sightings were sparse. Additionally, the safari vehicle provided was not up to the standards one would expect from a luxury hotel, and the snack provided was underwhelming.
Even the minibar in our room failed to meet expectations for the price paid. The overall demeanor of the staff seemed forced and inconsistent, lacking the genuine warmth and attentiveness one would expect from a luxury resort.
In summary, while the resort offers some amenities and comforts, it ultimately fails to justify the steep price tag. The lack of attention to detail, underwhelming experiences, and inconsistent service make it difficult to recommend this resort to discerning travelers seeking true luxury and value for their money.
title: The overall experience doesn’t justify the price

ownerResponse/text:
Dear Aneta, 

Thank you for choosing to stay with us.  I am glad to hear that you enjoyed your villa and the private pool, and I hope I can clarify a few concerns you had during your stay. 

As an all-inclusive resort, we offer all meals within the resort restaurant and the menu is changed daily. We do regret if the day’s option was not to your liking, had this been brought to our attention our chef would have been more than glad to assist in preparing a dish of your preference.. 

Safety of our guests is an utmost priority and we do have a strike policy on discouraging guest to swim in the ocean as this part of the sea is not swimmable due to the heavy currents. Venturing along the beach is also dangerous as it frequented by Elephants and other wild animals. 

We assure you are rangers are well trained, experienced and passionate, they would in no way act in a manner that would be inappropriate causing harm to the wildlife and the surroundings and do take alternate routes whenever possible in order to avoid overcrowded areas of the park. 

We thank you for your patronage, we look forward to welcoming you back to Chena Huts when you do return to Sri Lanka.
placeInfo/address: Wildlife Tourism Zone, Palatupana, Yala National Park 82600 Sri Lanka
text:
Resort itself is located on the oceanfront, short drive away from the Yala park entrance, so the location is good but it is disappointing and overpriced for what it is.

Rooms are spacious, nicely decorated and come with cosy outdoor private pools but..

Food is average and meagre (as it is an all inclusive resort you have no other choice but to dine in the hotel), it is forbidden to swim in the sea as it is too dangerous (heads up - this is not mentioned on Uga's website), there were local men playing cricket just outside of our hut (so much for the security and the privacy of the resort), private road leading to the resort (according to Uga's website: "specially built") is in terrible state (any car that is not 4 x 4 will struggle) and finally the biggest disappointment (and the main reason why we booked this place) was the complimentary safari.

Park itself is beautiful but we were bitterly disappointed with Uga's and park's rangers. During our safari visit we saw one poor elephant on the road surrounded by dozen of trucks so tourists could take a photo of it. Despite having two rangers just in our track, the driver would still pass the elephant several times and the hotel's ranger would laugh when the elephant got irritated with our and other trucks passing. It was very sad to see that drivers nor rangers cared about the wellbeing of the elephant. Also Yala park doesn't regulate how many tracks can enter the park and to add insult to injury most of the trucks we saw weren't even fully occupied.

We probably should've done more research before we booked this hotel and visited Yala park but if we knew more about the actual safari and the fact that you can't swim in the ocean we wouldn't stay in this place.
title: Nice hotel but...

placeInfo/address: Wildlife Tourism Zone, Palatupana, Yala National Park 82600 Sri Lanka
text: This hotel was beautiful with great accommodation , service, staff, food and guides and is definitely 5 /5. Except : we especially wanted to see leopards and we booked several months in advance and a 4 week holiday and business around the 3 days at Yala. A few months before our trip we received an email from them that the leopard part of the park would be closed in September. We discovered that this happens every year for the breeding season.  It also meant a 90 min drive each way to the open part of therr Park instead of 15 min to the leopard area. We only sae a few elephants, crocs, deer, water buffalo, monkeys , 2 eagles and assorted lizards/ sloths. Chena Huts should not open in September or should charge 1/2 price. It was also difficult to work out how to get there: no help from Uga. We discovered the Cinnamon Air sea plane that was fabulous.
title: Beware the month

placeInfo/address: Wildlife Tourism Zone, Palatupana, Yala National Park 82600 Sri Lanka
text:
My fiancé and I were SO excited to stay at Uga Chena Huts, but left feeling the $1,000/ night price wasn’t worth it. We haven’t been to South Africa on a safari and are considering it for part of our honeymoon, so Uga Chena and Yala were going to be our first tastes to this type of experience. Obviously Uga Chena comes at a steep price per night, so our expectations were very high. 

Check-in- We were greeted with a very warm welcome by the staff where they have you put in the flag of your country on their welcome board. For a small intimate place, it’s nice to know where the other guests are from. Nice touch. 

Rooms- Spacious and impressive. We immediately put on our bathing suits and took advantage of our private pool. There were saw water buffalo in the distance as our room over looked out to a watering hole. So cool! Beds were comfortable and amenities like the bathtub were special touches. 

All-inclusive- This is a point where we felt we did not get the true value of an all inclusive experience. Our mini bar was stocked with sugary drinks, water, and sodas, but NO alcohol! Not even canned beer. On a hot day all we wanted was a cold drink in the pool. So we called the front desk and asked for a bottle of wine to our room. They said no room service since there is wildlife very close to the property, but we could come to the bar, get a glass of wine, then bring it back to our room. Huh? So it’s okay if we drink at our pool, but we have to inconvenience ourselves to get out of the pool to order it at the bar, then head back.... At that point if I can bring wine back to my room myself, then the staff should be able to do it as well. That is definitely not 5-star service, and frankly contradicts their policy. **I’m not talking about food here because I 100% understand why there is no food allowed in the huts. I am simply referring to drinks. 

Staff- Very friendly and strive to make sure you are “okay” at all times. They want to make sure you are happy and having a good experience, but lack the power at times to actually make sure this happens. My fiancé had e-mailed the staff ahead of time letting them know that we were celebrating our anniversary, and they were so excited to bring us a cake with sparklers to celebrate. These were warm and thoughtful touches that we commend them for. 

Spa- My fiancé and I got a 1-hour full body massage and both thoroughly enjoyed them.

Safari- Two game drives a day are included in your nightly rate, which is a seamless perk of staying at Uga Chena Huts. Kasun was our game driver and we would highly recommend him! We only did two game drives: one early morning and one late afternoon. Most people do a minimum of four game drives, but for us two was enough to get a taste of Yala. Kasun was extremely knowledgeable and passionate about wild life, especially elephants. Sadly, we didn’t get to see the famous leopards, but by no means did that took away from our wonderful safari experience. We saw elephants, crocodiles, water buffalo, king fisher, painted storks, eagles, lizards, wild hogs, baby hogs, etc. It was so relaxing to just park at a watering hole and watch nature in real time. After our last game drive Kasun spoke with us in more detail about leopard and elephant behavior. He was amazing and a true highlight of our stay at Uga Chena!

Safety- My issues with safety are similar to my issues with the no room service policy—their policies 100% make sense, but they aren’t necessarily consistent i.e. we could get drinks at the bar and bring them back to our room to drink at the pool, but their staff couldn’t bring them to us because they have a no room service policy. That makes no sense. Anyways, back to the safety issue. They definitely take safety seriously. They do not allow you to walk to the beach without a staff member guiding you. One night the staff had coordinated my fiancé and I to eat a private meal on the beach where wildlife passes by regularly, but canceled it because there was an elephant nearby. All great safety measures that we appreciated. That night at dinner one of the waiters told us that there was a leopard spotted at Hut 14. But here’s the kicker: you are able to walk alone at night from the restaurant to your hut and vice versa! When there are leopards! It is also very dark along these paths and I personally felt very uncomfortable that an animal (even a monkey) would pop out from the bushes at any moment. I feel like the staff should always offer to walk you back to your hut in these situations.  

All in all, we enjoyed our game drive with Kasun and the amenities in our room, but sadly left feeling disappointed in the experience we received for the $1,000/ night price tag. It would be may more accurately priced at $600/ night. Also, we only stayed one night and truly felt if we stayed any longer we would have gone stir crazy. Definite room for improvement here!
title: Overpriced and not up to standard of quality

ownerResponse/text:
Dear Guest,

We are happy to note that that your overall experience at Chena Huts was good and thank you for taking time off to review.

Regret to note that you were not entirely satisfied with your safari to the Yala National Park. This cannot be compared to safaris in Africa where there are open plains starching across a vast area of open terrain with abundance of wild life which Africa has to offer.  Yala National park is unique in its own way which is renowned for its high-density of Leopard population.

We hope you will find an opportunity to stay with us again in the future.

Regards,

Ramli Ghaffoor
Director/CEO
placeInfo/address: Wildlife Tourism Zone, Palatupana, Yala National Park 82600 Sri Lanka
text:
The rooms are interesting, although very poorly lit, do not try packing at night or you will leave stuff behind!
Food and wine is quite good, however the reason you are there is Safari. If you have ever been to the Kruger National Park you will be somewhat disappointed by Yala, which boasts a high concentration of Leopards, but you probably will not see any. The jeep tracks are very badly maintained and the ride along them is painful. Most tracks are close to thick undergrowth, so mostly there is precious little to see. Their guides are very good but struggle to keep your attention with what they can spot for you.
title: Safaris are ok - but sure not Africa!

ownerResponse/text:
Dear Guest,

Thank you for staying at Chena Huts and we are pleased to know that you enjoyed your stay, the ambiance, safari and the culinary experience we offer. 
We sincerely apologize for the delay in having your room cleaned and the inconvenience caused. 

Thank you for your feedback as we continue to strive to do better. We look forward to seeing you again at Chena Huts.

Thank you! 

Regards,

Ramli Ghaffoor
Director/CEO
placeInfo/address: Wildlife Tourism Zone, Palatupana, Yala National Park 82600 Sri Lanka
text: Cena Huts is a wonderful experience. The rooms ,safaris and meals are great.  We had one problem. They didn't clean our hut one day and when we complained to the manager she said it was because the maid was sick.  When you are paying hundreds of dollars a day at a luxury hotel, this is not acceptable.
title: The hut and grounds are wonderful. Manangement is a problem

ownerResponse/text:
Dear Guest, 

Thank you for taking the time to share your detailed feedback and for having stayed at Chena Huts. 

We regret that we were unable to fully satisfy you during your stay with us and your constructive comments are a good learning for us. Your feedback has already been taken up with the team at Chena Huts for corrective measures.

Thank you once again and we do hope that you find an opportunity in the near future to stay with us again. 

Regards,
Ramli Ghaffoor
Director/CEO
placeInfo/address: Wildlife Tourism Zone, Palatupana, Yala National Park 82600 Sri Lanka
roomTip: don't go to Chena Huts if you are seeking a room with a view.
text: I loved the idea of Eco-tourism huts and firfst impression was just that but much of the resort is built in pre-formed plastic and concrete which rather spoils the overall effect. The rooms are very well equipped but rather masculine in style and the bathrooms lack any privacy. The food was good but the portions rather too large which made it difficult to do justice to the four course meals. The staff, in an effort to be helpful and attentive, are too overbearing and intrusive. Compared to our visit to the Dunkeld Bungalow at the Ceylon Tea Trails in the few days before, Chena Huts have something to learn. However the safari did live up to expectations in Yala because we did see a leopard, albeit briefly.
title: Great Idea but Could be Better Executed

ownerResponse/text:

placeInfo/address: Argyle Road Kudaoya Estate, Hatton 22000 Sri Lanka
text: We checked in here as we were unhappy with our booking elsewhere.  We were warmly greeted by ALL members of staff.  Luckily for us they found a very nice large room overlooking the garden and pool at a good db&b price.  No complaints about the room.  However we found the buffet dinner and breakfast. very disappointing.  Nothing was hot or even warm.  Produce was poor.  Can’t believe in a tea plantation region they serve a tea with just a bag in a cup - not even a teapot.  All in all not what I would expect from this quality of hotel.  Back massage is highly recommended.
title: Disappointing

Your honest review is highly appreciated, and it brings us immense joy to know that you found our hotel's friendly staff and breathtaking views to be convenient. placeInfo/address: Argyle Road Kudaoya Estate, Hatton 22000 Sri Lanka
text:
Impression mitigée sur cet hôtel due notamment à l'attribution d'une chambre pas à la hauteur des commentaires lus sur tripadvisor (???) : accès à la chambre par une sorte "d'annexe" en sous-sol, style accès à un garage. Pas de balcon/terrasse privée mais extérieur à partager entre 4 chambres avec seulement deux petites tables entourées de deux chaises chacunes (4 chaises pour 8 personnes !!!). Petite salle de bain incommode.

Parties communes extérieures avec peu de places assises (tout comme le nombre de transats autour de la piscine).
Salle de restaurant petite et bruyante, buffets dîner et petit déjeuner inférieurs (pas mal de plats fades) à la plupart des autres hôtels visités durant notre séjour au Sri Lanka.
Bar sans atmosphère.
High Tea sur une table sans vue en plein soleil au milieu du passage des autres clients (...). Le comble pour un hôtel au milieu des plantations de thé : un seul thé basique en sachet (...) proposé. Une dégustation de plusieurs thés (feuilles) avec explications seraient une expérience intéressante à proposer.
Pas d'activité proposée par l'hôtel, si ce n'est une petite marche aux alentours : très sympa, mais des explications avec un guide aurait été appréciées. De même, prêt de vélo (sans guide) non adapté au terrain et à la taille de la personne....
Pour nous le séjour de 2 nuits dans le cadre de notre circuit organisé par l'agence H.O.T (cette agence se voit-elle toujours attribuée les plus mauvaises chambres dans les hôtels ?) nous a semblé trop long, même si la vue de la terrasse commune et les alentours sont magnifiques et le personnel souriant.
title: Impression mitigée

ownerResponse/text:

roomTip: Avoid staying in Stewart room. Overlooks the parking garage. You pay top money and it's called as junior suite bigger than Bruce but upper floor Bruce has better views
text:
Nice and new hotel but not the way we thought based on the reviews. First great things as already mentioned by few 
- very clean hotel.
- extremely pleasant and helpful staff. Top marks on that. Also live music every evening. And two great musicians. Loved it. 

Not so great 
- I would not call it a luxury resort. Small little things give it out whether it's the quality of toiletries or the bar or small TV hanging on the wall. No need for a TV in Hatton. 
- having a Badminton courtyard to pool table in the middle of Hatton also shows that it's focus is to cater to local crowd rather than foreign tourists. Hence may be less than 20% were foreigners in the resort the time we were around. 
- food - while they were really accomodative but I am not sure if this is the best. Maybe we are vegetarian and we struggled. But must say that they went out of the way to support. Full marks on that. 
- Scottish? Not so sure. Too bright a lobby for that.
title: A very sincere effort by GM and full marks to the staff. Great hospitality.

placeInfo/address: Ulagalla Road, Thirappane 50072 Sri Lanka
text:
Pleasant hotel 

A very pleasant hotel with lovely staff. The food was also pleasant though I would have preferred a more authentic selection of breads

Horse riding lovely and well kept loved horses

Bed very comfortable though shame no drapes to keep light out ( roller blinds light outside on at night).  Very large room . The plunge pools are shaded and perhaps a waste being enclosed 

There was no pressure to purchase add ons but little to do without it 

The beautiful pool was exposed to breakfast dining area viewers so would have felt conspicuous
title: Pleasant hotel

placeInfo/address: Ulagalla Road, Thirappane 50072 Sri Lanka
text:
Staff and service: was definitely 10/10. Specially buggy drivers, they were amazing. Did their job perfectly. 

Location: was okay. 

Room: We booked a deluxe one bedroom villa, which on the website looks amazing but sadly it wasn’t as amazing as it is on the website. Our villa which was villa no.26 had a very poor view. Instead on the website it’s in the middle of the paddy fields. But in reality you see nothing but trees not even nice to see them. And then there’s no difference between the 1st category villas and the second category villas a part from the bath tub and one extra toilet. In my opinion not worth paying that much to get only these two things and these villas were too far from the main hall and restaurant. But if anyone looking for a calm, quiet and privacy then this villa is the best choice. Other than that I recommend to anyone who wants visit this hotel go for the cheaper one. 

Food: Sadly food quality was very low for the standard of this hotel. Only three course meal been served for people who are on BB, HB or FB basis. Dessert options were same for both lunch and dinner. Very few options of foods. A la carte menu prices were too high. Definitely needs to be improved. Specially for locals. 

The other thing is check the period before you travel if you wanna see the green. Because a week before our stay paddy fields been all harvested. So it was all dry and dull. 

The choice of this hotel was due to our last year visit to uga Chena huts. So our expectations might have been raised somewhat. All in all the hotel is okay but it’s disappointing and overpriced for what it is.
title: Overpriced hotel

placeInfo/address: Ulagalla Road, Thirappane 50072 Sri Lanka
text: The extensive Uga property is delightfully planned to provide a totally unique experience – this was our second 3-day stay.  Accommodation is provided in superbly appointed, spacious villas, with deck and well-sized plunge pool.  Villa maintenance is good.  A buggy service is provided to transport guests to the Main House (some drivers need to drive at an appropriate speed for the somewhat uneven terrain!).  The Main House is enchanting with splendid lounge / bar area, scenically sited to enjoy the pool and array of Frangipan trees.  However, one of the two restaurants was ‘closed for renovation’ and the à la carte menu of the other is very limited.  For a 3-day stay, one struggles to find acceptable items.  Further, the quality of the meals was very mediocre and prices were high.  This was a disappointment for a hotel of this standing.  Breakfasts were good.
title: A Perfect Property, but Ruined by the Poor Dining Experience

placeInfo/address: Ulagalla Road, Thirappane 50072 Sri Lanka
text:
We were told many lovely things about Uga Ulagalla, even from the lovely W15 Resort, so our expectations might have been raised somewhat.
We had a deluxe one Bedroom Villa, which on the website looks amazing! Sadly it was not as amazing as it looked. The Villa is very rustic and colonial again like so many which we really like, the bed was comfortable, the shower was not great and we did ask them to try to fix it as the pressure was terrible and would come on and off at different pressures thought-out the shower, it was very "rusty" and old looking as were a lot of the bathroom facilities They did improve it but still, it was not great (The worse in all our hotels in Sri Lanka) We had to ask them to fix the toilet seat twice as it kept slamming down (Supposed to be soft closing, which they did replace on our final few days. The pool was very cold and I could not use it. sadly, my husband did brave it! We were quite away from the main house so had breakfast sent each morning which was very nice and presented well. The food was included in our stay just the Alcohol we had to pay for which was severely overpriced! The rose Wine which we love was so sweet and the white was average I had to resort to the Oyster Bay at £60 pounds a bottle !!! The food was ok, we do enjoy the Sri lanken food so eat mostly the curries, and we did enjoy the KAMATHA Diner in the Mud hut which was a slightly added cost but not too much considering the amount of food you got! 
We went on the safari with Katherina, who was lovely and well informed, we saw "one" elephant and a few Serpent Eagles I wished I had not got up at 4 am to do this as it was so not worth the effort,! But not their fault as you never know what you might see! The staff were very helpful and the Assistant Front desk Manager Seshaya was super and really tried to get things done for us. As we left we told the General Manager, Thashinthan, our thoughts regarding the cost of the wine and the general condition of the villa, so I do hope they take action and up their game as after coming from W15 it was hard to come down to the lower standards provided at Uga considering the cost of staying there. I would not recommend it at the present but maybe if they improve things it would be better.
title: Our Number 5 Hotel on Sri Lanka Tour

placeInfo/address: Ulagalla Road, Thirappane 50072 Sri Lanka
text: A beautiful place with amazing deluxe villas but is let down by its dining room and service. We had a lovely villa with large bedroom, sitting room, large bathroom and separate cloakroom with shower, plus a great verandah with small pool. This was beautifully furnished and surrounded by wild life and plants, but about 8 minutes away from the main dining room and pool by buggy. We were told we just had to dial 0 and the buggy would arrive. The first night the phone had no dialling tone, luckily after about 20 minutes of wondering what to do, the man turned up to do the evening turn down service and eventually got through on his mobile so about another 20 minutes later we got to dinner. For breakfast the next day, the phone worked, but unfortunately the buggy broke down so after about 25 minutes we got to breakfast! After that it worked fairly efficiently but one was always fairly unsure. The dining room was the main problem though. The service was totally erratic.  Sometimes you got bread and water as you sat down, sometimes, the table next to you who came in later than you got bread and water and you didn’t. Sometimes you got an “amuse bouche” sometimes you didn’t. The food was not very good either. I appreciate Covid has not made it easier for hotels and everyone was doing their best but it was really rather disappointing.
title: Very beautiful BUT

ownerResponse/text:
Dear Guest,

Thank you for staying with us at Ulagalla and sharing your feedback. We are pleased note that you found the resort and its surroundings to be special and you were happy with the villas, views and the abundance of wildlife.

However, I do regret to learn that you were not entirely satisfied with your meals. We change our lunch menus daily and we also offer an extensive ala cart and snack menus to choose from, Regret if these were not presented and communicated to you during your meal times. 

We hope that the overall experience was pleasant and we look forward to the opportunity to welcoming you back to Ulagalla.

Thank you
placeInfo/address: Ulagalla Road, Thirappane 50072 Sri Lanka
text:
The hotel is undoubtedly special, that is mainly due to its setting. It’s set in 58 acres of land, mostly forest some paddy fields and a few small ponds/lakes. We were a group of 6 and stayed in 2 chalets. The chalets itself were lovely, beautifully decorated, fantastic views over paddy fields or forest and very comfortable. Some rooms come with a plunge pool. To get around the hotel you can cycle or use a golf buggy from reception. We opted for the cycles except at night. The grounds are a haven for some wonderful tropical birds. We spotted quite a few extraordinarily colourful ones including the Ceylon jungle fowl and many peacocks. The hotel pool is great too. We also used the pool table and did archery- which is charged for. 

Now the reason for the 3 stars... sadly for a hotel of this class the food was a real let down. It’s a set menu - which is not a problem but the food didn’t live up to expectations of a hotel of this class. Also the same menu was given for both lunch and dinner and over 2 days! Desserts were worse than the mains. 

The service was somewhat hit and miss too. Some of the main staff were very robotic almost and we all felt were not very genuine. Where as others like one waiter and some of the ground staff and security were very nice indeed. 

Also there was a mouse in our room!! 

All in all we had a good break.. would we come again? I’d like to think that maybe one day we would. But there certainly are some issues with this hotel and for the prices they charge and the way they portray themselves some serious changes need to be made.
title: Spectacular setting!!

ownerResponse/text:
Dear Guest,

Thank you for your stay at Ulagalla and for taking the time off to post a review. We are very pleased to know that you found the resort to be beautiful and you were very happy with luxurious accommodation. 
While our culinary experience offered is highly appreciated, it is unfortunate that in this instance we could not entirely satisfy you. We regret that the wine of your choice was not available and sold out. This is not acceptable and corrective action is being rolled out.

We do sincerely hope that the overall experience was positive and the memories of your stay will give us the opportunity of welcoming you back to Ulagalla.
 
Regards,
Ramli Ghaffoor
Director/CEO
placeInfo/address: Ulagalla Road, Thirappane 50072 Sri Lanka
text:
The property is unbelievably beautiful with the cottages spaced out around the resort's own paddi. Ours was luxurious and the distance from the main building no problem as we enjoyed cycling over on the bikes provided. The food was good, but not as good as we enjoyed elsewhere in Sri Lanka as it somehow just lacked the final touch. 
However what rather spoiled our stay was an issue with the wine list. There are 6 whites listed but three had run out. We had decided to treat ourselves to a Chardonnay from Margaret River to find there was none left so we were offered one from Chile as an alternative. Foolishly I did not ask the price so we ended up being charged the price of the Margaret River wine (9600 rupees plus service plus tax so well over £50 GBP) for a very average bottle. When I queried this on the bill it was greeted with a shrug and a waiter who could not escape fast enough!
Maybe we were just unlucky but the experience was not what I would expect from a resort of this calibre
title: Stunning property ........but

ownerResponse/text:
Dear Guest,

Thank you for taking the time to share your feedback. While I wish you had a better experience, it is feedback like this that we learn from and use to improve. We work hard to deliver an exceptional guest experience, and it's apparent in this case that we regret we were unable to meet your expectations. If you give us a chance to earn back your trust, I can assure you that we will do our best to give you the great hotel experience that so many of our guests have grown so fond of.

Sincerely,
Ramli Ghaffoor
Director/ CEO
placeInfo/address: Ulagalla Road, Thirappane 50072 Sri Lanka
roomTip: Don't have Villa 4
text:
Four of us arrived for a two night stay.  The situation is remarkable and my husband and I enjoyed the nature and wild life.  Our room was good and comfy, but you needed a degree in electronics to get everything working or indeed turned off!  

The food was disappointing - the curries all tasted similar, service was slow and for a 5 star hotel it was not good enough. Breakfast was fine.

Regrettably our friends suffered badly by being in Villa 4.  Air conditioning was not working, the lock didn't work properly.  There had recently been a power strike before our arrival and the electronic screen to control everything wasn't working either.  This should have been checked and repaired before their arrival.  Interestingly, looking back in the comments book in Villa 4.  There are a number of comments about poorly working air conditioning, no wifi, and a number of other difficulties.  Clearly this room needs some upgrading which in spite of comments they have failed to do.

The staff were on the whole very good, but one or two of them were frankly pretty useless and some more staff training is needed in order to justify its Small Luxury Hotel of the World status.

The swimming pool area was lovely and the whole setting fabulous.  We walked and used the bikes, and, of course it is well positioned for seeing Anuradnupura. 

With a bit of tweaking this hotel could be truly wonderful and I am glad that others have enjoyed it - maybe we were just unlucky.  It's a shame.
title: Wonderful location but disappointing food

ownerResponse/text:
Dear Guest,

Thank you for taking the time to share your feedback. While I wish you had a better experience, it is feedback like this that we learn from and use to improve. We work hard to deliver an exceptional guest experience, and we regret you were unable to fully enjoy you stay with us. It is also unfortunate that you did not indicate your concerns to any of the staff members as they would have been more than willing to go out of their way to address them.

If you give us a chance to earn back your trust, I can assure you that we will do our best to give you the great hotel experience that so many of our guests have grown so fond of.

Regards,
Ramli Ghaffoor
Director/ CEO
placeInfo/address: Ulagalla Road, Thirappane 50072 Sri Lanka
roomTip: Get a villa near the restaurant or you could be waiting ages to be transported there.
text:
First impressions are good. A beautifully restored reception hall with the restaurant on the first floor giving a fabulous view of the gorgeous pool, the manicured lawns and the distant paddy fields. The individual villas with private plunge pools and large living area and bedroom are  also beautifully presented.
It's not until you actually start to use the facilities that the cracks appear. The bathroom is large, but the open shower is badly built and the water is always in danger of flooding the floor. The shower head itself is too close to the edge of the shower area and soaks the floor, the towels, the bathmat and anything else within reach.
There is a shaving/make up mirror but the lighting is so poor it's useless. The resort is eco friendly, so the towels and grey and hard. Now I'm all in favour of saving the planet, but give me fluffy white towels any day.
The room service is erratic. The first night we had lovely candles in the bathroom, the second night no candles and the mini bar was not restocked and glasses were not replaced.
But by far the most disappointing thing was the food. Very bland and ordinary. We saw three people return their food, ours was OK but certainly not the standard you would expect. As I have already said, the views are wonderful but the food is not.
The service at breakfast is painfully slow. Everything is waitress served so you wait for the fruit juice, wait for the cereals, wait for the fruit and eventually get your eggs, in my case served at the same time as the fruit. We had FIVE incorrect things served in two days. The first breakfast took 45 minutes with our driver waiting outside. Why don't you have a buffet table for the juices and fruit and cereal like everyone else, it would speed things up enormously and there would be less wastage as your portions are very large.
The villas are so far spread over several acres so they have a golf buggy to ferry you around. That's ok except at busy times such as breakfast or checkout time, but there appears to be just one grandfather figure who controls everything and the delays are very frustrating.
All small things but it wouldn't take much to get everything to a much higher standard.
title: A lack of attention to details stops this being an excellent resort.

ownerResponse/text:
Dear Guest,

Thank you very much for this feedback and we are extremely glad you enjoyed the surroundings and services offered at Ulagalla.  

We are located just outside of Anuradhapura within a 58 acre property surrounded by paddy fields, natural woodlands and lakes. Therefore while the location is remote it provides for an excellent experience that is close to nature.  Due to these very surroundings that our property and villas are located in, peacocks, monkeys, exotic birds as well as geckos are spotted in the vicinity.  However I believe that our staff informs all guests to be mindful when leaving the room and to always keep the room doors shut in order avoid attracting any unwanted visitors such as geckos to your rooms.  

We do hope you enjoyed your stay with us as much as we enjoyed having you at Ulagalla and we sincerely look forward to welcome you back to our property.

Best regards,
Ramli Ghaffoor 
Director/CEO
placeInfo/address: Ulagalla Road, Thirappane 50072 Sri Lanka
text:
Pros: well-established, service is excellent, peaceful, spaced, private, offers horse back riding, spa, gym, helicopter ride (expensive)
Cons: it's 5 hours from the airport, there are no places around it and the room is full of lizards.
title: Relaxing, well-established, BUT in the middle of nowhere...

ownerResponse/text:
Dear Guest,

Thank you for taking the time to post your feedback following your stay at Ulagalla.

We are pleased to know that you overall had a comfortable stay and your feedback is greatly appreciated.

Please allow us to clarify that the Mini Bar charges that you are referring to.  All items in our Mini Bar are chargeable and we do always have a folder that clearly depicts all prices of items in the mini Bar. With regards to Milk, this is part of our tea coffee making facilities and as we wish to provide you with fresh milk we leave it in the fridge and we do also keep a tent card indicating that the milk is in the mini bar. 

We also believe that the rates of our mini bar items are very much in line with boutique resorts or our calibre and regret you found them to be expensive. However we do apologise for any miscommunication that may have occurred.

Thank you once again and we look forward to the opportunity of welcoming you back to Ulagalla.

Regards,
Ramli Ghaffoor
Director/CEO
placeInfo/address: Ulagalla Road, Thirappane 50072 Sri Lanka
text:
Great boutique hotel with fantastic facilities and a very warm service and great food too!

one word of caution - happy figuring out what's free in the mini fridge! Milk in the fridge is free, so are the water bottles, do not touch the nuts packets and sprigles in the living room! It's not free and it's expensive! 

I asked if it was free from who came in to deliver room service, he said it was, but I was charged around $20 for it. I inquired at the point of settling the bill, the lady apologised for the miscomm, I still had to pay:( 

Totally dented my otherwise great memory of the experience.
title: Lovely place, lovely hospitality, one suggestion!

placeInfo/address: Ulagalla Road, Thirappane 50072 Sri Lanka
roomTip: Stay in the high numbers, you're further from the main building and thus buggy noise in the night.
text:
Great setting and close to the main sites in Anuradhapura which is the main point!  Main building is lovely and the pool is in a stunning setting with the paddy fields beyond surrounding it.

Sadly the lodges (rooms) are a little tired and desperately need maintenance, which is a shame as they are pretty and well equipped. Ours had one bedside light not working, very dirty windows (the walls are huge glass panels) and mould on the cane blinds that hang at every window.  Sections of wood and concrete around the entrance and pool showed signs of really poor repairs which are letting the feel down badly.

Restaurant service was friendly but inefficient and the food was erratic, some things great, others shockingly poor. The restaurant area also needed a serious clean with wooden surfaces feeling sticky to the touch and pigeons nesting in the open structure.

This is all a real shame as the place is in an amazing setting and you can walk or cycle alongside the reservoir or through the surrounding villages.  It just feels like it needs a good shake and clean up to come up to spec really.
title: Great setting but getting a little tired

ownerResponse/text:
Dear Guest,

Thank you for taking the time to post your feedback following your stay at Ulagalla.

We have noted that whilst your overall experience at our resort met your expectations, there were certain services and facilities that did not. Please accept our  sincere apologies for the inconvenience caused to you and your detailed feedback has already been taken up with my team for corrective measures.

We do hope that you will give us another opportunity to provide you with a more positive impression

Regards,
Ramli Ghaffoor
Director/ CEO
placeInfo/address: Ulagalla Road, Thirappane 50072 Sri Lanka
text:
Ulagalla is  very nise resort, with nice welcoming, very good service, rooms were very nice, big, separate sitting area, outdoor sitting area, but we felt away from everything. In rooms not too cozy.
Restaurant was o'k, could be better
title: Feels away from others

ownerResponse/text:
Firstly thank you for your comments and we greatly appreciate your input on our Eco concept and our two horses.  As you've mentioned we are indeed an ECO friendly retreat and take great care in preserving the environment surrounding the hotel as well as the animals.  This is why we take an extra effort to reuse all our bio waste to produce bio gas that light the pathways, the reverse osmosis water management, have an extensive Solar farm, an organic garden among many other strict ECO policies.
 
It is our ongoing commitment to maintaining an Eco friendly hotel that we value the feedback and suggestions from our guests and we have taken your  comments on the horses very seriously. The GM has informed me that the district equine veterinarian visited the property recently and attended to the horses and they are in perfect health now.  If you would like to know more about how the horses are doing or any other aspect of the hotel, please contact me on info@ugaescapes.com and I would be happy to give you an update.
 
We sincerely hope you pay us another visit very soon and we look forward to welcoming you back.
placeInfo/address: Ulagalla Road, Thirappane 50072 Sri Lanka
text:
The 2 horses from Ulagalla Resort are living night and day in a box on a concrete floor, without any straw, except when tourists are riding them. They never have access to a field to freely run around and graze grass. After observing them closeby, the black horse had injuries at each knee (caused most likely by laying down on concrete to sleep) and the white and black horse had a lot of scars all over his body. After some investigation, we’ve been told that the two young smiling stable hands beat them.

After having complained to the general manager, asking him to provide straw in the stables, to put the horses in a field at least several hours a day and to replace the young boys who beat the horses, he only had a thin layer of sawdust put on the floor. 
The manager claimed to be unable to improve the condition of these animals because they are owned and being provided by a company called Premadasa Riding School Sri Lanka which is said to be responsible for the conditions these horses are kept in. 

Here are the photos we made in Ulagalla Resort in August 2013.

The idea of an eco-resort like Ulagalla is very appealing to me , but finding these 2 horses in the condition they were in was shocking and unacceptable.
title: A  heavenly eco-resort except for the 2 horses : mistreatment and negligence

placeInfo/address: Ulagalla Road, Thirappane 50072 Sri Lanka
roomTip: Chalet # 3,4 and 5 are conveniently located with a good view. Always check whether the chalets are in working order as our preferred chalet # 5 was not usable twice in 9 months.
text: It is yet a great property with with friendly service. But the overall experience is getting pretty average. This was my 4th visit in 9 months, this time for the New Year holidays in April. We noticed that the quality of food which was dropping had now dropped to an all time low.Bland food, poor quality and lacking variety. On New Years Day the menu was as usual a la carte with no traditional food during the New Year for lunch which is a standard across the island even in a 3 star hotel. Once you stay for 2 nights you can predict the menu.To cap it, one has to wait about 2 hours for the meal to be served. If you are on a FB basis that would be about 5 to 6 hours a day which is ridiculous!
title: Our home away from home

ownerResponse/text:
Greetings from Resplendent Ceylon!

Thank you for your review of your stay at Wild Coast. It is important for us as your feedback is invaluable to us and will be looked into.

 We hope you give us a chance to welcome you again!
placeInfo/address: Palatupana, Yala National Park 82600 Sri Lanka
placeInfo/name: Wild Coast Tented Lodge - Relais & Chateaux
text:
Hotel good, but not up to Relaix Chateaux standards
The service at meals was often slow and disorganized, the furnishings in the main restaurant need to be refreshed - the cushions on seats were old and used, the tables needed varnishing, light fittings needed painting - 
When the staff sat us down at our table for lunch it was still dirty from the breakfast service , the bedrooms were very nice, and the safari guides were good
title: Ok but not up to Relais Chateaux standards

ownerResponse/text:
Dear Chuansu, 

It is extremely unfortunate that you did not experience the same level of service as Tea Trails, as the seamless thread of service is something a number of our guests write about. We have some of the best rangers in Sri Lanka, and the overall safari experience is certainly one of the highlights. Suranga, along with the rest of the team are incredibly proficient in explaining what you see at Yala, and educating you about the bio-diversity in the region. In terms of the rooms, the family rooms are connected via a small bridged walkway. This connected 'urchin' is very popular among all families that visit, and this form of design was implemented to keep in line with building standards and sustainability principles in order to not exceed a specific tent size. 

We have already completed an inquiry on why the restaurant service on that particular day was not up to your satisfaction. We always strive to improve and we appreciate your feedback in regard to this matter. Your comment about Tea Trails being rated 11/10 is something we truly appreciate, and next time you visit, you can be assured that you will experience the same level of hospitality at Wild Coast.

Warm wishes, 

Malik
placeInfo/address: Palatupana, Yala National Park 82600 Sri Lanka
placeInfo/name: Wild Coast Tented Lodge - Relais & Chateaux
text: We came here directly from tea trails which is managed under same mother company. Everything here except safari has a large gap to catch tea trails. First, rooms decorated and designed so interesting. We booked a family rooms and they are not connecting each other, two separated rooms. It’s not convenient for a family or a group of friends. Restaurant here is terrible, everyone with a poke face. Nobody cares about our feelings for the food, in fact food are too salty. They served food too slow. Some foods already cool down when we ate.  Safari is only reason that I will recommend this resort to my friends. Guide and driver are more than perfect. Guide named Saranga was easy to talk and showed us lots of animals. After all, wild coast rented lodge is a nice resort compared with a lot of resorts. But need to improve all the services. Send a few staff to tea trails and learn from them.
title: Not worthy

ownerResponse/text: Hi, having escorted you back to your room our team were alarmed that you set out into the bush alone afterwards. Security had alerted against walking alone at around 840pm – the resort isn’t fenced and wild animals can freely walk around - there had been a leopard detected in the area around that time. My apologies that you felt we were heavy-handed​. Despite waivers being signed we would be irresponsible to allow a guest to walk alone at night and this is generally appreciated by guests, as is the case at most lodges. Warm wishes, Malik
placeInfo/address: Palatupana, Yala National Park 82600 Sri Lanka
placeInfo/name: Wild Coast Tented Lodge - Relais & Chateaux
text:
Wild Trails is in a beautiful location and the tents are well designed. But I agree that with some of the recent reviewers that management and service are not up to Ceylon Tea Trail standards (where we stayed immediately before Wild Trails). Upon arrival as an all-inclusive guest, you are given a confusing set of instructions of what exactly is included in your 'all inclusive' experience (three pieces of laundry per day and four drinks, for example). This comes across as cheap and unnecessary and the opposite of what one should feel upon arrival.

But our biggest problem with the hotel was its heavy-handed use of security to restrict guests' movements around the hotel. You are only permitted to walk on a sliver of the beach, and you are not permitted to leave your room without an escort after dark. If you do so, security is aggressive. 

I'm sure that the hotel will say that they are protecting their guests' safety, but the truth is that incoming guests are in far more danger in the car getting to the hotel than they are once they are on the grounds. We've traveled to many places worldwide with dangerous wildlife and have never experienced an obtrusive management experience like this. Our sense was that the hotel's paternalistic approach had everything to do with a corporate approach to a wildlife lodge that aimed to limit liability and was happy to whitewash the experience for guests. Until management loosens up some of these policies, this is not the best place for more adventurous travelers or for those who value their privacy.
title: Management and service need work

placeInfo/address: Palatupana, Yala National Park 82600 Sri Lanka
placeInfo/name: Wild Coast Tented Lodge - Relais & Chateaux
roomTip: book a cocoon with a plunge pool or go to Chena Huts next door!
text:
Not an auspicious start. Our welcome letter, signed by Rooms Division Manager Kenny Speklewinde, was addressed to Mr Tonny Peder not our name!  Very sloppy and there was no turn down on our first night and when we returned from bird watching at 11 the next morning, having left at 5.30 our room had not been cleaned.  There is a rather complicated complimentary wine arrangement for people on full board. I am not sure why as we certainly didn’t drink our ‘quota’ but I guess some people take advantage.
The highlight here was our guide and naturalist Pradeep Surunga.  His knowledge and ability to spot birds was remarkable.  He is a final year student in Colombo and hopes to become a full time ranger at Tented Camp when he graduates.  He is so good they would be mad not to hire him before Chena Huts grabs him!
The cocoons are very well designed but the outside decks are too small and provide no shade for large parts of the day unlike Chena Huts that we took a look as we left Tented Camp.  Chena are larger more spacious have plunge pools and has half the number of huts.  Tented Camp’s main pool is next to the bar and dining area, is not very large and when there are children in it it can be noisy.  Dexter who looked after us in the dining room stood out.  We felt some of the staff were rather inexperienced. We noticed that they are building a Hilton Hotel close by to Chena and Tented Camp.  It is not possible to swim in the sea at either resort.
title: Not up to the standard we know Resplendent Ceylon can provide

ownerResponse/text: Dear Charles. I'm sorry that we fell below your expectations, despite having an enjoyable stay overall. The National Park can become busy on local holidays, our rangers try to mitigate this as far as possible. The food comment surprised me as we have been maintaining a consistently high standard. I will check what went wrong in your case. Thank you for your frank feedback, we always seek to improve, warm wishes, Malik
placeInfo/address: Palatupana, Yala National Park 82600 Sri Lanka
placeInfo/name: Wild Coast Tented Lodge - Relais & Chateaux
text: Exotic location right on the beach (but swimming in the sea prohibited due to rocks) and in the Yala national park. The "tented" rooms and bar and eating areas are modern, exciting and well thought out. The rooms are very comfortable and well equipped. The staff are young and very willing and friendly but sometimes lack leadership and experience. Because of its location, you are restricted to eating in the hotel restaurant. This is sometimes disappointing as the cooking can be hit or miss with not enough attention to detail and quality. The safari experience on day 1 was good but on day 2 (, a public holiday) it was a nightmare with far too many vehicles in too small an area. Not enjoyable. We enjoyed our stay but 3 nights was enough.
title: Promises much but does not always deliver

ownerResponse/text: Dear Anthony, glad you found the setting of Wild Coast Lodge's stunning and liked our cocoon accommodation. This is a particularly busy time of year and the main pool overlooking the beach is a popular spot - I apologise that you found it too noisy, the first such complaint. We arranged a private beach dinner for you on both nights since we took your concerns seriously. We do offer Cocoons with private plunge pools but these were fully occupied during your stay. There is much peace and serenity available in and around the guestroom Cocoons as well as on the beach if the main pool area is lively, warm wishes, Malik
placeInfo/address: Palatupana, Yala National Park 82600 Sri Lanka
placeInfo/name: Wild Coast Tented Lodge - Relais & Chateaux
text:
We have decided to stay at WCL instead of AmanWella after a two-night stay at AmanGalla due to its setting and resort’s architecture.

The setting is indeed stunning, and the accommodation is nice. However, the overall excitement is quickly ruined by the extremely noisy environment:
- there is only one pool which is constantly occupied by children screaming and shouting all day long (the beach is not open for swimming),
- safari: mass tourism with people feeding animals and screaming and shouting. No surprise that leopards don’t show up.

Place to be avoided if you are looking for quietness and serenity.
title: Not for those who are looking for quietness and serenity

ownerResponse/text:
Dear Sunela,

I’m glad that you enjoyed the service and food at Wild Coast. But not the game drives – for which please accept my apologies. I’ve gone into the matters raised and checked records:

Our policy is that kids below 3 are not allowed on a game drive, we made an exception at your insistence although we advised against taking an infant and suggested that one parent stays back for each of the drives. We will communicate this policy more clearly going forward, my apologies if we didn’t inform you when booking.

We work with the local community, using carefully selected Toyota 4WD safari jeeps accompanied by our rangers. Ranger Keith had conveyed your specific request for a driver from Sugatha Safari’s and we booked driver Kalu from that company, who we have accredited. Kalu was waiting for you at 0615 for the drive - we don’t “forget” guests on game drives! It appears you wanted a different driver from the same company, Sumudu, who is not on our accredited list. Sumudu was also waiting for you, having been directly contacted. Kalu was dismissed and you did the game drive with Sumudu and we paid Sugatha Safari’s

Our rangers strive to offer a holistic experience of Yala and are highly rated – in this case an unusual confluence of events resulted in a misunderstanding for which I apologise although I do believe you have been unjust with your comments.I am happy to share copies of rosters and vehicle movements if you require, please do message me.

Warm wishes, Malik
placeInfo/address: Palatupana, Yala National Park 82600 Sri Lanka
placeInfo/name: Wild Coast Tented Lodge - Relais & Chateaux
roomTip: Stay in a room away from water holes as the frogs will do your head in, in the night.
text:
The cocoons are amazing. However the service experience needs a lot of work starting from the rangers. No one contacted us pre arrival to even inquire about what time we were to be expected etc.

The food was good, the presentation excellent. The head chef went out of his way to ensure we were happy after each meal and to offer to make us things we liked to eat. The F&B Service staff were good and nothing was too much for them to handle. The cocktails by the pool were lovely and the bartender was only too happy to oblige. Lilanga and his team really made our stay a pleasant one. Overall the service staff at the hotel; from the boys walking us to our cocoons in the night, the receptionists, the room service guys and the housekeeping boys were very courteous and obliging.

Our game drives were a disaster from the get go. We travelled with an infant and the senior ranger Nick immediately scared our friends by saying their daughter would likely have a "heart attack" on seeing an elephant. Not for a moment did he inquire if our friends were comfortable with taking their daughter on a game drive but continued to ramble on and on about company policy and that they would be charged extra for a private jeep in case the infant had a "heart attack". We realised that this was because game drives are shared with other guests. Luckily for us we were a group of 5 travelling with the infant, only to mention that we were happy to simply travel together. At no time in the 5 minute conversation did he even ask about our interests for the next mornings drive because when sharing jeeps, it is the hotels responsibility to match the interests of all travellers within a particular jeep. A very sad state of affairs for a head ranger from South Africa.

My husband requested a particular jeep driver for the next morning after being told that all the jeeps were brought in from the local neighbourhoods and was told by Keith (a ranger) that the request was fine and that all was organised for the morning drive. Come morning, there was no sign of the requested driver and jeep and my husband went ahead and called him personally only to be told that he hadn't been booked as promised the evening prior. In the end, we called and organised our own jeep from outside as the game drive coordinator had completely forgotten us in his roster. They were only too happy to inform us that we would have to pay for our own game drive as the jeep and the driver was not on their roster. 

The ranger team needs to realise that paying guests are just that, no matter if they are Sri Lankan or foreign guests. A few trainings in South Africa within exclusive tented lodges and private game reserves will surely be an eye opener to the ranger staff at Wild Coast Tented Lodge about how to treat guests, clearly Nick and his team have no clue!!

Yala has so much to offer, not to mention competing hotel offerings and a company of this stature, should only offer the very best of Sri Lankan hospitality. Shame the ranger team has left a bitter taste in our otherwise perfect holiday.
title: Fantastic Hotel with a bad team of Rangers

ownerResponse/text:
Dear valued guest,

" Greetings from Maalu Maalu Resort & Spa "

First & foremost thank you for the valuable time taken to write feedback, Your content is duly noted and we as a team strive to satisfy all the guests, we are sad to hear we could not reach up to your expectations in some occasions and we will definitely look into the matter in a serious mode & We look forward to welcome again in near future

Best Regards,
Ashokkumar
Assistant Manager cum Front Office Manager
placeInfo/address: Coconut Development Board Road Pasikudah Bay, Pasikuda 30410 Sri Lanka
placeInfo/name: Maalu Maalu Resort & Spa - Thema Collection
text:
For the most part, everyone is really friendly and eager to please so I feel kinda bad giving a less than stellar review but there are some things that really need to be addressed or pointed out.

1. Wifi was shoddy to non-existent in our room and I had to come to the main lobby area to use my laptop - and I was getting devoured by mosquitoes when that happened.

2. Some staff at the buffet area need better training. I had a couple of incidents that didn’t happen at the other resorts we stayed at: my eggs at the egg station being given to another patron and then coffee I ordered simply not showing up.

3. Lighting in the rooms is less than ideal if you need to work on the desk, but fortunately they were able to bring in a lamp to suit my purposes.

On the positive side:

1. Staff is very helpful if you ask them for anything, so don’t hesitate. The chef was able to accommodate my wife’s request for special curries for our lunch the next day after checking in.

2. The central pool overlooking the ocean is magnificent and jaw dropping.

3. Rooms are quite spacious and have a really open feeling.

Overall, I would return if they improved their WIFI capability and did a better job handling mosquitoes on the premises.

Tip: Get to the buffet early to ensure you don’t miss the best items
title: Warm service, but some tweaks would go a long way

placeInfo/name: Maalu Maalu Resort & Spa - Thema Collection
text:
After my last visit in September 2019, I thought that I'd never visit this place again. But since I saw a few hotel deals and I badly wanted a break I thought I'd take this up again. Need to say that the service this time was way better than the last time. Got my room on time, the amenities, staff were really good and friendly. Enjoyed my stay.

But I also need to mention that there's definitely more space to improve. Listing them down here.. 
1) lighting at night. The hotel seems a bit too dark at night with minimum lighting. Specially at night the lobby and dining area looks very dull
2) more trees and greens around the pool area
3) more interaction with the in-house guests (activities)
4) music/entertainment is a must. The hotel felt a bit too lonely and silent
5) games for familes to engage (i.e.: card games, pool table, board games etc) and even activities for kids
6) the entire atmosphere could be a bit more lively

Regards,
title: Have got better

placeInfo/name: Maalu Maalu Resort & Spa - Thema Collection
text:
We felt that the place (in reality when get there), is a bit tired and getting worn down a bit. It's quite minimalistic and sparse. The beach is lovely here though.  They could do with revamping the pool area and having a nicer atmosphere. Poolmosdalt water also. Not an issue for me, but might be for others. The place was deserted when we were there. Which was nice in some ways, but awkward in others. The service at meal times was pleasant, but a bit too fussy and always coming back and forth to the table and not letting you relax and have some peace and quiet. The beverages are quite expensive and so is the food. The buffet dinner was good though and a nice big selection. Which we felt terrible about, since it was just a few guests, with so much food prepared. 
The wifi in the place was very patchy and kept dropping out. Mostly with the in-room wifi. 
The bedroom itself was fairly small.and there was lack any plug sockets next to the bed. Which always annoys me and makes no sense. 
The bathroom was huge and clean. Although the bathroom and shower backed up to where alot of staff would chat and make noise. 
I was surprised that a lot of the staffs English was quite poor. Some simple requests and questions, were met with confusion. 
Overall, its friendly service for the most part. Restraunt staff are very nice. 
The place just needs something else added around the grounds of the pool to create a nicer feel.
title: Lacking of atmosphere and minimalistic. Staff very nice, but not tough communicating

text: Me and my mom stayed at this hotel from January 28-31, 2018.  The view is spectacular, place is very clean! Staff are very kind! However, we got an Ayurvedic treatment (facial and massage, package c) and it needs improvement.  Facial was staff tugging and pulling skin.  This is a no no for any facial.  It should be gentle . Also, the face steaming machine is ancient.  You have to bend over your body to use it and it’s steaming hot water between your legs.  This is outdated . Room service food is not that great, bland food.  Breakfast is really good and tasty.  It is vegan and vegetarian friendly which is a bonus!!!

placeInfo/name: Maalu Maalu Resort & Spa - Thema Collection
text: No complaints about the room and amenities except that the beds were horribly uncomfortable, saggy and creaky. Would never imagine to have such a horrible bed even at a budget motel. The air conditioners were very outdated and malfunctioning as well. The so-called buffet is a huge scam. The food is recycled every day, just with minor modifications to make it look slightly different. Not one thing in their spread was fresh. The seafood was absolutely tasteless, and must have been re-cooked dozens of times. I was unfortunate enough to stay there on the 23rd of December and decided to extend my stay for another night (Xmas Eve). Apparently they have a "Xmas party" for which each guest is FORCED to pay LKR 5,500 irrespective of whether you want to participate or not. So our family of four was charged LKR 22,000 which is almost another night's stay. The least they could give us in return is a decent Xmas celebration but alas! It was a complete mockery. They served us a so-called special buffet which was once again nothing but recycled food. We got absolutely nothing else! They came around asking each table to purchase tickets for the raffle draw, despite having already paid so much and receiving nothing in return. We were even charged extra for the water we consumed, which was once again left on our table, opened and poured into our glasses before we even arrived. We had no idea we would be charged until we got the bill. This so-called party consisted of a god-forsaken choir singing a few carols and then a supposed DJ playing a few outdated songs. We fell asleep at our table, couldn't stand it anymore and left to our room. At the end of it all, their so-called "fireworks on the beach"  was just a few fire sparklers they lit up. It was the worst scam to rip guests off of whatever money possible.
title: Good hotel with bad food and worse scams

roomTip: The upper-level room has a better view of the beach.
text:
We came here on an offer which was referred to us by a friend. There was a friendly atmosphere portrayed throughout our stay from each and every team member. Have to give credit to Pathum who served us well during our breakfast meal.

We checked in to the double deluxe rooms. They were flexible with our request to change rooms to the upper level for a better view. Room service was great, there was a prompt response! They were very generous with amenities.

The view of the pool from the entrance was fabulous. We were totally psyched with the photos taken.

However, we were disappointed with the meals. Having checked in on a full board basis, none of our meals consisted of a buffet! As I was walking in for the meals I could see the “Tandoor” which is used to make naan bread. But not there on the menu we had!

The four-course menu was not appealing at all to me! So much so that during lunch I was left hungry after the Bolognese Pasta serve. I literally had to ask them for another meal because I did not want to leave hungry after enjoying in the pool for over 2 hours. The staff was quick to get me another meal of my choice. 

Overall it was a highly lucrative offer (full board 1-night stay on a double deluxe). Although we were not entirely satisfied with the food menu and I would rate it average. We were having high expectation on the meals since we came a long way from Kandy and most us were foodies :) 

Either way I would still recommend this place to anyone who would like to come over to Pasikudah and enjoy the beach view, surroundings and the hotel facilities they have on offer :)
title: Our family get away trip

title: Ocean View Suite..I think not

ownerResponse/text:
Dear Valued Guest,

Let us thank you for patronizing Maalu Maalu Resort & Spa and for the review uploaded on Trip Advisor and please accept our sincere apologies for having given you cause to express your disappointment on certain issues. Your comment specially about keeping you hold during making your reservation and the panoramic view from the room have our full attention.

We as a renowned hospitality organization take very serious note of each minor detail when it comes to customer service and standards. 

I will surely look into the matter of the points as mentioned by you as it is truly a very isolated incident.

Once again, thank you for your kind and valuable feedback and we look forward to your return.

Ayubowan..!

Roshan Sugathadasa
Manager
placeInfo/address: Coconut Development Board Road Pasikudah Bay, Pasikuda 30410 Sri Lanka
placeInfo/name: Maalu Maalu Resort & Spa - Thema Collection
roomTip: Upstair rooms are better close to the beach
text:
Holiday at Malu Malu was one of my greatest excitement. I first visited the beautiful sea resort on 2014. After that I have visited twice to Malu Malu. At the same time, I was holidaying with almost all other resorts surrounded in magnificent Pasikudda beach.  
 
All other surrounded resorts have caught up malu malu during last 4 years and Malu Malu Aura has faded and surrounded resorts have lifted the bar. 

Panoramic view is not Panoramic  

Last holiday in June 2018 at Malu Malu was not a stay I would cherish. It all started with reservation conversation over the phone. Reservation officer kept me hold twice for more than 3 minutes during the reservation call in order to answer in coming other calls. He kept arguing with me and reasoning out not being able to reserve upstairs room for my stay.  Ultimately in order to make sure that I get up stair room I had to reserve panoramic view room which is expensive. The worst was that panoramic view room which has been offered to us was covered with coconut trees which is blocking 120 degree of the view.

Professionalism and experience required in service 

Staff is very friendly however it was evident that they lack experience and professionalism. Hotel management seems to be less enthusiastic and lack in experience and professionalism.  resort management in terms of site look, maintenance and building quality getting deteriorate as with the years. 

Food is not the best 

During our stay (3 nights) we have experienced that no variance in food served. similar set of items being served for every day. 

My excitement to stay in Malu Malu for next Pasikuda holiday has been weakened
title: Malu Malu Aura is fading

placeInfo/address: Coconut Development Board Road Pasikudah Bay, Pasikuda 30410 Sri Lanka
placeInfo/name: Maalu Maalu Resort & Spa - Thema Collection
text:
The hotel is certainly well located just on the beach and has a nice, large infinity pool. Service is mixed though, even though the staff were friendly. When we arrived we had to wait for a full hour to be able to check in - no real communication from the desk what was going on and why - at some point we just went to eat (1 star deducted). 

During our stay the Spa was closed one day for cleaning. The manager was very apologetic and gave us each a free massage, so it was made up. There is a free morning yoga session - we went only to find the teacher had a day off (not great if you are getting up for it at 7am, another star deducted) but on the second day when it did happen it was great.
We felt the buffet was nice with a good spread of choice but when the guest numbers dropped there was only a la carte which was pretty average. The dining area is a bit tired and it would be much nicer to be able to eat nearer the beach, at least in the evening when it is not so hot (would be impossible for lunch as it had 35 degrees).
The staff are very friendly so nothing to fault there, but overall the experience was average. Overall it felt a bit disorganised (check-in time, yoga session, spa opening).
title: Somewhat disorganised

text:
The best thing about this place was the staff. Everyone was super friendly and helpful. 
The pool is nice to look at, but shallow when you get in. The beach itself looks better in pictures and is also shallow when you get in the water.
Food wise - the dinner buffet was average enough, breakfast had a lot more options and was of a higher quality of food.
Location wise the hotel isn't really near anything, perfect if you want to be isolated from everything.
The biggest downside of this hotel is the decor used in the rooms and even in the bar area. Seriously out-dated and uses bizarre colours. This would be so easy to replace with white fabrics.
title: Nice staff, strange decor

title: big disappointment

placeInfo/address: Coconut Development Board Road Pasikudah Bay, Pasikuda 30410 Sri Lanka
placeInfo/name: Maalu Maalu Resort & Spa - Thema Collection
text:
First of all should be told this is not a 5 star hotel now.it seems it has lost its 5 star standards for past few years. first we had to wait much longer for check in.
1. Food was awful.worst food we ever had.no taste at all.almost all time our dining table wasn't ready and had wait until it's done !
