placeInfo/address: 4/22 Galkanda Road Aniwatta, Kandy 20000 Sri Lanka
text:
I’m not sure I recognise the hotel from many of the reviews posted here.

Yes the place is a relatively quiet sanctuary from the noise and bustle of Kandy centre, but my wife and I thought the food was poor and the room was bland with no view to speak of - we had a suite which essentially looked out over a small rear lawn and trees beyond.

The pool area was okay but because the weather wasn’t great we didn’t get to use it. 

The room itself was comfortable if basic and had limited storage space, with a single cupboard in a room that could have accommodated much more.

The staff were helpful and friendly and did everything they could to make our stay comfortable and enjoyable but at times they became an intrusive nuisance spoiling any chance of relaxing in the common areas as you always felt you were being watched. With only about 8 or so rooms and quite a few staff they always seemed to be looking for something to do or someone to watch.

We had dinner there once which was pretty average at best - not a great ambience and at night not much of a view. The breakfast was okay, but the bread basket included toast that was hard and brittle - a sure sign the bread has been frozen and then placed in the toaster. We did order room service and I can say the chicken burger I ordered was without doubt the worst I had ever had anywhere. The bun was rock hard and the chicken was mushy and tasteless. The food menu was also relatively expensive in our opinion.

The standout contribution was from the resident Tuk Tuk driver who took us to the botanic gardens (well worth a visit), and later took us to a restaurant in town for dinner. He was fantastic.
title: Not a 5 star experience

ownerResponse/text:
Thank you for your thoughtful feedback. We’re delighted to hear you enjoyed our warm welcome, attentive service, and breakfast offerings. Your insights on the room and dining experience are valuable, and we’re continuously working to enhance our guests' experience. We hope to have the opportunity to welcome you back in the future.

Best Regards
The Kings Pavilion Team
placeInfo/address: 4/22 Galkanda Road Aniwatta, Kandy 20000 Sri Lanka
roomTip: Avoid booking half-board
text:
This hotel is quite difficult to review because in most soft product aspects it is absolutely excellent but the hard product (room) and the pricing of alcoholic drinks really let it down and make it seem poor value for money when compared to other high end properties we stayed at. For example the Anantara Peace Haven, which many reviewers feel has high prices for food and drinks, charges about half as much for cocktails and other alcoholic drinks and we found the prices there very fair compared to Kings Pavilion.  

We arrived to a really lovely welcome with a cold towel and welcome drink.  We were promptly shown to our room and enjoyed the welcome amenities including chocolates.  When we wanted to go to Kandy the staff quickly organised a very good and inexpensive tuk tuk driver for us and reminded us of the requirement for  covering up at the Temple of the Tooth which was very kind and welcome information.  

The turndown service was also excellent.  We received more chocolates and beautiful towel art decorated our beds which was a lovely surprise.

When we went to dinner, again staff were very engaging and kind. However, being on half board meant  having a very limited menu to choose from.  Drinks other than Fanta or Coke were outrageously priced for Sri Lanka. In nearly 3 weeks travelling through Sri Lanka staying at high end hotels all along, prices here were by far the highest.  Needless to say we stuck to soft drinks.   Although the food was good, I would advise against taking the half board option, as you are stuck with a limited choice and very high drinks prices.  By leaving it open where you have dinner you could still choose to eat here and have the full menu to select from.

Breakfast was very good and we were offered a second helping of any fruit or breakfast items that we particularly liked - this again was great service.

Our room was a suite and located in a separate building behind the main structure.  The bathroom was huge and very well appointed, but the room itself was a bit of a let down.  While large in size, the pieces of furniture did not seem high quality and were mismatched.  The room itself reminded me of a motel room somehow, the decor seemed poorly finished and the door seemed old and had a huge gap at the bottom which allowed a large caterpillar to gain access during the night. All in all the least impressive room we had during our trip and the only hotel were I felt that bugs could easily get into the room. The staircase that leads up to this annex was overgrown with plants. While I largely avoided getting bitten by mosquitos in Sri Lanka, I did get a few bites here.  The patio area outside our room did not look inviting either, it wasn't paved but you walked out onto soil and a small amount of grass, there was no view to speak of. It is possible that other rooms offer a better standard as they seem to be of individual character and some seemed to be looking out over Kandy. However, the greedy drinks prices alone would deter me from staying again.
title: Poor value for money

ownerResponse/text:
Thank you for choosing Kings Pavilion and for sharing your thoughts with us. We're delighted to hear that you appreciated the cleanliness and towel arrangements at our hotel.

We sincerely apologize for the inconveniences you encountered with the breakfast timing and storage options. Please know that your feedback is invaluable to us, and we are taking steps to enhance these aspects. We are dedicated to making your next visit not only meet but exceed your expectations, ensuring a truly memorable experience. Thank you once again for helping us improve our service.

Best Regards
The Kings Pavilion Team
placeInfo/address: 4/22 Galkanda Road Aniwatta, Kandy 20000 Sri Lanka
text:
We are a family of six with four kids aged 8, 10, 12 and 14 and traveled Sri Lanka for 13 days. The Kings Pavillion was our third hotel - and, unfortunately, the least excellent one during our holidays. 
The service was fine and friendly but not as welcoming and heartful as in other destinations. One morning, we had a really tight timing and let every one know in advance so the staff could prepare (we wanted to pre-order which we were told was not necessary). When we arrived at 7 am for breakfast as announced - no one was there and it took another 15 minutes before we could finally start breakfast. 

We had two junior suites; they were perfectly clean and we really liked the animal towel contructions! :-) 
However, there was only one small cupboard in our room with no room for hanging longer clothes, like dresses. 

The food was good but not exceptional - small surprise: butter and jam for breakfast were single-packed products. We did expect more in a 5 star hotel (which was confirmed by what we got in other places we stayed).
title: Everything was fine but nothing special!

placeInfo/address: 4/22 Galkanda Road Aniwatta, Kandy 20000 Sri Lanka
text:
Having just stayed at Horathapola Estate and Water Garden Sigiriya, The Kings Pavillion is a disappointment.

Despite the elevated position in Kandy, the views are less than expected.

Also, the view from the “infinity pool” is missing as tall flowers block it.

The staff are unnecessarily over attentive.

Food is tasty, although the menu options are limited. Restaurant prices exclude taxes and service charge which were for our stay 30%!

Rooms are large & comfy, but lighting is poor for reading after dark.
title: Disappointing

Whilst apologizing for any inconvenience, we assure you that all points highlighted by you will be treated with highest priority and steps will be taken to further improve the overall experience of our valued guests.

placeInfo/address: 4/22 Galkanda Road Aniwatta, Kandy 20000 Sri Lanka
text:
Pros: Our room was beautiful. Stayed in the kings suite and the bathroom was huge and luxurious although not a great shower. Great outdoor patio and a comfortable bed.  Very pretty, spacious and well appointed. Staff was friendly and tried hard.
Cons: the food was highly mediocre, not what one would expect from such a highly rated hotel. We fortunately found Theva restaurant which was so delicious and much prettier. The most annoying factor was the GM  who hovered while we ate and frankly I didn’t need an audience while I dined. 
The pool is tiny and cold and there is no gym.
I believe there are superior places to stay in Kandy.
Would not return or recommend.
title: Amazing room - crappy food

placeInfo/address: 4/22 Galkanda Road Aniwatta, Kandy 20000 Sri Lanka
text:
This is a stunning boutique hotel with 9 rooms (4 were occupied during our stay). All materials used are excellent quality and the soft furnishings and interior design are exquisite. The views are wonderful and the location is good. 15 or 20 mins walk to centre or a 2min tuk tuk ride.
Unfortunately the staff whilst super friendly are just not good enough. We left our room at 10am to return at 14.30pm  to find that the 1 guy doing the room service hadn't had time to service our room. There is  no gym. The pool is small and only 4 loungers. The breakfast is acceptable but nothing special. We have stayed in 5 different 4 or 5 star hotels during our stay in Sri Lanka so far and whilst this was the nicest room (we had the King's suite) it was the most expensive and I think you can find equally nice for a much cheaper price. This hotel needs to tweek its staff and services/facilities to merit the price tag.
title: Stunning hotel but overpriced
