ownerResponse/text:
Dear Guest,
Ayubowan!

Thank you for your review of Aditya and your feedback. 

Please allow us to apologize for the short comings that you have experienced. At Aditya meals are custom prepared to each guest’s requirement off our ala carte menu and is freshly prepared at the time of order which takes least 25 to 30 minutes depending on what our guest choose. 

Further as there were eight guests in your group who had requested for a variety of dishes it had taken slightly longer than our standard serving time as all the dishes are served together. 

We will make note of your comments regarding the food preparation time and take measures to rectify this. 

With regards to your valuables we have conducted and inquiry into this matter and it was brought to our attention that you had informed our front office staff of the loss, who thereafter made all efforts to find the missing item including asking our housekeeping staff to make a thorough search of your room.

We are sorry that you got the impression that we were not interested. This we assure you was certainly not the case and perhaps our front office staff had not adequately communicated this to you.

With regards to your comment of Aditya not being an adults resort we would please like to say that we have never positioned our self as an adult resort. We are an exclusive private luxurious boutique property that welcomes everybody.

Unfortunately, there is not much that we can do about the tides which make the sea dangerous to swim in at certain times of the year. In fact almost the entire western cost is not swimmable at this time of year.

Once again we apologize for any inconvenience that we have caused you and we hope that you will return and give us another opportunity to treat you to the perfect holiday.

Warm Regards,
Shami & the Aditya Team
placeInfo/address: 719/1 Galle Rd, Hikkaduwa 80000 Sri Lanka
text: The décor is uber cool but it is rather soulless. If you partake in that old fashioned habit of reading a book you will not be able to do so in your room without a head torch. Service times at meals are a bit haphazard - 45 minutes to produce breakfast. We suffered a theft from our room of some 'fake' diamond earrings of very small monetary value but still annoying. The hotel management wasn't interested. The poor thief must have truly disappointed having assumed he/she had won the lottery. This is certainly not an adults only hotel as other reviewers have questioned; many guests during our stay were families with toddlers - not a problem for us. It is a full 25 minute auto rickshaw ride from Galle Fort. Swimming in the sea is out of the question in August.
title: Could do better

ownerResponse/text:
Greetings from Aditya! 
Thank you for sharing your feedback. We are disappointed that we were unable to live up to your expectations during your stay with us. we hope to have another opportunity to welcome you back. 
Warmest wishes,
Shami and the Aditya team
placeInfo/address: 719/1 Galle Rd, Hikkaduwa 80000 Sri Lanka
text:
After reading all of the glowing reviews on trip advisor I had quite high expectations of the Aditya which it unfortunately didn't live up to. 
Whilst the rooms are spacious, I'm not a big fan of the bathrooms which are partially open to elements and meant a constant battle with mosquitoes (unfortunately they make a bee line for me no matter how much repellent I have on) and also means the room is a sweat box after the cool of the bedroom (especially not great when you are trying to dry your hair with the hairdryer). It would be so easy to have the room fully enclosed so I'm not sure what the design theory was around leaving them exposed. 
The bedroom and living area smelt a bit damp and the lighting is dreadful so as soon as the sun sets the room is dim at best. We also found the food average with no Sri Lankan dishes other than breakfast on the menu.
On the positive side, the beach side location is stunning and I think it’s a great idea to be able to order breakfast any time of the day – it’s nice to work to your own holiday lie in schedule! Also the general staff (housekeeping and room service) are excellent.
One small tip, don’t ask reception to book your tuk tuk transport – its double the price. Just walk up the drive and flag one down from the busy main road.
title: Little bit disappointing.

ownerResponse/text:
Ayubowan!

Thank you for your review of Aditya! We’re happy that you liked the ambiance and all the comforts of Aditya. 

We apologise that your breakfast at Aditya did not meet expectations. At Aditya, we try to offer the utmost flexibility in your holiday, and this includes mealtimes, which is why, instead of buffets, meals are custom prepared to each guest’s requirement. We will make note of your comments regarding the food and take measures to rectify this. 

We hope that you will return and give us another opportunity to treat you to the perfect holiday.

Warm Regards,
Shami & the Aditya Team
placeInfo/address: 719/1 Galle Rd, Hikkaduwa 80000 Sri Lanka
roomTip: See view suites
text:
When we visit Srilanka last month, we stayed in this hotel. Mainly my wife loved the decor and hotel ( based on pictures)
When we visited the hotel, we realised that the hotel is amazing ,different to many other hotels. Beautiful, massive rooms with jacuzzi .

But when it comes to food,,,,,
We wanted to have breakfast and lunch,,,,,
For breakfast had no buffet, we got to choose few dishes from a very limited menu, 
I choose some English dishes and my wife ordered srilankan dishes,,,
Food was terrible, specially srilankan food,,,,
Hoppers were burnt ( I sent one back, real charcoal ) curries were tasteless, simply really dissapointing ... We had some really nice food from some local restaurants.

Finally we went out for lunch,,

But food price, I saw the most expensive food at this place from all the hotels I visited

As a summery, great place, nice rooms, dissapointing food...
title: Great hotel, dissapointing food

ownerResponse/text:
Ayubowan!

Thank you for your review on Tripadvisor. We value any feedback that we get and hope to work on this to improve Aditya, which mainly targets guests who would like a relaxing and quiet holiday. 

We regret that you didn’t enjoy the food as most of our guests do and will definitely work on improving this.

The plunge pools are usually a welcome break in the balmy southern climate, and we are sorry that you found it too cold for your liking. 

Unfortunately, there is not much that we can do about the weather and the tides which make the sea dangerous to swim in at certain times of the year. 

We are glad that you enjoyed the service however and it was a pleasure to have had you with us.

Warmest Regards,
Shami & the Aditya Team
placeInfo/address: 719/1 Galle Rd, Hikkaduwa 80000 Sri Lanka
text: I know this place is supposed to be amazing and it was our most expensive hotel, but it didn't have the personality of any of our previous guest houses, the food wasn't as good as 3 other hotels that were cheaper, there was only one treatment room which got booked out quickly, the jacuzzi was freezing and we only went in once and had to jump out after 3 testing minutes and the beach is too steep a shelf of sand to swim off without rip tides. Not even the locals swam in our section of the sea. When we got the bill for our food, it just didnt feel like good value.
title: Overpriced sterile luxury

ownerResponse/text:
Ayubowan!

Thank you for your review of Aditya. We value your praise and criticism of the hotel as we constantly attempt to improve ourselves.

We are glad that you enjoyed the food and service as well as the rooms and the facilities.

We regret that you did not have a good night’s rest because of the stray dogs. This is a recent issue and we are working with the authorities in order to remove them without causing any harm. With regard to the pillows however, we understand that our guests have different preferences and, with this in mind, we have available a pillow menu in each suite, so you can choose a pillow of your liking. The menu includes down pillows as well.

The Shanthi suites offer a view of a courtyard and we will change our literature in order to give our guests a clearer idea of what to expect and thank you and other guests for bringing this to our notice.

The red flag has been put up as the sea has recently been too rough to swim in and we would like to ensure our guest’s safety. We also follow Health and Safety standards that are set out by our travels partners to ensure that guests are safe.

We apologise for the issues that we had with the wifi signals when you stayed with us. We made all attempts to rectify this as soon as possible.

We hope that you will return to Aditya and that you will be able to enjoy a more relaxing holiday with us.

Warmest Regards,
Shami & the Aditya  Team
placeInfo/address: 719/1 Galle Rd, Hikkaduwa 80000 Sri Lanka
roomTip: To avoid the view from the rooms to the side of the hotel, chose a sea-view suite rather than a garden suite
text:
Having read a number of highly positive reviews, I was expecting luxury and perfection. To be honest I was a little disappointed. There was certainly luxury in spades, and friendly, attentive service. But there were some things missing that I would have expected from a resort pif this calibre.
Good points:
* Attentive management
* Great service
* Luxurious and massive suites
* Quiet pool & beach
* Delicious cuisine

Bad points:
* Difficult to sleep – hard kapok filled pillows & dogs barking all night
* View from the bedroom
* No swimming in the sea – red flag, no lifeguard
* WiFi intermittent at best (often non-existent) until fixed after 2 days of complaining
* The bathroom is outside the air conditioned bedroom, so it was hot and humid and at night infested with mosquitos 

It's a shame, because the hotel had all the makings of a top rating, but was let down by a few design faults.
title: Fabulous boutique resort hotel - but a little disappointing

ownerResponse/text:
Ayubowan!

Thank you for taking the time to review Aditya!

We are glad that you enjoyed the ambiance and the food. However, we regret that we could not make your stay more special. 

To address the issues that you have mentioned in your review:

A flat rate for all rooms were based on a request from your host in order to make the reservation and payment process easier for her guests. Sea view rooms are sold at a premium when compared to the garden view rooms since the former have a better view. We had also, at that point, advised that the guests be informed that the different suite categories were available. The rates were also discounted since 10 suites were to be booked and then a per night rate calculated based on the special offer of stay for 4 nights and pay for 3. Your stay was subsequently shortened to 3 nights, but we still upheld the same rate as a measure of goodwill. We regret that this miscommunication has taken place between you and your host. 

Perhaps the drive from the airport would have been faster if the driver had been advised to take the expressway in order to get to Aditya. The drive from the airport to Aditya via expressway takes a maximum of 2.5hours. In the near future, the airport expressway will be connected to the Southern expressway and travel time from the Airport to Aditya reduced to 1.5 hours.  

While we regret to know that your stay in your suite was not comfortable, you were allocated one of the more requested Shanthi suites, which has the galaxy lights on the ceiling and is enjoyed by a majority of guests. The bathrooms are open air and have fans fitted in them in order to avoid them getting too warm. 

We are extremely apologetic about the flooding of the toilets and the inconvenience it caused. The situation occurred due to a rather unusual problem of a pen being stuck in the drain. Back to back bookings of the room did not allow us to delve deeper into the problem, but it was fixed as soon as possible and we apologize wholeheartedly for the inconvenience.

As you have mentioned, our staff is very obliging and our housekeeping team is highly trained. All the bathroom linen is in white and therefore you may have been misled between the bath mats and the towels. 

A remote control is provided in the room and guests usually set the temperature according to their preference. We noticed that the only issue with the air conditioner was that the temperature of the room was higher than our usual setting.

Pest control for mosquitoes is carried out on a regular basis and mosquito repellents are provided in all rooms and plugged in during turn down service every evening. Mosquito nets are also available on request.  

Once again, we are extremely sorry that you did not find perfect respite at Aditya, which is what we strive to provide for any guest. We hope that you will visit us again. 

Warmest Regards,
Shami and the Team
placeInfo/address: 719/1 Galle Rd, Hikkaduwa 80000 Sri Lanka
roomTip: Simple - insist on a sea view room.
text:
There are highs and lows to this resort but sadly we experienced more of the lows. We were there in a large group and paid US$275 per night for our room - we stayed for 3 nights.

The Highs:

- Once through the gate the setting is great and pool very nice
- Food very good and reaonably priced
- Staff very obliging

The Lows:

- It takes 3 hours to get there from Columbo airport
- The sea view rooms are bright and airy, the garden rooms are not. We were allocated a garden room which was gloomy and a bit foisty with a large mosquito population. The toilet flooded our bathroom a few times before we were moved to another gloomy garden room.
- Maintenance and housekeeping could be better. They used the bath towels to mop up the toilet flood, our air con failed and a few guests had to get the room safe fixed.
- The room design is flawed. There is no decent dressing table mirror in the aircon part of the room and the bathroom is like a sauna making it hard to dry hair and apply make up. Also very short on draw and hanging space.

We felt the room prices should have been around $150 to $180 per night and would have ranked it higher at this price point. Also had we been allocated a fully functional sea view room our opinion would have been better. Do consider the long drive from the airport if you are considering Aditya for a long weekend.
title: Not Quite Right

ownerResponse/text:
Dear Guest,
 
Thank you for your valuable comments about Aditya. and it sure was a pleasure having you with us. 

To answer a few points you made about the suites and its availability, Sagara suites, which  have a sea view, are sold at a premium and guests are often not hesitant to pay a higher price for this added luxury. Usually we do not offer free upgrades if we have them available. 

The four course meals served at Aditya are competitively priced and are as we hear often, exceptionally good; some of the finest in the area.
 
We appreciate your  comments about our service. We pride ourselves on our service that is personal but not intrusive so as to allow our guests to feel the privacy that we have promised them. Staff is always at hand to cater to your requests. 
 
Aditya is an ideal location for relaxing and unwinding. We sincerely hope that we, at Aditya, did not fall short in this regard.
 
I have a very fond memory of having a chat with you in my office during your stay at Aditya and wish to convey my regards and wish you success in your business.
 
Thank you
Aditya
placeInfo/address: 719/1 Galle Rd, Hikkaduwa 80000 Sri Lanka
roomTip: Stay in Sea facing room.
text:
This is a good boutique hotel near Hikkaduwa.  Expensive & less value for money overall.
Hotel has been designed aesthetically but does not have anything exceptionally different 
Few things which disappointed me are as following:
1. Little value of money: I think they are over priced for the rooms or decor they offer to the guest. They charged me $350 approx for a room when hotel had only 2 rooms occupied. I was booked for a room which was  $300 approx exclusive breakfast which was not sea facing. For sea facing room 'Smudra', they asked me to pay $50 additional when almost 90% hotel rooms were unoccupied. 
2. Less personal: Since it is boutique hotel with 12 rooms only & if you paying almost $ 350 a night, one would expect a hotel manager to at least come & greet/meet you for basic courtesies of asking how the guest is doing. Never happened. 
3. Food prices are way above in comparison to other similar hotels. A meal for two would cost you approx $150-200.

What I liked in the hotel are:
1. Great food: Didn't meet the chef, but food was excellent. Very well prepared food, delicious & extremely well presented. 
2. Restaurant Staff: Staff at restaurant was very courtesies & extremely attentive.  
3. Great view of ocean: View from the room was really good. It has huge balcony & view to ocean is very nice

They need to work on personalization of services for the guest & little bit on the prices. Value for money seems to missing. The upgradeable room with extra $50 each night still hurts as hotel had less than 10% occupancy. They need to be more accommodative to guest needs & desires rather than always thinking of money. 

Overall great hotel for relaxing for good 3-4 days. Food superb.
title: Less value for money overall - but great food

placeInfo/address: 719/1 Galle Rd, Hikkaduwa 80000 Sri Lanka
text:
We came from the Villa Bentota to Aditya and spent most of the time wishing we hadn't moved.  The Aditya is an ok hotel but worth about a quarter of the price it charges.  We started in a room with no view and a passageway used for (as far as we could gather) delivery lorries, rubbish bins and air conditioning units running alongside it.  After an evening here we moved (at additional, although discounted cost) to a suite that was far fancier, split level and with a fabulous view.

Both rooms, however, suffered from bathrooms that were completely open to the elements (I don't know if they have rooms without this feature).  While this might look exotic when you first see it you quickly realise some of the downsides...no temperature control and absolutely full of mosquitoes.

The other major disappointment was the plunge pools that each room, I believe, have.  Again, a fabulous enticement in a brochure but a freezing cold (again no temperature control) plunge pool isn't what you want unless it's sweltering outside and otherwise you are paying for a fancy feature you don't use.

The food was fine but not great and very pricey, as was Aditya in general.  It is also about 30 minutes from Galle so not great for sightseeing and the beach outside is almost non-existent (a very steep drop down to the sea caused by treacherously strong current) so you are confined to the (average, not overly new/clean) pool.

We have a large number of friends who have since been to Sri Lanka and have stayed at nicer, far far cheaper hotels.
title: Not fabulous.  Very expensive.

text:
We came here with high expectations but were disappointed with the food and the service. 

The sri lankan section and the desserts were exceptional, but the rest of the food was very lacking. The flavours were not there. We usually eat out at high end restaurants in colombo, and i have to say this buffet doesn’t compare to the likes of Kingsbury and Shangri- la and cinnamon lakeside.

text: Service out of this world, but food is a total let down. Quinine restaurant buffet is what could be termed well below for a star class hotel. Clumpy wads of batter fry, which is supposed to be tempura prawn, cold unappetising hard dumplings which is never filled, funny tasting cold cuts of meat. Bland Indian curries, overpowering Italian pizzas, the list could go on and in. I felt so sorry for the very friendly service staff, right from the courteous doorman staff to the reception and the ever helpful restaurant staff excepting the kitchen staff who were never with a smile. Very very classy Gatz bar, a must go, to such a well spent investment, is a world class product, making me proud to be a Sri Lankan.
title: Quizine needs to strat living upto expectations

ownerResponse/text:

Thank you for this kind review.

I'm glad to note that you found Wallawwa to be a pleasant stop before your adventure in Sri Lanka.
