placeInfo/address: Minuwangoda Road, Kotugoda Sri Lanka
text:
The Wallawwa is indeed a wonderful colonial boutique hotel (at a price, that is). We arrived today in the booked Garden Suite which is very wel decorated. Surroundings are very pleasant.
However: the terrace belonging to the suite has no comfy chairs but you have to sit very uncomfortably on a corner-bench and there is no table at all. So don’t count on sitting at ease with a book or your laptop. What a pity that we had to remove 2 starts out of five.
title: No comfort while sitting on the terrace.

ownerResponse/text:
Dear Nicky,

Thank you for your review. Whilst we’re happy with most of your feedback of the Wallawwa, we are disappointed that your stay was not as wonderful as your visits to our sister hotels, Camellia Hills and Kumu Beach.

As you may know, the Wallawwa is an 18th century manor house that was transformed to an 18-bedroom boutique hotel, just over 10 years ago, preserving the colonial style and atmosphere of the 200 year old building. In contrast, Kumu Beach and Camellia Hills are both newly built properties, and hence are more contemporary in style and architecture. This could perhaps be one reason why you felt a difference in character between the properties.

A majority of our guests who have stayed at the Wallawwa, have praised it for its beautiful setting, fabulous food and stylish rooms, and ironically have regretted staying for just a night!

That being said, we too, have noticed a couple of cracked tiles inside and outside the pool, and due to the time duration it takes to replace the tiles (a couple of days from emptying the water in the pool and leaving the tiles to dry) the management have scheduled the maintenance work for the off season in May/June.

We’ve also noted your comments on the menu prices and the level of service and will ensure the service levels are up to the same standard as the rest of the Teardrop collection.

Finally we thank you for choosing to stay with us and wish you a safe journey onward.

Best regards,
The Wallawwa
placeInfo/address: Minuwangoda Road, Kotugoda Sri Lanka
text:
My husband and I stayed at this hotel for one night before flying back to the UK.  It was lovely to arrive here, after a gruelling four hour car journey, and know that we would have to drive only twenty minutes the following day to get to the airport.

The hotel is tucked away and it is quiet.  Both good things.  Possibly if you come here first, upon arriving in Sri Lanka, you might be impressed by the layout of the hotel.  However, arriving there from Camellia Hills, possibly one of the most fabulous places in the world, I was a touch disappointed.  The swimming pool is adequate, but a little tired looking, with quite a few cracked tiles.  The restaurant was okay, but the prices were high.  Our room was fine and the bathroom was really huge and lovely.

This is an okay hotel is spend a night in, but I would not think it had enough going for it to want to stay three or even two nights.
title: Useful for the airport

ownerResponse/text:
Dear Ellen,

Thank you for reviewing us. We’re glad you liked the setting of the hotel, yet we feel a little hard done by your comments regarding the fogging and mosquito treatment.

As you witnessed, The Wallawwa is surrounded by over 6-acres of lush tropical gardens. Whilst this gives the hotel a beautiful atmosphere and feel, unfortunately it also attracts many bugs and insects including mosquitos. Fogging and pest control, although unappealing, is common and frequently carried out in environments such as ours, in order to prevent the mosquitos from being an annoyance to our guests.

Nonetheless we entirely agree that conducting fogging without informing any of our guests would be unethical and very unprofessional. It is for this reason, the team at Wallawwa stick to 3 methods of notifying our guests on the day the pest control has been scheduled. After discussing this matter internally, I can confirm that all 3 procedures had been carried out on the day you stayed with us. They are as follows – 
1. Informing the guest upon check-in regarding the pest control and fogging time (applies only if check in is on the same day).

2. Placing a letter in each room informing the guest of the mosquito treatment and fogging time. It reads as follows –
Dear Guest,
Welcome to the Wallawwa Hotel and thank you for choosing to stay with us.
Today we carry out our weekly mosquito treatment between 16:30 Hrs to 18:30 Hrs.
There will be no harm to the human body during the fogging period. So please feel free to use any of our facilities as usual.
I do apologise for any inconvenience. Please kindly speak to our Duty Manager or myself if you need further information.

3. Placing a note near the pool area that says “Pest Control in Progress” one hour before start time.

I would also like to share a short note from the Pest Control Agency regarding the composition of the fog used -

As per the discussion we had with our supplier, the level of toxicity for short exposure is minimal or negligible. Please find the following facts.
 
• This product is specifically used for the thermal fogging purpose registered in Sri Lanka under Pesticide Act of 1980.
• The dosage of chemical used per liter is very minimal (20 ml of chemical per 1 Liter diesel).
• The product is registered under Sri Lankan Pesticide act and being used by the Government authorities and pest control companies in Sri Lanka.

We sincerely apologise for the trouble you had with the coffee maker. Although housekeeping had checked the coffee machine during turn-down service and did not find any leaks, we still take full responsibility for this issue and will ensure the coffee makers are up to working standard. I would just like to confirm that it took approximately 5 minutes to replace the coffee machine (as per CCTV records). 

Linen replacement is an ongoing task where linen in poor condition is discarded and replaced with new linen. We have addressed this matter internally and the housekeeping team have been informed to ensure the linen is always fresh and crisp, otherwise, to be replaced if we find it to be a little tired.

Once again, I apologise that we could not make your stay perfect and hope the above justification will help to better understand that we meant no harm or disrespect to our guests during the mosquito treatment. If you have any additional feedback, please be kind enough to email me on mustafa@teardrop-hotels.com

Best regards,
The Wallawwa
placeInfo/address: Minuwangoda Road, Kotugoda Sri Lanka
text:
We stayed on our last night in sri lanka. It is a very pretty hotel however....
While relaxing at the pool on a Friday at 4:50 pm they sprayed/fogged for mosquitos completely polluting the air and making it impossible to breathe. The worst part was they didn’t warn the guests to take shelter and we had to breathe in the toxic fumes, all the while they insisted that it wasn’t poison. If not poisonous, how would it kill the bugs. 
The coffee maker in the room wasn’t working, leaking everywhere and when asked for a new one it took 15 minutes to get another one that also didn’t work. The person who came to replace it had difficulty plugging it in when all he had to do was move piece of furniture, which i ended up doing. This was most unpleasant, given we had to leave the hotel by 5 am. The sheets were like sand paper, very rough and uncomfortable, not something one would expect from a supposed high end hotel. We are so sorry we ever stayed there, making our last night of a beautiful vacation most unpleasant and uncomfortable. I’d suggest you find a better place to lay your head.
title: Beautiful setting and thats it

ownerResponse/text:
Dear Guest,

Thank you for your comprehensive review of your stay at the Wallawwa. As much as we are delighted with some of your comments, we are also saddened to hear that your visit did not live up to the mark. We are constantly aiming to improve and thanks to your detailed feedback we are able to address your points with the relevant departments. We’d like to apologise for any inconvenience and hope you appreciate reading our response.

As you rightly mentioned, the Wallawwa is surrounded by acres of lush tropical gardens which in turn is also home to many birds, butterflies and unfortunately some creepy-crawlies. We do our best to ward off insects from getting inside the rooms (via scheduled pest control visits) however sometimes they do manage to find a way in. That being said, we agree that it is not pleasant for anyone to spot a cockroach at 2 in the morning or get bitten by ants by the pool and hence we will request the pest controller to focus more on the concerns raised.

Similarly, with regard to the mosquitoes, fogging is conducted on a weekly basis to prevent them from being an annoyance to the guests. Your comment has been duly noted and the hotel will monitor the situation carefully. When required, the frequency of fogging will be increased to twice a week. 

Our jungle pool has been praised numerous times for the serene atmosphere and shade it provides. We’d like to maintain that ambience but do apologise that it did not appeal to you.

Your comments on the room, bathroom and communal areas have been acknowledged, and you may be happy to note that the management plans to implement a soft refurbishment of the hotel in the coming months.

Thank you for your excellent feedback on the food and restaurant as well as the staff.

Our packed breakfast consists of sandwiches, yogurt and juice in addition to the cut fruits and croissants. It is against hotel policy that we allow it to be switched with dinner. We thank you for understanding.

Unfortunately the system generated invoice does not produce a breakdown with taxes. We will address this issue with the company managing the system. The airport transfer had been arranged accordingly but we admit that it was not added to the initial bill. We have already conducted a refreshment training to the Front Office team on billing procedures.

Once again we sincerely apologise for any inconvenience and hope that you would be back after the refurbishment to enjoy a better stay. Please contact me directly on mustafa@teardrop-hotels.com the next time you’d like to visit so I can ensure you are looked after.

All the best,
The Wallawwa
placeInfo/address: Minuwangoda Road, Kotugoda Sri Lanka
text:
So despite this being listed as one of Asia’s finest hotels and despit eit being part of teh same group that owns Fort Bazaar in Galle which we just stayed in -it somehow falls short 

I can’t quite put my finger on it but it didn’t hit the spot. There’s no denying this is a great location in terms of quickly getting to Colombo airport - and it’s not an airport hotel next to a mass of car parks. It feels remote and much much further away but was less than 20mins in the morning. 

The grounds are pretty but not huge - but you do feel like you’re rather in the jungle. This was one hotel we stayed in that we felt the most bitten and has led by bugs and creatures. Of course I’m not knocking nature and what can a hotel do but it was mosquito heavy and the pool area was overrun with huge and small biting ants. Not pleasant. 

Also the pool was largely shaded by trees so every sunbed was in the shade and there were nowhere near enough sun beds for guests. There are other sunbeds randomly placed in the middle of the lawned gardens but that felt odd and slightly exposed. 

The communal public spaces felt very dated and dark and therefore unused. The room was a great size but again felt incredibly dated and not in a cool way. We had a small courtyard garden which we daren’t venture into because the amount of bugs trying to get in the glass door was enough to put you off opening it. The flooring in the bathroom was wooden slatted which clearly can hide a multitude of sins including one of the biggest cockroaches we’ve ever seen that greeted us during a 2am loo break. 

In truth this should have been a stunning bathroom but it felt dated and a little grubby with mouldy black marks around the sink and shower that absolutely could’ve been cleaned better over the years. 

The restaurant was good and busy - there’s nowhere else to go! But the food as with Fort Bazaar was excellent and the staff lovely. 

One annoyance was - like most people staying here - the breakfast which is part of the cost - is included but most don’t partake as they have an early flight. We asked if we could miss that and have some sort of discount on dinner but they absolutely refused arguing they would give us a breakfast parcel. An apple and a croissant doesn’t make up for what breakfast we clearly could’ve had and I do feel hotels that don’t let you opt out and have a small discount on dinner instead are being greedy. 

Checking out was also slightly painful. We booked using a travel site but after dinner were presented with an invoice showing room and dinner (and we assumed transport as we’d pre booked airport transfer when we checked in) all combined with no clear breakdown and no tax shown plus an odd discount they’d applied to apparently match the website we’d booked with. Basically we were presented with an invoice with one amount and wanted to know how it broke down to check it was right. This created much consternation on their part and the manager was called and a whole fuss about nothing ensued. 

All they needed to do was show each item without tax to make it clear. We paid but by sheer chance mentioned the airport transfer for 4:30am the next morning to discover they clearly hadn’t done that and hadn’t charged us so thank goodness we checked. Again it would’ve been clear had it been on the invoice. 

The next morning the driver took us to the airport but was one of those drivers that has clearly been told to drive British people slowly - despite the roads being completely empty we drove at 20km/hr which made the journey painful. 

This is a great luxury chain and in a superb location - it needs the same kind of design eye that Fort Bazaar has which retains the character but ups the luxury feel. This is not a cheap hotel and needs to up its game.
title: Oddly unimpressed

ownerResponse/text:
Dear Guest,

Thank you for taking the time to provide us with a detailed review of your stay with us. We are glad you enjoyed some attributes of the hotel such as the location, friendliness of staff and convenience. Unfortunately some aspects you found just average. Your comments have been taken in a positive manner and will be discussed with the team and management. We hope to see you again during your next visit to Sri Lanka.

All the best,
The Wallawwa
placeInfo/address: Minuwangoda Road, Kotugoda Sri Lanka
text: We chose The Wallawwa as it is only 30 minutes from the airport. It is convenient, friendly and quite interesting. Rooms are adequate but not special. Restaurant is very average. spa OK. Overall a fair choice but nothing really to recommend it apart from the location.
title: First Hôtel in Sri Lanka

ownerResponse/text:
Dear Guest,

Thank you for your feedback. We’re glad you enjoyed some aspects of the hotel, but unfortunately some fell short of your expectations. Your comments regarding the food and prices have been noted and will be discussed in detail with the management. With regards to the hotel atmosphere, you may be happy to note that we have planned a soft refurbishment during the year. Nevertheless we apologise for any inconvenience and hope you will be back again soon.

Best regards,
The Wallawwa
placeInfo/address: Minuwangoda Road, Kotugoda Sri Lanka
text:
Lovely as it is, being a bit of an oasis in overcrowded Colombo, the Wallawwa is very tired and is in desperate need of an “uplift”.
The food is OK but, like the drinks and the overall experience, overpriced.
Bottom line - there are better alternatives: go look.
title: Graceful but tired!

ownerResponse/text:
Dear Guest,
Thank you for your feedback via Trip Advisor.
We are, however, extremely disappointed to receive the low score you’ve given, particularly as we are being penalised for something that is, for the most part, out of our control.
 
As I’m sure you understand, we aren’t able to predict who guests are and how they’ll behave based on their pearl earrings or school reports, and can therefore only apologise that you were disturbed by this particular family and hope that you understand that this is not the norm. Our aim is to create a peaceful and friendly environment for travellers to relax and unwind before their onward journey.
 
I’m sure, had you voiced your disapproval at the time of your stay, a member of the team would have either tried to accommodate you in a quieter area of the hotel or could have asked the family to keep the volume down. If you have any further feedback as to how you feel we can improve, or have dealt with the matter at the time, please do contact me directly on henry@teardrop-hotels.com. I’d also appreciate it if you could let me know the exact date of your stay, so I can check our daily report to see if anything has been recorded.
 
Warm regards,
Henry
 
Henry Fitch
placeInfo/address: Minuwangoda Road, Kotugoda Sri Lanka
roomTip: All of the rooms are spacious and very well appointed.
text:
First of all, I don't want to contradict any of the reviews that say this place is great. It is. A beautiful hotel, well positioned near the airport and an ideal place to start or end your tour of Sri Lanka. Delicious food, nice rooms, welcoming staff, charming grounds.

My issue with the place is that it tends to attract a certain kind of clientele. During our stay these tended to be the kind of person who felt, because they had paid a reasonably high rate, were very entitled. Whacking cricket balls on the lawn without respect for others with a  "you had better get out of my way" attitude. Organising competitive swimming races in the reasonably tiny pool as though it belonged to them and them alone. Talking in a very loud voice about their various status symbols. I think you know the type. 

Then there is Sir Bufton Tufton and his wife, crotchety-faced retirees desperate to recreate the days of the British Empire and looking down their noses at people who don't wear a tie and a blazer for dinner (or pearls in the case of Mrs Tufton).

If you are the sort of person who enjoys taking part in this  social dance, or can manage to ignore it, then this place is for you. Maybe as a couple of nights luxury in an otherwise more characterful journey around the island. But compared to the many other welcoming and friendly places we visited in Sri Lanka I would say the somewhat stand- offish attitude of the guests spoiled an otherwise tranquil and elegant place to stay.
title: Beautiful hotel, not very nice clientele

placeInfo/address: Minuwangoda Road, Kotugoda Sri Lanka
text:
We stayed here one night before taking the flight the day after. The hotel is well positioned but the prices are way too high compared to the services offered. We were not enthusiastic of the dinner after one week in Sri Lanka we have tried much better and much cheaper.
The good point of the hotel is definetely the spa where we have great massage.
title: Good position but average hotel

ownerResponse/text:
Dear Jrrob,
Thank you for your review. Whilst we're disappointed to be rated as a '3 out of 5', the feedback provided helps us to improve. 

I'm very sorry to hear about the issues you faced. I agree that it’s unacceptable that an unclean cup was left next to the coffee machine and that the shower in the second bathroom was blocked. This was clearly a mistake of the housekeeping team and we’ve already addressed this with them, so that it doesn’t happen again.

With regards to the linen, it is always, without fail, changed prior to a new arrival. While I apologise if it didn’t smell fresh, we could have easily arranged a new set for you if you’d mentioned it to a staff member at the time. As the Hotel Manager told you, we were aware of the stain on the daybed in the master bedroom, hence it being covered with a clean sheet. Unfortunately, it’s taken a while to get the tailor to reupholster the cushion, but it has now been done. I appreciate this is too late for your stay in early December, and apologise that it wasn’t done in time.

I hope you had a fantastic time in Sri Lanka and that we may have the opportunity to welcome you back to The Wallawwa in the future, to show how things have already improved.

Warm regards,
Henry
Henry Fitch, Managing Director
placeInfo/address: Minuwangoda Road, Kotugoda Sri Lanka
text: This hotel is stunningly beautiful. The grounds are magnificent and the decor if phenomenal. However, the staff needs to pay better attention to cleanliness and other details. My friend and I stayed the night of Dec. 12. in the Mountbatten suite. This suite is enormous. It has its own pool. Beautiful, large windows. Two bedrooms and living room space. That's where my compliments end. The two beds in the secondary bedroom did not smell as though the linens were clean. So I ended up sleeping in the main bedroom with my friend--not exactly ideal. There were very visible stains on a cushion covering a day bed. There was a dirty, used mug by the coffee machine. Finally, the second bathroom was unusable because the shower drain was clogged. I flooded the second bathroom and bedroom before realizing this. Management was nice, but it still doesn't take away from the fact that there were so many problems. He claimed that all of the rooms were going to get new cushions, thus the stains would no longer be a problem. That's great for future guests, but it still didn't take away from the fact that I stayed in a room with dirty cushions, dirty beds, dirty coffee cups and a clogged drain.
title: Potential to be 5-star, but ...

placeInfo/address: Minuwangoda Road, Kotugoda Sri Lanka
text: A beautiful property near the airport. Airport transfer was efficient and comfortable. The arrival experience was acceptable and the room is large and comfortable. Beauitful open air bathroom and comfortable bed. Wifi was quite weak at some spots. The food was nothing extraordinary and service was simply average only.The Spa was excellent but the aircond in the SPA is very loud hence the Spa experience is compromised.The breakfast option is average. Could be better for the price we are paying. I must say the hotel grounds are pretty and cosy. Could see the ageing but needs some more maintenance.
title: Gorgeous Boutique Resort Near The Airport

ownerResponse/text:
Hi Mike,

Thank you for your feedback and I am really pleased you enjoyed your stay at the Wallawwa. However, I am sorry that you felt the issue with the unanswered phone call detracted from the enjoyment of your stay. We are a small boutique property where all the staff members work very hard in all parts of the hotel. The levels of service are always very high and I know that a ringing phone would not remain unanswered unless all the staff were very busy. Our staff always try to help and have our guests' best interest in mind, so saying 'Very good' to a complaint was due to English being their second language and an unfortunate misunderstanding.

However, we do appreciate your feedback and will look into both these issues and we look forward to welcoming you back to the Wallawwa in the future.

The Wallawwa team
placeInfo/address: Minuwangoda Road, Kotugoda Sri Lanka
text:
We stayed one night before heading down to the south coast with some friends who arrived early from Colombo Airport. On the morning that we left, we wanted to have tea in the room but the kettle was broken. I was unable to raise anyone at 6:30am for replacement kettle (and extra towels) - tried all numbers suggested but the calls were ignored. I had to go out to find someone who could attend to this.

Our friends who had arrived earlier told us they had heard the phone ringing but no-one went near it! Charming.

The air conditioning was awful. It kept turning itself off and my wife and I took it in turn to reset it. There were no instructions in the room and we were not given a demonstration when we arrived at our room. Needed extra towels the next morning as we both needed showers before leaving.

When paying at the Restaurant after breakfast for our stay, I was asked if everything was OK and I said that we liked the food and the bedroom but found it frustrating not to be able to get to speak to anyone on the phone and the guy said, "very good".

Afternoon tea was very pleasant as was the pool.
title: Pleasant Hotel let down by unanswered call to Reception.

ownerResponse/text:
Dear Robinjn1,

Thank you so much for your feedback and we are really pleased that the Wallawwa exceeded your expectations in so many ways, in particular the staff and the dining. However, we are very sorry that the group that we were hosting that day impacted on the enjoyment of your stay. In no way did we mean to prioritise them over any of our other guests and we do take your comments seriously. We will look into how we deal with groups like this in the future as all of our guests are equally important to us. Thank you once again for your feedback and we look forward to welcoming you back to the Wallawwa in the future.

Best wishes,

The Wallawwa
placeInfo/address: Minuwangoda Road, Kotugoda Sri Lanka
text:
Was not quite sure what to expect when it is described as an airport hotel, so pleasantly surprised to find that it exceeded expectations.
After what will be quite a long flight for most Europeans, a short  transfer is usually preferable, and this was only 20 minutes. The rooms are spacious, well laid out and include a fridge with some complimentary soft drinks.
Air conditioning is standard, views are nothing special, in fact ours was not much more than 3 meters of garden and a wall.
The hotel has a good outdoor pool and mature gardens. Unfortunately, on the day of our visit, they had opened up to a corporate function (Swedish car manufacturer) so the guests were rather an 'inconvenience' whilst they gave over the gardens for afternoon tea with the 30+ delegates.
Our afternoon tea was laid out in a side room but unfortunately they had omitted to cover the food, and flies were feeding from it by the time we arrived! As I pointed out to the member of staff I spoke to, this sort of basic hygiene mistake leads one to wonder what might be happening in the kitchens.
The hotel staff were all very helpful, and the restaurant meals were very good.
In summary, could have been better, but not poor enough for me to give less than 3* rating.
title: Let down by prioritising corporate function

ownerResponse/text:
Dear Dag108,

Thank you very much for taking the time to write a review of your recent stay at the Wallawwa. We are always delighted to have returning guests stay with us and I am really pleased that you found the staff, food and setting as lovely as your previous stay. However, I am very sorry that on this occasion you found some elements of your stay not as satisfactory. Although you booked into a Wallawwa bedroom, I am very pleased that we were able to offer you a complimentary upgrade to a Garden Suite. We are looking into the concerning comments regarding the bathroom as we pride ourselves on the high quality and cleanliness of our rooms. With regards to the menu, I am sorry if you did not feel that the choice or quality was consistent with the prices, however we do ensure we use only the freshest and best ingredients and offer a wide variety of dishes to suit all tastes and price ranges.

I really hope you come back to visit us, or another of the Teardrop Hotels, one day and we can restore your faith in our lovely properties.

Best wishes,

Amy Welfare
placeInfo/address: Minuwangoda Road, Kotugoda Sri Lanka
text:
This was our second time in two years and it didn't measure up.It is still a 
Oasis in a country where you can either be wowed by your experience or also often left rather dissapointed.The staff are great,attentive and helpful,the food was tasty,the gardens lush and a highlight,a tranquil retreat but way over priced.In Asia there is a plethora of such resorts,exclusive,luxurious,excellent service in a great many countries but markedly cheaper.
The room we were given was considerably smaller and very basic..I would equate it to a 4 star hotel in a developed tourist environment,certainly no more than that,at US 288 including the rather hefty ++.We naturally drew their attention that it was not what we had two years ago.After some hesitation and "we are full" we were moved to a room that was the same to what we recalled.But the bathroom sinks,shower ie wet areas had dirt and grime..rather a turn off.The price of dinner,simple local fare,plus a couple of glasses of low end wine was rather pricey to say the least.
title: Poor value for money equation

placeInfo/address: Minuwangoda Road, Kotugoda Sri Lanka
text:
We stayed here for one night before departing from Sri Lanka - it is a lovely and gracious hotel based around an old Dutch colonial villa and gorgeous gardens. The rooms are spacious and trendy in a minimalist way. Beds are comfortable although pillows were a bit hard. A complimentary high tea is served in the afternoon, which was a lovely touch. 
Lovely pool in the gardens.
We ate dinner and breakfast at the hotel. The restaurant area is very pretty. The food is very good - best tuna I had in Sri Lanka actually cooked so it is rare in the middle. Hoppers for breakfast. 
Service is attentive and efficient. We really liked the staff who were so friendly.
On the down side we were woken up by high pitched noise  coming from our A/C in the middle of the night and once we worked out where the noise was coming from we had to turn it off and put the fan on. 
We had been warned about wifi problems when we arrived and the wifi was really bad - the worst we had come across on our trip. 
Also noticed there was no spray or insect repellant unit that you plugged in at night (we had these in other hotels) and I was woken by the sound of mosquitoes in the night.  
Finally no hot water - we understood it was solar and could take some minutes to come on but  was the same after 5 minutes.
We really liked the hotel and staff but given the rates there should not have been all of these problems.
title: Lovely hotel but some problems

placeInfo/address: Minuwangoda Road, Kotugoda Sri Lanka
text:
My family and I booked the Wallawa based on its many good reviews. We were unfortunately disappointed. We spent 2 nights there, I at the start of our 10 day trip and  the other at the end. The room we were in was infested with cockroaches. I was informed by the duty manager that the cockroaches could be coming into the room because of the rain. However, I informed him that I noticed cockroaches in the room even on our first night there, when it was not raining. 
There is also no wifi in the room and one has to come out to the dining area for decent reception. 
Our electricity tripped twice during our second night there. Again I was told it could be because of the rain. 
We had a late flight out of Sri Lanka and were hoping for a late checkout. We were unfortunately informed that the room we were in was not available and we would  either have to pay hourly rates for a replacement room, or could wait in the lounge area till our flight instead . it would have been nice if we could have been offered a room for a couple of hours to shower and change in prior to our flight, rather than being asked to pay hourly rates, especially since we had to put up with cockroaches, tripping electricity and no wifi (in the room) . 
On the plus side, the grounds are beautiful and peaceful and the food was satisfactory .
title: Disappointing

placeInfo/address: Minuwangoda Road, Kotugoda Sri Lanka
text:
Beautiful colonial style hotel with an immaculate garden. It was previously used as a government building. Nice rooms, quiet and clean, modern bathroom, mosquito net provided which was nice. We had the sri lankan options for both dinner and breakfast as we keen to try it.
Food portions were very generous but taste could be improved. Sear fish curry was rather disappointing as smelt quite strongly of fish which was not too appetising. Hoppers were served cold and were limp in texture, which was not how they should be served. Waiters were very nice and service was very good.
I got a huge mosquito bite at breakfast and a swollen foot. Remember the mozzy spray!
title: Nice gardens and good hotel overall

ownerResponse/text:
Dear Sue,
Thank you for your review. Whilst we're disappointed to be rated as a '3 out of 5', the feedback provided helps us to improve.  
We’re delighted you enjoyed your meals with us. We spend a great deal of time and effort ensuring that our food is not only excellent, but is sourced as locally as possible – much of it from our own fruit and vegetable garden.
I’m very sorry to hear that you didn’t like our bathrooms. The vast majority of our guests (as many reviews show) love the generous space, with natural light from the skylight and the double terrazzo basins and huge rainshowers. 
I can assure you that the cool hand towels provided upon arrival are laundered each and every time. Having said that, we’ve been through our collection, since this feedback, and discarded a few that had permanent stains on them. I apologise that these were even used in the first place – they should have been pulled out of circulation.
I hope you had a fantastic time in Sri Lanka and that we may have the opportunity to welcome you back to The Wallawwa in the future so you can see the changes we’ve made.
Warm regards,
Henry

Henry Fitch
Managing Director
placeInfo/address: Minuwangoda Road, Kotugoda Sri Lanka
text:
Situated only 15 minutes from CMB airport, The Wallawwa was our tour group's first and last nights' stop while touring beautiful Sri Lanka. Although the property is quiet and quaint, we felt the lodging was average at best. The guest rooms lacked ambiance with cement floors and cavernous shower floors. Furthermore, the bathrooms sported mold on the floors. Hygiene issues also included serving visibly dirty white "refreshing" towels upon arrival. We were expected to wipe these towels over our faces and hands, yet they clearly were not laundered between guests. Yuk!

The plus at The Wallawwa is the food. Breakfasts and dinners (both Sri Lankan and Western cuisine) were excellent.
title: Average Lodging with Excellent Food

ownerResponse/text:
Dear Sir,
Thank you for your review. Though we're disappointed to be rated as a '3 out of 5', the feedback provided helps us to improve and we appreciate you taking the time to share your experience with other Trip Advisor users. 

As mentioned to you in my email, we have taken all of your points on board and will make improvements to our service levels where necessary. Although it is no excuse, we were short staffed in our Welcome Pavilion on the day of your arrival and this seems to have affected the friendly welcome and departure every guest usually receives.

I hope you had a fantastic time in Sri Lanka and that we may have the opportunity to welcome you back to The Wallawwa in the future to see how we’ve improved.

Warm regards,
Henry

Henry Fitch
Managing Director
placeInfo/address: Minuwangoda Road, Kotugoda Sri Lanka
text:
The grounds and environment of this hotel are exceptional. We stayed in the Mountbatten Suite for 1 night prior to leaving Sri Lanka at the end of a 10 day visit. The room is beautiful but we were let down by the very poor service.

On arrival the reception desk was not staffed. I unloaded the bags from our vehicle and our driver left. I waited for a few minutes for someone to come and then started trying to work the phones in the back office. Eventually someone came to ask us what we wanted. Not what you expect when you are paying over $400 per night. We were then shown around our room by a "butler" who seemed oblivious to the river of water across the room caused by the A/C. I asked one of the cleaning staff if they could help with this and he and a friend arrived immediately and fixed it - they provided the best and most efficient service of our stay. One of the bulbs in the bathroom was not working either. We loved the private garden and plunge pool that came with the suite but were surprised by how dirty the loungers were and our enjoyment was curtailed by the bonfire lit outside which meant we had to leave our garden early. The smell of burning tyres was still there in the morning.

I then went to try and print out boarding passes. There was no paper or ink in the printer. I had to go to the central office 3 times to get this fixed. Four staff were in the office. The first time a lady answered the door quite quickly and asked another staff member to fix things but they didnt. On the 2 subsequent occasions I had to knock 3 times before anyone even looked up from their desks (there is a glass door so it isn't as though they couldn't see me!). I suspect I was interrupting busy people but it wasn't clear where else to get help.

The food in the restaurant was good and the kitchen clean and efficient. The waiters were however poorly trained. They were very helpful and pleasant but didn't know what they were doing. At lunch we sat down and ordered. The waiter needed to go to the kitchen 5 times to find out if food was available (it was) and then brought us the wrong thing despite me correcting him 3 times and pointing at the menu. The first thing to arrive were our drinks which took 45 minutes to arrive (4 lime sodas!).

After dinner (also excellent but with very slow service) we were offered the opportunity to pay the bill for our whole stay which I did but our waiter didn't know how to use the credit card machine. After breakfast I said to one of the red shirted staff (butlers I think) that we were leaving - they said goodbye and didn't offer to help with the bags. I therefore went down with my family to the transport booked for the airport and a member of staff came running down just as I was dragging the bags back to the car. I pointed out that the lack of staff at reception on arrival and departure made the hotel seem unwelcoming. He told me they dont staff reception and he would "pass my message on". I suggest the staff in the main office take turns greeting guests unless of course they are too senior for this.

Overall this is one of the most beautiful hotels I have been to and the food is good. Food service is slow which I can understand as everything is freshly cooked. I cant understand why 30 minutes was the quickest it took for drinks to arrive. The staff (with the exception of the staff in the main office) are friendly and kind but its clear they are poorly lead. They are insufficiently trained and the reception and departure arrangements are incompetent and leave you feeling cheated and unwelcome.
title: Missed opportunity.........

ownerResponse/text:
Dear Guest,
Thank you for your review on Trip Advisor - we’re glad you liked the architecture, peacefulness and proximity to the airport of The Wallawwa. 

We have taken on board the feedback provided and will use your comments to improve. I should, however, take a moment to explain that we are a small boutique hotel and do not promise buffet style food generally served at larger hotels around the island. In our opinion, and that of the majority of our guests, this is a positive. For breakfast we offer a fruit juice, fruit platter, tea/coffee, homemade bread and croissants and an array of additional dishes such as Eggs Benedict, French Toast and Tropical Granola with curd & honey, to name a few. All served to your table while you can sit back and enjoy the beautiful gardens.

Some of the improvements you suggest are already in progress. Mini fridges are soon to be fitted in every room and we are working hard to persuade Sri Lanka Telecom to increase our bandwidth for better wifi (which is offered free of charge throughout the property). I apologise that the connection was slow when you stayed with us.

I hope you have an excellent tour of Sri Lanka and that we may have the opportunity to welcome you back in the future to show you the improvements we’ve made.

Warm regards,
Henry 

Henry Fitch
placeInfo/address: Minuwangoda Road, Kotugoda Sri Lanka
text:
This place has beautiful architecture, a very peaceful feel and is very close (15 min) to the airport. It should be ideal for a night or two, a bit dull maybe. But the place has several issues, some of them are just very unusual or plainly not acceptable for a property at this price level:
- no refrigerator, no minibar
- nice big bathroom but no power outlet and no bathtub
- we are used to getting a fruit basked or some chocolates or a bottle of wine at arrival: nothing here
- Just soap, conditioner and shampoo in the bathroom, no other amenities
- Walking to breakfast you need to pass by the kitchen which did not look clean and neat
- breakfast was substandard. It is waiter service, no buffet. They only have one local dish (out of around 6 you can order) - and that one was not available. No ham, no cold-cuts, only one cheese (cheddar). They charge extra for several items (like cappuccino or orange juice - very unusual for a place this expensive
- Internet only works in the lobby area, does not work in the room and does not work in the breakfast area
title: Mixed feelings

ownerResponse/text:
Dear Guest,
Thank you for your review of The Wallawwa via Trip Advisor. We’re delighted you found the rooms comfortable and enjoyed our beautiful gardens and your breakfast.

With regards to your comments about the transfers, I must point out that no-one at the hotel is ‘making some extra money’ and, at present, there is no freeway into Colombo. I believe on the day you travelled into town there was a detour due to some construction work on the freeway that is being built (due to open later this year) and therefore the driver had to take you an alternative route – this, I’m sure, would have taken longer than the usual 45-60 minutes it takes from The Wallawwa to the city centre. It should also be noted that our transport rates are lower than the charges of other hotels in the city. The Kingsbury, for example, charge US$50 (approx. Rs 6,250) for an airport transfer, which is roughly the same distance as from The Wallawwa into Colombo. As you mention, we do recommend using our hotel transfers for airport pick ups and drops to ensure the driver knows exactly where he’s going and so that he will be in the arrivals hall to meet guests who pre-book this service. 

The liquor license we hold allows us to keep the bar open until midnight (extensions can be granted with prior approval), therefore I’m afraid it was not possible to serve your husband a beer upon arrival without risking losing our license and incurring heavy fines. I apologise that the Butler didn’t explain this to you more clearly at the time.

With the above in mind, I hope you feel that our team did everything they could to ensure your stay was as enjoyable and comfortable as possible and I’m sorry for any shortcomings on our side. 

We hope to have the opportunity to welcome you back in the future to improve your impression of The Wallawwa.

Warm regards,
Henry

Henry Fitch
Managing Director
placeInfo/address: Minuwangoda Road, Kotugoda Sri Lanka
roomTip: For a one night stay the cheapest rooms are very good.
text:
We, like many others chose to stay here the night instead of going in to Colombo after arriving at Colombo airport at just after midnight.
For us this was a mistake, as at this time of night the traffic is light and we could have spent 5 nights at the Kingsbury instead of the 4 we booked. The Wallawwa is everything that is described in the other reviews, the room is large and comfortable, the huge concrete bathroom I found cold and mortuary like, but this was made up for by the lovely gardens and wonderful breakfast in the  morning. Because many flights arrive and depart after midnight, we heard planes overhead before finally dozing off. Late morning we asked for a taxi to take us into Colombo - it cost 5600 rupees instead of the 3000 I had been advised, so some-one at the Hotel is making some extra money. Also the driver refused to take the freeway, so we had to suffer horrendous stop/start traffic for over an hour. 
My advice if you are going into Colombo, is just take the trip straight in  from the Airport and arrive at your Colombo address late but then you are settled. My husband wanted a beer before bed but the bar at the Wallawwa was closed and no effort was made to accommodate him. The Sky Bar at the Kingsbury is open all night, and that would have been an amazing way to start our Sri Lankan 4 week holiday. Also get your hotel to pick you up at the Airport - there is no obvious taxi rank and again we were ripped off by a driver taking us to the Wallawa. We knew that we paid too much (3000 rupees instead of probably1200 as advised by Sri Lankan friends) but we were just too tired to haggle.
title: Ripped off by transportation Costs

ownerResponse/text:
Dear Guest,

Thank you for your feedback on your recent experience in Jaffna Heritage Hotel.

your all concerns you mentioned have been noted and we will review them internally to ensure improvements We very much look forward to welcoming you again.

Sincerely,

Wijekumara Rajapaksha
Manager
placeInfo/address: 195 Temple Rd, Jaffna 40000 Sri Lanka
roomTip: Informieren Sie sich im Vorfeld, was Sie erleben möchten. Im nahen Umfeld kann man nichts unternehmen.
text:
Dem Landesstandard entsprechend ein kleines schönes Hotel. Vor dem Hotel gibt es einen kleinen Pool, welcher einen gepflegten Eindruck erweckt. 

Die Gegend an sich ist sehr ruhig. Man sollte sich bewusst sein, dass Jaffna keine Touristengegend ist. Zum erkunden des Landes muss man schon recht weit fahren.

Demzufolge finde ich persönlich den Preis ein wenig happig.
Frühstücksbuffet ist recht überschaubar, eine große Auswahl gibt es nicht.
Eine Möglichkeit tagsüber was zu essen oder zu trinken (außer  Wasser) gibt es nicht. Demzufolge muss man sich wissen zu beschäftigen.

Im Groben und Ganzen ist das Hotel für reine Übernachtungen zu empfehlen. Das Personal ist äußerst freundlich und hilfsbereit.
title: Hotel ist zum Übernachten ausreichend…

ownerResponse/text:
Dear Guest,

Thank you for sharing your feedback. I regret to learn that your experience did not meet expectations. Your all concerns you mentioned have been noted and we will review them internally to ensure improvements. We also recognize your concerns about the overall pricing, and we strive to offer value that reflects the heritage character and quality service of the hotel and we are not sure price you paid to travel agent. We strive to uphold the highest standards of hospitality, and  I appreciate you bringing these matters to our attention. Please accept our apologies for any inconvenience you encountered during your stay. 
We hope to have another opportunity to welcome you back, where we can better demonstrate the high standards of hospitality that The Jaffna Heritage is known for. 

Sincerely,
Wijekumara Rajapaksha
Manager
placeInfo/address: 195 Temple Rd, Jaffna 40000 Sri Lanka
roomTip: Ground floor rooms have slightly more space
text:
In Nallur suburb, about 500 m walk from the famous temple (and ice cream parlours) there which means it’s a bit too far to walk to railway station and market areas in city centre.
Initial reception is really lukewarm: smallish pool (with exactly 2 loungers) near the entrance hence no secluded atmosphere, not too big rooms (but comfy beds, and small balconies for the ground floor ones). However good wifi and bathroom. No hair dryers however, a shame. Staff is friendly except the tyrannic GM which holds office in the reception area, hardly welcomes the guests, and consistently shouts to all staff and in his phone calls. Might be good in his job, but creates terribly bad PR for his 3 Heritage hotels in the same street.
Impression worsens as the cook partly spoilt the set menu dinner with soup exploding from black pepper and lukewarm Lankan mains. Chinese-style mains and desserts were much better. (Note all is veggie-only, a rule from the municipality for all food sold within 1 km from the temple.) Buffet breakfast next morning, with bread, fresh fruit and Lankan stuff, was again decent. Did not eat the HB dinner for 2nd night as we had something to celebrate outside.
Overall more or less worth the 3-star price level – below e.g. Fox or Jetwing hotels in quality but also in price. Which means our experience is in line with reviews of those that have really stayed here.
title: Decent for a 3-star

ownerResponse/text:
Dear Guest,

We would like to extend our gratitude for choosing to visit us. It is with great pleasure that we receive your feedback,

It is of great pleasure to note that you've enjoyed the meals served and staff service!

Your kind complements and concern of our associate had been conveyed to team for their action.

Whilst assuring you of continued service excellence, we invite you to a returned visit of Jaffna Heritage Hotel!

With kind regards,

Wijekumara Rajapaksha
Manager.
placeInfo/address: 195 Temple Rd, Jaffna 40000 Sri Lanka
roomTip: Zorg dat je een kamer boven krijgt
text: Al het personeel is super service gericht. Locatie is goed, iets buiten drukke stad maar in de buurt van groot tempelcomplex. Alles bereikbaar met 5 min Tuktuk. De styling is leuk maar onderhoud blijft belangrijk. Sommige dingen waren niet in orde. Voor het lucht rooster in de douche zat een niet goed bevestigd netje, dus er kon van alles naar binnen, wasbak liep niet goed door. Verkleurde randen in de douche. De wifi was niet sterk genoeg of werkte zelf niet in sommige hoeken van de kamer. Aangezien dit hotel zegt 4 sterren te hebben heb ik zo beoordeeld. Wij kregen de kamer beneden naast de receptie. Kon niet meer veranderd worden. Zorg bij reserveren dat je een kamer boven krijgt. De kamers beneden hebben veel geluidsoverlast van de weg en luid pratende mensen in de receptie. Prima hotel maar geen 4 sterren kamer, wel 4 sterren service!
title: Prima hotel maar geen 4 sterren kamer, wel 4 sterren service!

placeInfo/address: 195 Temple Rd, Jaffna 40000 Sri Lanka
text: Ideally located, pleasant and helpful Manager and staff. Total vegetarian meals. A good budget hotel. Meals other than breakfast must be pre-ordered. Breakfast has a variety of Jaffna food cooked in a traditional manner.
title: A pleasant and enjoyable stay

placeInfo/address: 195 Temple Rd, Jaffna 40000 Sri Lanka
text:
It was one night stay and I must appreciate the staff's service style was very friendly, dedicated and looking for further opportunities to serve when required. It was located close proximity to the "Nallur Kovil" and easy access to the hotel. Car park exit gate was closed due to their maintenance convenience which I believe is inappropriate.

Swimming pool seemed fairly clean and average maintenance, however the hotel room's amenities were so poor, specially the bathroom cupboards, windows, towels, bedside table lamps, bed linens, hand towels, blind curtains etc.

Very interrupted sleep at night as the mattress was super uncomfortable since the hotel has joined two single beds as a double. I could find so many insects in the room which I believe the hotel must implement immediate pest control sessions urgently for health & safety of the fellow guests coming to experience this property.
title: Poor room amenities

placeInfo/address: 195 Temple Rd, Jaffna 40000 Sri Lanka
text:
hotel is walking distance to famous Nallur hindu temple. very calm and a quiet place. staff is very friendly. 
We took B&B basis, however it is totally vegetarian hotel, therefore variety of the buffet must be improved. Pool is small but good to relax after a whole day tour in Jaffna. 
Room is good, excellent water pressure in the bath rooms, however lighting needs some improvement.
title: Jaffna Tour

placeInfo/address: 195 Temple Rd, Jaffna 40000 Sri Lanka
text: The hotel is simple, nothing extraordinary but the heritage contribution is worth the mention The furnitures the paintings on the walls are worth the mention.I did suggest that a shop of paintings and furnitures would be a worthy adventure Breakfast not to the mark
title: Heritage

placeInfo/address: 195 Temple Rd, Jaffna 40000 Sri Lanka
text:
The hotel is on Temple road on walking distance to the big temple. 
The room is spacious, with a double and a single bed. Small fridge and TV with sports channels. Good WiFi..Two chairs. We had a small outside area but it was close to the road and a bit noisy. The bed was comfortable. The bathroom was very small with very narrow entrance to the toilet. Good shower. I am not sure if more corpulent people than us could cope. Our main problem was the noise caused by a kind of generator that switched on and off. Not so nice during the night.

The swimming pool is small and doesn’t look very attractive. No seats in the shade.

Breakfast was OK, with toast, cornflakes and some curry’s. No eggs (not that we missed these)
We had diner twice. We were on an HB-arrangement and had the set menu.
The first evening was a shamble. It took them ages to prepare and it opened near 19:45. They forgot to bring the rice and another dish. The curry tasted nice but the portions were too small for us. Staff didn’t look as they were in control. It was quite busy (Saturday night)
On the second evening (Monday) we were the only guests and we could use the a la carte menu. The soup was nice and so were the curries (mixed vegetable and mushroom). My wife liked the Indian dessert but that was too sweet for me.
So two totally different experiences.

The staff is very friendly and helpful, but they seemed inexperienced or somewhat shy. The language barrier is also bit of a problem.  The manager speaks English reasonable well but the other staff doesn’t.
title: Small, clean, friendly hotel. But some attention to detail would help

placeInfo/address: 195 Temple Rd, Jaffna 40000 Sri Lanka
text:
We stayed for a few nights in Jaffna for vacation.  We do not know how other hotels in the area are, but the Jaffna Heritage Hotel looks like a hotel that has had better days.  It is clean, the people are friendly, but our first room had a leakage issue (we did get a new room promptly) and the the blinds or neither the first nor the second room could be opened because the lines to do so were out of order.  The breakfast was ok, but could certainly be improved too.  When we were there they were cleaning the pool.
Now that we have been a few more days in Sri Lanka,we think the food in restaurant can be better.  e.g. the curd we had was very watery.   All this does not make it a bad hotel at all, it is a good place to stay, but do not expect excellence.   Because the hotel is near a Hindu temple they only offer vegan dishes and no alcohol.
title: Good hotel that needs some work

placeInfo/address: 195 Temple Rd, Jaffna 40000 Sri Lanka
text:
A small hotel close to the Nallur temple. The, small, swimming pool is great to cool down. The room was clean and had a good airco.
The vegetarian restaurant serves good Sri Lankaan food. The breakfast (tea, toast and jam) is a bit simple though.
title: Fine hotel to visit Jaffna

placeInfo/address: 195 Temple Rd, Jaffna 40000 Sri Lanka
text:
The Heritage Hotel is located really close to the Nallur Kandaswamy temple. The rooms are large however the bathrooms leave a fair bit to be desired. They do not have any screens so are open to the element and were filled with mosquitoes in the evening and early morning. There was also no hot water - which wasn’t a problem because it was very hot. The road outside the hotel is very busy and you’ll need a flashlight at night if you want to go anywhere. Breakfast was pretty average and consisted of cereal and toast. We didn’t eat dinner either of our two nights and chose to wander down the road to the vegetarian restaurant about 50 metres towards the temple. 

The staff were very helpful and organised a driver for us to get out and see the sights (we had a lot of rain during out stay).
title: Ok - but a long way from downtown Jaffna

placeInfo/address: 195 Temple Rd, Jaffna 40000 Sri Lanka
text:
Neat small hotel. Tiny pool l that could use some repair. The rooms are small and clean with a communal terrace. The shower water is only hot in the afternoon, cold in the morning. The bathroom was not very clean. 
The breakfast was only toast, jam and fruit, tea,coffee and fruit juice. 
The restaurant served lunch and dinner at good prices. Excellent vegetarian curries and naan bread hot from the Tandoori oven.
title: Small hotel away from the city centre

placeInfo/address: 195 Temple Rd, Jaffna 40000 Sri Lanka
text:
We stayed in the Villa, which is a separate building. The rooms are spacious, the bathrooms have a different size and maintanance. It is not possible to get it really clean. Breakfast is very sober and below average. The swimmingpool is very small and not located on the right spot (in front of breakfastroom hotel, so unconfortable to go swimming) dinner is not bad, you have a lot of choice, but it tastes almost all the same.
That is a pity because all the people working there are very friendly and helpfull. They help you were they can.  It is overpriced, and was not Negotiable. The big boss ( not the manager in the hotel) was not sensitive for our complaints about the quality, and wanted to have the full price. Due to the friendly staff we had a good stay.
title: Nice but overpriced

ownerResponse/text: Thank you for your comments
placeInfo/address: 195 Temple Rd, Jaffna 40000 Sri Lanka
text: The location of the Heritage Hotel Jaffna is good as one could walk to the Nallur Kovel (temple) and the area is interesting. The fact that the manager and staff were very helpful and friendly made up somewhat for the room that had no chair and it was impossible to hang clothes in the cupboard as the raiil is so high that not even a tall man would be able to reach it. However, it is reasonably priced and there is a swimming pool. If one does not want luxury this Heritage Hotel can be a satisfactory place to stay when visiting Jaffna.
title: Friendly hotel near the temple

ownerResponse/text:
Thank you for your comments and noted.

Definitely we will look in to your comments will improve the service.

Thank you
placeInfo/address: 195 Temple Rd, Jaffna 40000 Sri Lanka
text:
A 3 night stay in room 101. 
Pros: a very friendly and helpful manager and front of house team. Breakfasts were a more than adequate 'continental breakfast' We didn't eat in for other meals. Request for an early breakfast and lunch pack on one day, met with no problems.
Cons: the room itself was spacious enough but the furnishings are 'tired'. Little evidence that the room servicing staff ever entered the rather cramped bathroom.  Was a little surprised to find I had to produce an empty shower gel bottle to get a refill!
There is a 'small' swimming pool but only 3 loungers...wooden slats and no cushions! A few garden chairs and loungers around the pool would provide somewhere to sit other than in the room or reception!
Overall: basic and just about acceptable given the helpfulness of staff, but could, with a little effort be so much more comfortable.
title: Adequate but could be so much better

ownerResponse/text:
We apologize for the short comings at the hotel during your stay.

We have noted the short comings and taken measures to improve the service and we have briefed the team and to improve the services.

Thank you
placeInfo/address: 195 Temple Rd, Jaffna 40000 Sri Lanka
text: Jaffna is a special place to visit nowadays. Since there is peace the people have to get used to receiving tourists again. Same applies for the staff in this sympathetic hotel. Given the important temple nearby there are tight rules with respect to serving meat and alcohol. That is not a problem, since the hotel offers all kinds of dinner at a location at tuktuk distance. So there we found ourselves having a private dinner under the porch of a nearby villa. Really special, although it prooved to be rather difficult to eat crab with bare hands. Rooms are good, although it is strange that there is a balcony, but no door to reach it. Pool is rather strangely located at the front, where are the accompanying chairs? And we would rather have the staff come up with a helpful solution in stead of just saying there is no laundry service. The brochure mentioned otherwise and it turned out that the washing machine had broken down. But I guess that is part of the learning experience of the staff.
title: After the war

ownerResponse/text:
Thank you for your comments.

We will be looking  forward for your next visit to serve you better

Thank you
placeInfo/address: 195 Temple Rd, Jaffna 40000 Sri Lanka
roomTip: Rooms in the main block.
text:
this is a good place to spend your holiday/lodge in Jaffna. Acceptable level and room conditions. Many are air conditioned. Rooms with attached bath rooms. I found water runs very slowly in the shower. 
They provides south Indian type breakfast. They have supper pittu. The place is very closer to the famous Rio ice cream outlet. Hope this ll help you
title: Relax in Jaffna

ownerResponse/text:
We apologize for the short comings at the hotel during your stay.

We have noted your unhappiness and taken measures to improve the service and we have briefed the team and to improve the services.

placeInfo/address: 195 Temple Rd, Jaffna 40000 Sri Lanka
text:
We arrived late in the morning without reservation. They were still cleaning the room but were finished within a few minutes. 
At first the room seemed very nice. The bed was great and the room stylish and big. However the bathroom wasn't as clean as the bedroom. We had the feeling they forgot to clean to toilet because there were stains (urine and faeces, little but still) on it. There was some used soap on the sink. Also the toiletshower had some faeces on it. 
After we had a nice refreshing swim in the pool we wanted to take a shower. We were a bit disapointed because there was no hot water (because of the price of the hotel). 
The staff was great and the location was perfect! After all a nice hotel but not what we expected for the price they charge.
title: Nice hotel

ownerResponse/text:
Thank you for your comments.
We do apologize for the short comings during your stay at Jaffna Heritage Hotel 
We will take necessary actions to improve on

Thank you
placeInfo/address: 195 Temple Rd, Jaffna 40000 Sri Lanka
text:
I had heard about this hotel from friends who had rated this high, but frankly disappointed. The exteriors are all neat and clean, and well maintained but probably the feel good ends with that.

The air conditioning is poor and not well maintained. The bathroom is a bit more than basic, and the showering cubicle is very cramped. The TV reception is very average. The restaurant is all vegetarian, which is fine, but the food was just about average.

To top it all, their credit card machine did not work when we checked out, and lucky we were carrying cash! 

Overall a big disappointment!
title: Disappointed

ownerResponse/text:
Thank you for your comments, and noted about the shower, point taken and will correct it.
Please accept our apologies.

Further we have taken note of poor English of staff.

Thank you
placeInfo/address: 195 Temple Rd, Jaffna 40000 Sri Lanka
text: This was the most basic hotel on our trip to Sri Lanka but that said it was still okay for a couple of nights, the shower did not always work and the staff had quite poor English but were extremely helpful just like everyone we met in Sri Lanka, the food was good and plentiful and not expensive, although the the simple vegetarian restaurant across the road served an excellent meal for 75p.
title: Basic hotel

placeInfo/address: Kandalama 21100 Sri Lanka
text:
Nice location, but needs a renovation.

Visited the hotel with a group of friends for 2 nights. The hotel staff were very attentive during the check in process and to complete all the formalities.

The hotel is situated on a large and expansive area bordering the Kandalama tank which means you get to see some wildlife around.

The rooms we got were chalets which were large and had a sitting area outdoors as well.

Unfortunately the furniture within the rooms need a thorough renovation. One of the beds we got started sagging after lying down while the furniture and tiles within the washrooms were cracked or had decayed.

A little pest control in the rooms would also be useful to get rid of geckos that are roaming around. 

The dinner and breakfast buffets had quite a lot of variety and food tasted good.

We didn't have a chance to check out the pool and other facilities as we were on the move most of the trip. 

Would return again, but it would be nice if the management paid more attention to the amenities.
title: Nice location, but needs some attention

ownerResponse/text:

placeInfo/address: Kandalama 21100 Sri Lanka
text:
We had a wonderful stay at Amaya Lake, Dambulla. The Sinhala Avurudu event was amazing – full of fun and beautifully organized. The rooms were cozy with stunning lake views, and the atmosphere was peaceful.

Ravindra and the housekeeping team provided exceptional service, and all the staff were friendly and helpful.

However, we were a bit disappointed with the dinner and breakfast buffets, as the spread was quite limited, we expected a bit more variety from a hotel of this standard.

Still, overall it was a lovely experience. Highly recommended for anyone visiting Dambulla. Thank you, Amaya Lake, for your warm hospitality!
title: Relaxing Stay, Great Staff – Buffet Could Improve

placeInfo/address: Kandalama 21100 Sri Lanka
text: The hotel has a beautiful location next to a Lake. It is peaceful and pretty. Rooms are chalet type set out in a large area, some quite a walk to the facilities. However, you can request a golf buggy as a taxi to and fro. We saw Monkies, Squirrels and one of our group saw a Snake. The rooms are a good size and have kettle, coffee, tea, hairdryer, ironing equipment, some toiletries. However, the room we were in (60) was a little tired, especially the shower; the tiles and cubicle needed a deep clean. The food was ok but never very hot. Breakfast was not great. I was especially disappointed that there was no nice bread to have with cheese etc. Only very dry, sliced bread was available for breakfast, although lovely, fresh bread was available at lunch and dinner. Cereals were basic, cornflakes and some chocolate things, which weren't very nice. The jam was fluorescent, definitely not good quality. This was a shame, as with a few tweaks, this hotel could be very nice. Overall, our stay was quite good, just disappointed with the food.
title: Part of Mercury UK tour

placeInfo/address: Kandalama 21100 Sri Lanka
roomTip: Get to dinner early to have the best selection of dishes!
text:
The good points. The location of the hotel is beautiful with large grounds overlooking the lake. The swimming pool is excellent. The staff are friendly and efficient.
The not so good points. The accommodation was the poorest and most basic we encountered in Sri Lanka and little things spoke volumes e.g. no shower gel in a supposedly freshly prepared room. A dark damp patch running around the wall of the bathroom. However the principal issue is the restaurant. It is buffet style at both breakfast and dinner; however with a number of large groups in the hotel, they descended en masse & hoovered up almost everything. Replenishment was slow or non-existent; so for later diners choice was limited. Food quality was at best average, it's the first time I've seen jelly on a dessert choice since I was a child!
One quirk that stopped me in my tracks; on Sri Lankan independence day they would not serve alcohol, so that cold beer that had been on my mind all day, turned into a Coke!
title: Room for Improvement

This hotel is getting old, rooms are tired, furniture is worn out - sit in the couch and you’re basically on the floor.
Mozzies everywhere- inside rooms and outside.
Street dogs on the property barricading you in your room.
Long waits for golf cart transportation to main lodge.

Warm regards,
Management - Amaya Resorts & Spas
placeInfo/address: Kandalama 21100 Sri Lanka
roomTip: Pack plenty of mosquito repellent creams
text:
My husband and I stayed in Amaya for a business trip.

Pros: 
1. The staff are friendly and accommodating.
2. We had buffets for every meal. Each buffet had unique and impressive dishes.
3. They offer buggy services to get to your rooms as they can be far away from the bar and restaurants.
4. A massive pool to enjoy, and they also have a tennis court.
5. You're fully immersed in nature. Great place to watch birds. 

Cons:
1. The villas are quite old and have a leaking issue. On the day we checked in, we had gotten a villa that had a serious leak from the roof while it heavily rained outside. The leak was falling directly onto the bed. Thankfully, they accommodated our request to be moved to a different villa.
2. Rooms are slightly dusty, and the amenities fall short.
3. There is no gym, which is odd since it is a resort.

Tip: There are loads of mosquitoes, so make sure to shut your doors and windows during the evening and pack mosquito repellent creams with you.

We had an okay time and
title: An Average trip

text:
Would rate this as a 4* hotel. Service in the rooms was quite slow. Rooms don’t have easy access from the reception unless you use buggy provided by hotel. For seniors, not a practical place unless rooms are close to dining area, reception etc… 
Food was good, chef very accommodating to our vegetarian needs & plenty of variety. Rooms & bathrooms are quite dated, with some of the rooms having a damp smell… location is great by the lake but it’s quite an old property

placeInfo/address: Kandalama 21100 Sri Lanka
text:
Beautiful setting, lovely trees and gardens and cheeky monkeys,.
The staff were very friendly.
The bed was amazing, so comfy and I love our hut, it was private and spacious. The bathroom however was old with stained mirror and cloudy shower glass. 
The food was pretty good, was very happy.
It’s obviously popular with families.  The pool was nice, very warm water.

HOWEVER the music. Doof doof pounding music. Ordering at the bar was hard being so loud and we couldn’t talk easily to each other. Sleeping was with earplugs and noise cancelling headphones.
I get the staff are young but this is a tranquil setting that is far from serene.
Why not ambient background music?  The noise just ruined it for me.
title: Resort not nightclub

ownerResponse/text:
Dear Guest,

Thank you for sharing your detailed feedback following your recent stay with us. We appreciate the opportunity to address your concerns and improve our services.

We are thrilled to hear that you enjoyed the culinary experience at our resort, particularly the variety and quality of our buffet offerings. However, we apologize for the inconvenience caused by the live music performance during one of your meals. Your feedback regarding this aspect has been duly noted, and we will take steps to ensure that future entertainment aligns better with our guests' preferences.

We regret any lapses in service, such as the delay you experienced in the bar area. Please accept our sincere apologies for this, and rest assured that we will address this with our team to ensure such instances are minimized in the future.

Your appreciation of our extensive and beautiful grounds, as well as the secluded swimming pool and lounge area, is heartening. We're glad you had the opportunity to explore and enjoy these amenities during your stay.

We're sorry to hear that the room assigned to you did not meet your expectations. Your feedback regarding the room features and amenities has been duly noted, and we will work to address these shortcomings to enhance the overall guest experience.

We appreciate your feedback and hope to have the opportunity to welcome you back in the future, perhaps to one of our Signature Suites, where we aim to provide a more luxurious stay that meets your expectations.

Warm regards,
Management - Amaya Lake Resort
placeInfo/address: Kandalama 21100 Sri Lanka
roomTip: Deluxe villas aren’t deluxe. Get a Signature Suite if you can.
text:
We stayed three nights on a tour of Sri Lanka and so have five other hotels with which to compare.

Firstly, the good points : the food ! The breakfast, lunch and dinner buffet was to die for ! Both Sri Lankan and western tastes are catered for, the quality is up to the standard of almost anywhere else we ate, the range of dishes on offer enormous. The semi-outdoor setting was lovely too. Apart from the incentive to grossly overeat, there was only one problem - live music on the second night, a cringeworthy easy listening repertoire delivered shockingly out of tune, which spoiled the meal. (But the following evening, a Sri Lankan folk ensemble was much better). 

Service was mostly good, but let down occasionally. One evening in the bar area (not busy), we waited 20 minutes to be served, then gave up and went for dinner.

The grounds are extensive and beautiful with birdsong punctuating views of the lake through the tall trees. A buggy service (usually very prompt) is offered for any journeys within the grounds, essential as our villa was the furthest from the main building. although sometimes it was more pleasant to walk.

 Although we never used the main pool or spa, we discovered a second, smaller swimming pool and outdoor lounge area nearer to our room, which was quieter and very secluded.

Now for the not-so-good parts : the room (no. 71). Despite being called a Deluxe Villa. I would not describe it as such - definitely the least well appointed of all our hotel rooms. Decor was tired, side of bath had a hole in it lacked a plug, nowhere to hang laundry, insufficient natural light getting into the room, so that it felt oppressive. The advertised minibar was an empty fridge that leaked. The thing I missed most compared with our other hotels was any outdoor table & chairs with the room. My wife viewed a  Signature Suite which had outdoor seating. Next time we would opt for one of those (at a considerable price premium). 

All in all, the room features let this hotel down, but if you can afford a Signature Suite it could be a great stay.
title: Great food and grounds but disappointing room (not deluxe in our opinion).
