ownerResponse/text:
Ayubowan 698udayap
Thank you for this lengthy and eye-opening feedback and thank you for taking the time to share your entire experience with us. We are very sorry to hear about the short-comings and customer service which we have looked into with immediate effect. This is definitely NOT something any of our guests should experience at our properties and we will speak to the relevant teams to ensure this kind of service is never repeated. Thank you once again for your constructive feedback and I hope you do give us another chance.
placeInfo/address: Kandalama 21100 Sri Lanka
text:
My experience on staying at your hotel is so unforgettable, it compelled me to write this review. My colleagues and I arrived at Amaya Lake hotel on the eve of 2nd of December 2022 and we stayed till 4th Sunday morning. When we arrived, we were tried from the long journey and reception welcomed us with a warm and welcoming smile. Cold towel and herbal tea offered to us certainly lift our weary spirts up and I was feeling enthusiastic of our stay at your hotel. Staff was welcoming and helpful and we were in our room (Number 324) soon. The room was clean and magnificent and at that time I was already making plans to visit here with my girlfriend for a few days of nice and relaxing vacation. Since it was late night and we were all tired, we ordered some room service and few beverages. 

The food was … well, I don’t know what to say other than it is not enough, It is amusing and shocking to realize that for a such a reputed luxury hotel, you don’t have sea food options. Only one of us ordered Chicken. But it had more bones in than actual, edible meat. It should be noted that when we received our beverages we did ask for a bottle opener and were told one is available in the bathroom. When we look for it, not only we couldn’t find it and when we called reception to inquire about it, we were told the same. “It’s in the bathroom” phrase. Your staff didn’t seem to bother to ask if we found it or need one. 

Next morning, I was stunned by the scenery of the place and spent some time by the Kandalama Lake. Hotel was full of beauty of nature and we all were impressed by it. In contrast, the breakfast buffet was rather disappointing. We knew breakfast buffet ends at 10.30 AM and arrived around 10.00 AM. We had very limited amount of food choices to make, Soup bowls are nearly empty and so is the many food items. That left me and few other guests dumbfounded. Fruit juice containers also nearly empty and someone placed wrong names on them. It could be a prank by anyone and I fell for it. I went for an orange juice and ended up drinking something unpleasant for my taste. Needless to say when I left, I was feeling rather hungry despite the fact that I just finished my breakfast.  

After that disappointing breakfast buffet, we tried to play pool. While we did have fun playing the game, it’s somehow felt we were in a confined space because information board and concrete pole sometimes gotten the way of cue sticks. I would suggest to move the table bit away. And please fix the floor or adjust the table because we did observe some of the pool balls curve their path when moving like Murli’s doosra. Also why you keep push bicycles chained? I really fancy a ride on one of those but seeing they chained I changed my mind. I can only imagine what a beautiful ride it might be if I actually took a ride. I don’t know why you do that but I really didn’t want the hassle of finding someone to unchain them. A hotel should be in my opinion, a nice, relaxing place and inviting to any to spend some quality time. Those chains, to me give different idea like “hey, we got some fun stuff to do, but you need our permission to do that”. I think I’ll pass, thank you.

Before we arrived for the lunch buffet, we were in our room and ordered a buggy to our room because we are far away to walk for lunch. Fortunately, when we left our room, there was a buggy waiting. The driver didn’t seem to care about us and was talking with the security officers nearby and then was on a call with someone else. It was clear the buggy wasn’t for us but he was kind enough to give us a ride.

Time we were at your hotel, there were few cooperate events being held and it is beginning to dawn to us even the buffet was made to match these events, regardless of other guests in the hotel. Lunch was again a disappointment. I was not very impressed with your food choices. Going out to eat is life’s simple pleasures. It’s one of the joys of life. But coming to such a highly reputed and recommended place and leaving half filled stomach and wandering why on earth someone spend so much money to feel unfulfilled is not an impression anyone wants to experience. But on the pulse side, if you see the situation as hilarious as it is to us, the mystery of the bottle opener deepened again as we were once again told by the hotel “it’s in the bathroom”. Your staff spectacularly failed to notice when we keep asking for it, there might be a bit of an issue there.

Late afternoon three of decided to go to swimming pool. Soon as we got there, it’s started to rain. Then the pool is closed. Now, I understand why many hotels or public swimming pools don’t let you swim when it rains. I absolutely have no issue with that. If it is your rule, yes it is the rule. But when one of your staff tell us “You should have come earlier” in an insulting manner. I have to ask you, is this how they treat your customers? We all felt he was way over the line with the way he speak. We payed to stay at your hotel. Not a bunch of freeloaders. His conduct was appalling. Also I have to ask, where you keep towels when someone in the swimming pool needs one. We didn’t see any available near pool area. We were wet due to rain and we had to ask for towels from the spa. Scent of the Ayurveda oil is hard to ignore on those towels but at that time they are the only one available. 

As the night falls, we went to hotel bar. Since one of our colleague is still in the room, we asked for a buggy to be sent to pick him up. We inquired about it from the staff multiple times. In the end after more than half an hour, our colleague had to walk to the hotel bar from his room (324). Needless to say the risk he was under when he was walking in the dark because I happen to see snake on road during day time and at night lights of the lamps are not enough to walk especially if your room is far away from buffet hall as ours was. Near our room, some of the lamps are not working and ones that do work, their light is clearly inefficient. While these lights dose seems beautiful, it doesn’t offer much visibility to walk. 

Your staff seems to favor foreign gusts more than the local gusts and they gave us the impression that they consider we were also the part of cooperate group in the hotel and seems fine to ignore us and our requests. When we did buy drink from the bar, we did have to ask for the bites as it seems they would not provide any if we didn’t ask for it. They even removed the ash tray on the table. Your staff at the bar can see we are smoking and we don’t have an ash tray, not bothered to provide one. 

When we went to the dinner buffet, the hall was full and supervisor there ask us to wait for five minutes. It’s only after half an hour later and hall was half empty when they remembers to call us. I wasn’t expecting mush for the dinner and again I was proven right. It is astonishing to stay in a big hotel and see no sea food, eggs or even sausages. There, we did inform the manager what a disappointment this stay has been to us. Later I saw the manager telling his staff to bring more food to the buffet as there were many empty bowls.

Back in the room we opened the liquor we brought with us and ordered some bites. This time, cashew nuts and fish were good. But the potato chips were bit damp. One who brought the food also had a bottle opener with him and but since we opened our bottles with our teeth, took it back with him. We knew of course he only brought it here because we complained to manager. At this point we asked ourselves, dose this hotel have enough bottle openers or ones that available was made of exotic material to leave in a room?  

Even before 6 AM next morning, we were awakened by ringing of the phone from the reception to inform phone line is connected. This was clearly meant for another guest but we were feeling too sleepy to point it out. Again sleep was disturbed by knocking on the door from one of your staff to deliver us water bottles that we didn’t ask for. Later I heard from the staff that the guest who ordered the water bottle actually had to walk up to reception for his order. The neglect your staff shows to your guests is appalling. 

Last morning of our stay, I am glad to say we saw some sausages. We had our breakfast, payed our bills and left. 

If anyone making plans to stay there, I tell you this. If you are a local, go there to spend the night only because to the staff there local guests not worth their time. If you are foreigner, by all means go there. It’s a beautiful place and staff is kind and friendly. You will most certainly have a wonderful time there.

Bring your own liquor and a bottle opener (just in case). Make sure ash tray is there before you smoke. The food, ah, I honestly felt more hungry there than anyplace else. Food options really needs to improve there. If you are a foody, go someplace else, this is not the place for you unfortunately. Also, please go early to your buffet. 

Another astonishing thing is that for such a big land, there was only 4 electrical buggies are available. How they manage the crowds when in full capacity is unimaginable. Some of the staff really needs to learn how to talk with local customers and how to treat them. They also needs to be more responsive, the amount of neglect and carelessness we experienced is baffling. Also if you wants to go swimming, go there before evening, unless you wants a lecture from the reproachful pool guy. Before dive in to the pool, find a towel because we have no idea where they were kept.

I should also caution you to be very careful if your room have a wooden bridge nearby. When it rains there, the wooden bridge is very slippery. I believe all of us at some time, were about to fall down there. Fortunately, none of us fell down there but the risk of injury is there. 

One of us already booked a room to stay in the hotel and after our experience, he ended up canceling the booking. I am sure many felt the same. I hope someone will look in to the things I pointed here and do something about it. But before I wrote this review, I take a look at Booking.com about your hotel. Even there, only foreigners seems to have good words to say. Isn’t that a big issue? If you only wants foreigners to serve, then ban us, the locals from going there. If not, please get your act together and address these issues I pointed.
title: Definitely unquestionably unforgettable experience !

placeInfo/address: Kandalama 21100 Sri Lanka
text:
Pros: 
- Nice location around the Kandalama Lake
- Sunsets are beautiful on the Lake
- Lots of birds, monkeys and iguanas
- Room is clean and nice
- Staff is very friendly and smiling. All the employees wear a mask. 

Cons: 
- Only buffet, no ‘’a la carte’’ restaurant.
- Not a lot of sri lankan food. Perfect place to eat a burger, pizza or pastas… That’s not what we were looking for when we are visiting Sri Lanka.
- A lot of tour bus tourists. They are playing loud music with their own radio at the pool and the staff is doing nothing. It’s next to the massage area… doesn’t make any sense. 
- Can be difficult to find a chair at the pool when all the bus tour tourists are there. 
- Some clients of the hotel don’t wear a mask at the buffet. They pick up the food from the counter without their mask and with their hands (without the utensils).  Please put more utensils at the buffet and ask everyone to wear their mask as it’s written before you enter the restaurant. 

Unless you like big resort lifestyle (buffet, crowded pool…), I do not recommend this hotel.
title: Big typical resort (bus tour, buffet, crowded pool..)

roomTip: No buffet for dinner, only a fixed menu
text:
I got there after 10 days of traveling over the country and staying in four other 4-star hotels before this one. Thus, I have a baseline to compare to. Accommodations in a good location and rooms are noise isolated. There is a shopping mall next to the hitel with a supermarket in the basement. The view to the skyline of Colombo is amaizing. I arrived in a group of 16 people. In other hotels, each piece of luggage gets a paper tag attached where the room number is written to identify the owner. This hotel doesn't use its own tags but relies on one's from previous hotels. The situation got even more messy at departure, where the luggage of our group was mixed with the ones of the other hotel guests. It cost us time to screen and segregate. Baggage handling definitely needs to be optimized and improved. The disadvantage of breakfast is the missing self-service for coffee and tea. One has to order and wait. I asked 3 different servants and had to wait almost to the end of my breakfast before I got my cup of hot milk. 
The staff was very friendly and helpful. The swimming pool was great.
title: Pay attention to your luggage at this hotel

placeInfo/addressObj/street2: Colombo City Centre Mall and Residences
text:
I had intended to spend four nights at this hotel, while touring the Colombo area. Unfortunately, due to various problems with two separate rooms (e.g., AC noise, pool music noise, mildew smell, and leaking shower), I checked out only after one night, and I moved to the nearby Colombo Sheraton. Why would a new hotel have these problems? I lowered my overall TA rating due to the room issues. I am a Marriott Bonvoy status member, so I received benefits during my stay.

Despite the problems with both rooms, this hotel is one of nicest Courtyards I've ever encountered in my worldwide travels. It's fairly new, and it's situated on the 9th through 17th floors of a shopping mall and residential high-rise. It's located within quick tuk-tuk access to Colombo's major sights. All services, including a well-equiped gym (didn't use), outdoor pool, lobby, restaurant, and bar, are located on the 9th floor. The 9th floor is impressively designed, with high ceilings and stone/marble throughout.

I used my Marriott suite certificate to upgrade to a Premium Corner room. The room was somewhat small, but nicely laid out, in a more modern Courtyard standard (e.g., not necessarily high-end, but comfortable, nonetheless). The small bathroom was only average, and I didn't like the small shower stall. The bed was super comfortable, and the pillows were great. Other than the noise, the AC worked great.

I had dinner and breakfast in the restaurant. Both were outstanding. The staff was also outstanding throughout the entire hotel, and they were so so accommodating.
title: Disappointed

text: Nice Location & nice reception at ground level bell desk. Valet parking provided  without any fuss. I came for Lunch buffet on a weekday. It was a very limited spread with soups, salads, Dishes etc, There were 2 soups but from the moment I went there Chicken soup was empty and no one bothered to refill it. I wonder if they kept that name tag mistakenly. Number of dishes were empty & they were not intrsted to refilled & I asked the staff a few times if I would wait for the food. I waited more than 10 minutes for the my Main Dish (Seafood fried rice) & I hardly found  vegetables or seafood in there. It's literally the same as white rice. Binjoul Moju never came up & i gave up. Meat items are ok.  By and large the buffet was unattended & I saw most of the time guests were waiting with plates. The desserts were not too  bad even though the number of items were very limited. All and all Lunch buffers were not upto standard.

placeInfo/addressObj/street2: Colombo City Centre Mall and Residences
text:
Made a booking for a staycation to coincide with my birthday. All arrangements were made via emails which were copied to multiple recipients in the hotel for their information. However the weekend staycation was a total nightmare with many shortcomings & lapses. 
Checked-in on Sunday where the welcome was painstakingly slow. Although the reservation was done via email weeks ahead, it appeared that the check-in was cumbersome. While certain guests were offered welcome drinks, we were left unattended. The front desk failed to send our luggage to our room after scanning where I had to run down to the lobby & request them to be delivered to the room since they were left unattended. 
Entertained some friends for Brunch which was exceptional. At breakfast on the birthday, we were told that breakfast is only complimentary for one person & that we will have to pay for 2 other guests when the package clearly stipulated bed & breakfast for two. Thereafter we were unceremoniously stopped at the entrance to the Beira Kitchen & were asked to settle the bill as we were leaving. Knowing the room number & with my instructions to the restaurant manager to issue the bill, the staff handled the situation in an unprofessional manner. The restaurant manager appeared to be busy having conversations with other guests while keeping us waiting for the receipt.
The hotel had more surprises in store for us at the checkout. The email clearly stipulated that the whole package was Rs. 30,900/- but I was asked to pay Rs. 32,400++ which I politely declined. This was clearly predatory pricing where the hotel had already advertised a promotional price of Rs. 28,888/- for the same packaged using the period of my stay.
I expected it to be a memorable staycation especially since my birthday coincided with the stay, but it was a disaster. The hotel staff was inhospitable & rude. They clearly lacked training. I am hence reluctant to recommend this hotel for staycations. There are other better hotels in Colombo which would look after & treat guests with utmost respect.
However I should compliment the chef for the lovely spread at Brunch & the room staff for keeping rooms tidy & clean.
title: Disappointed 😞

text: Marriot International has a number of different resorts & hotels under luxury, premium, select, & longer stay classes. Hence Courtyard is classified under the select range & the quality of service is contrastingly different from that of Ritz-Carlton & Sheraton which are upscale hotels. The Courtyard by Marriot, Colombo is one of Marriot's mid-priced brands. However I was craving for a hearty dinner at the "Beira Kitchen" which I visited with some of my other foodie friends. Although i had booked a table, we were shifted from one table to another since the first was occupied by other guests. It was a very limited spread with soups, salads, continental, Indian, & Sri Lankan mains, & a dessert section. However the food was average. The buns at the soups section were dry. The spread of salads were very limited & certain salads did not taste right. Certain dishes were empty & they were not refreshed or removed. The mains were also average since both the pork dishes were overcooked. I would love to have a nice juicy pork rib with a good barbeque sauce but the pork they served was dry. The biryani & the other accompaniments at the Indian section were delicious. I loved the mousse cakes at the dessert bar. Unfortunately the action stations were unmanned. Even the crepe & waffle stations were unattended. I had to wait & search for a chef to prepare pasta & kottu which were not upto expectation. Although kottu tasted ok, the pasta lacked seasoning. Presentation of both the dishes were not upto standard & completely different from the way they serve in videos on YouTube & how they advertise on social media.  However the chef suggested that they have a wider spread on Sundays at Brunch which I would love to try!
title: An Average Dinner Buffet 🥂

roomTip: Place your food orders a little in advance of the actual time it’s required-
text:
Courtyard  by Marriott in Colombo’s Beira Restaurant has amazing views during sunset and it’s a lovely place to grab a meal or have drinks. This place is suitable for couples, families and small groups of friends. This is definitely one of Colombo’s happening places! We loved the atmosphere and welcoming hospitality of staff.
However, the food was not up to the expected standard. Being a Marriott Hotel we expected the food to taste better as in other Marriott Hotels. We visited on 11th Feb. Night for dinner and ordered from the Ala Carte Menu - the menu has a wide range of options to chose from. What made the experience upsetting is, we had to wait 20-30 minutes for a server to take our order and nearly another hour for the order to be served. 
I believe it was the head chef who came and spoke to us in the interim and apologised for the delay - in fact he asked us whether we would like to have a salad or a soup from the buffet on the house (which was really nice and thoughtful of him) and requested the server to serve it ASAP. But it look nearly another 20 minutes for the server to serve the soup from the buffet. 
We felt that the kitchen is understaffed or for some reason they couldn’t manage the high amount of Ala Carte orders that came in that time while running the buffet - something that should be looked into to.
To top it off I ordered Chicken breast with potato fries but what I received was Chicken breast with mashed potatoes. I guess the order was mixed up with the busy kitchen. We didn’t make a fuzz about it at the time as to get the potato fries it might take another 30 minutes and we couldn’t wait that long.

Despite how busy the restaurant was that day the staff was very courteous - which is a good thing.
title: Nice place but the food takes a long time to come to the table

roomTip: Not much to do in the area if the weather isn't good, in hindsight one or 2 nights would've sufficed
text:
We booked 3 nights half board at Golden Ridge for our family. 

We knew Nuwara Eliya would be expensive, but were seduced by the online photos of golden ridge & thought it would be worth the splurge we were very wrong! We were already aware that 5* status hotels in Sri Lanka are at a very different standard to those in Europe, Middle East & North America, but we didn't realise the gap would be so great. We booked a junior suite with mountain view, however when shown to the room it bore no resemblance to the photographs. The mountain view, was a slither round a corner if you were to squint through binoculars, just above the restaurant and certainly not the balcony we were expecting. The initial room was very old and tired, we could hear everything from adjacent rooms & corridor,  there was no AC. Family rooms and the quadruples have bigger balconies better views and are cheaper! We subsequently found out all but the mountain suites are in the main hotel. From the response it seems this is a common 'mistake customers make' and it wasn't handled very graciously by the hotel. We upgraded to the mountain suite, taking this from a splurge to simply eye watering. The mountain suite was lovely & the bigger balcony did improve our experience. However having paid for the views the irony was that we had thick mist and rain and couldn't see it for most of the stay. The sun also sets around 6.30pm such that there is no view from the a la carte restaurant & rooftop bars in the evenings, it's all pitch black.

The half board offering is all a self serve buffet, which I wasn't expecting this for such a hefty pricey tag. The food was very good considering it's a buffet, and the best hotel food we had in Sri Lanka, but it's still a buffet. We did look at the other restaurant, but the menu sounded very basic so we stuck with the buffet. 

Service was quite frankly odd at the hotel. The porters, drivers of the golf buggies, cleaners and pool staff were lovely, very warm and friendly, really couldn't do enough for us. Reception staff were just odd, we were literally chased around the hotel for the contactless payment for the upgrade, several times as initially they made a miscalculation. Similarly service in the restaurant was often brusk with plates taken within a split second of finishing food. There was a general sense of the hotel being overstaffed and we wondered if we were interpreting the attempts at attentive service as intrusive. Service certainly wasn't discrete.
title: A very mixed and ultimately disappointing stay

placeInfo/address: 395 Bambarakelle Road, Nuwara Eliya 22200 Sri Lanka
text:

There's no hand sanitizer in the gyms, and you can't clean the machines before/after using them. Also, two times there were no towels.  It's only open til 20.00 and the dinner starts at 19.00. If it rains outside and you'd like to use the treadmil after dinner, you can't because it's close..

roomTip: Book a chalet and take warm clothing.
text: Stayed one night during a visit to this lovely “tea town” in Sri Lanka. We were in a Mountain View chalet which was AMAZING. Great views, modern interiors, jacuzzi on the balcony, faux fireplace and those tasty homemade biscuits in the rooms. Beautiful updated gym and indoor pool facilities. Unfortunately the heating in our room did not work and we were quite cold at night. No extra blankets in room either. Given that this part of the country is cold it may be something for management to consider. We enjoyed the jacuzzi. Where the property fell short- 1) beautiful buffet restaurant but food was unpalatable. Indian food too salty, pasta sauce bland, mass quantity but poor quality. They seriously need to get a better chef. 2) those going to Horton Plains for hiking will want to leave early but the hotel does not provide golf cart service at that time (the chalets are quite a ways away from main building) and the takeaway breakfast are food items all wrapped in cellophane. When you get to Horton Plains, they make you inwrap every single food item and transfer to paper bags. The hotel should know this and package accordingly. Maybe also consider providing hot tea in the early morning hours, as you do upon arrival (tasty orange spiced tea). It’s very cold and those going hiking leave between 5:30-6:00 am. 3) They would allow us to extend checkout and told us to keep our bags ready but then delayed sending a golf cart to pick up the bags. There was a very helpful gentleman at the front desk- I think his name was Dilmeet- and he deserves recognition!
title: Beautiful property but food and service are lacking in many areas.

placeInfo/address: 395 Bambarakelle Road, Nuwara Eliya 22200 Sri Lanka
text:
We recently stayed at the Golden Ridge Hotel in Sri Lanka and had a mixed experience. Be cautious about the room type you book—the new rooms are modern and comfortable, but the old rooms are very dated and in need of serious refurbishment.

Unfortunately, our stay was overshadowed by a fraudulent double charge. This occurred through a message sent by the hotel via Booking.com. While Booking.com reimbursed one of the charges, the hotel denied responsibility and offered no apology, which was deeply disappointing. Resolving the issue required hours of phone calls, and the lack of accountability from the hotel made the experience even worse.

On a positive note, the staff on-site were friendly and helpful during our stay, which we appreciated. However, this wasn’t enough to make up for other shortcomings.

The spa was another disappointment. Located below the pool, it was too noisy to enjoy a relaxing massage. Additionally, the service in the à la carte restaurant was disgraceful, though the food itself was good. For the high, Western-style rates charged, the hotel fails to deliver the level of service and professionalism expected.

In summary, while the newer rooms are appealing and the staff on-site were kind, the overall experience at the Golden Ridge Hotel falls short due to poor guest care, unprofessionalism, and lack of accountability.
title: Poor Guest Care

text:
The Golden Ridge Hotel in Nuwara Eliya offers a mixed experience, with certain aspects being outstanding while others fall significantly short.

Positives:

Room Size: The rooms are spacious, comfortable, and well-maintained, offering a cozy and relaxing stay.
Reception Staff: The staff at the reception were friendly, welcoming, and professional, ensuring a smooth check-in and check-out process.
Food: The quality and variety of the food were excellent, with delicious options catering to various tastes.
Negatives:

Restaurant Service: Unfortunately, the service in the restaurant was a major letdown. Despite requesting water, the waiter simply placed an empty glass on the table and didn’t bother to fill it. Calling for assistance multiple times was met with no response.
Lack of Proactive Supervision: Supervisors in the restaurant seemed indifferent, standing idly without engaging with guests or seeking feedback.
Summary:
While the rooms, reception staff, and food make for a delightful stay, the poor service in the restaurant significantly tarnished the experience. There is a pressing need for improvement in the restaurant's service standards and staff attentiveness. If these issues are addressed, The Golden Ridge Hotel has the potential to offer an exceptional stay.

text:
We stayed in the multi-storey part of the hotel which is in desperate need of work. Firstly waiting 5 minutes for the lift to go to our rooms with suitcases with only one lift to service the whole multi storey hotel is crazy. Then when we got to our rooms although clean the age and dire need for carpets to be replaced (large burn hole in middle of room).  The noise that comes  from the corridor and adjacent rooms are next level.  People late at night deciding to converse in hallways led to someone opening door and abusing which was also very audible to all.

If we had been staying longer we would have upgraded to the condos as there is no way we could stay more than 2 nights in hotel. 

This again is no reflection on the beautiful staff. There wish to help and the pride they take in cleaning room is evident.
title: Very tired …

placeInfo/address: 395 Bambarakelle Road, Nuwara Eliya 22200 Sri Lanka
text:
We (couple + 7  year old son) vacationed in December '23. The Suite we were in was excellent. The view was stunning. Unfortunately though, most of the staff was too junior/inexperienced.

Minor inconveniences in the room  - the battery for the Safe was not working, the Fridge was locked with no key available, the fake 'fireplace' was always on - a bit tacky, given the french curtains, guide rods would have helped. 

However, the service issues sucked the joy out of the stay  - receipt of laundry at the agreed time took a lot of follow up, room service was atrocious - 90 minutes for a simple order, a few dishes were 'forgotten' and were completely cold, very cold service at the buffet...could go on. 

In any case, I think the Hotel must drastically raise the quality of service and do justice to the beauty of the property.
title: Excellent property, let down by service

ownerResponse/text:

text: New luxury hotel with contemporary design. The buffet was copious with a mix of western and local Sri Lankan dishes. The service in the dining room was outstanding. Nice views from the dining room terrace. We were not allowed to use the spectacular restaurant seen on Agoda site although we purchased a half board package (initially we were told we could, and then the manager told us this was an error of an employee in training). The pool is far at the back, small and we did not use it because it was full of children. The assistant manager promised in writing that he would get us our train tickets, but he let us down, and we missed the train ride because the train was sold out, so we went by car to Ella.
title: New spectacular hotel with staff still in training.

I had just one night here.  The hotel looked impressive on arrival but didn't really live up to that first impression. I felt  that it was quite souless and had little ambience.

My bedroom was a good size and had everything I needed.  It was quite new so everything was in good order.  Be aware, that at least on my side of the hotel, you can hear the call to prayers from the nearby mosque which starts at about 6am.

The swimming pool is very small and or group thought the buffet dinner and breakfast were just average, not nearly as good as we had had elsewhere.

Also be aware that the hotel is located a good walk from the actual township, and with the height elevation, the walk back to the hotel can be quite tiring.

ownerResponse/text:
Dear Lara,

Thank you having visited Ulpotha and for reviewing your stay. I'm sorry about the creepy crawlies but Ulpotha is very much a place that is all about being wrapped in the arms of nature. Mosquitoes are more of a nuisance but not one that is a constant, as most times of the year are free of them. Having said that, the generous nets under which one sleeps are there to ensure one's nightly comfort. As for having no electricity, that is usually one of the highlights of the experience - the ambience created by naked flames and flares is a special one that quite often creates a visceral connection to our primal roots - one where we spend time talking and rediscovering the comforting oral traditions that connect all humanity.

More than anything, thank you for appreciating what Ulpotha is fundamentally about: the people (both who live there and visit), the food and the yoga. As for one week being enough, as it happens, we usually recommend that guests stay two weeks to truly connect into what is generally a rare and unique experience.

All the best,

Viren Perera

Unfortunately,too many mosquitoes, and one has to  be aware of creepy crawlies ,it has no electricity,so after 6pm, take a good torch,or a friend to play games with. I felt a week was enough for me.
title: Jungle living

ownerResponse/text:
Dear londongirl44,
 
Thank you for the kind words about Ulpotha and sorry we didn't meet all your expectations on the yoga and spiritual side of things.
 
It's important in the context of your comments to note that Ulpotha was not created to be a yoga centre to begin with. It was a serendipitous outcome of an exercise in playful creativity with the overriding theme being traditional lifestyle and organic, bio-diverse farming. Yoga came later when we were looking at ways of making Ulpotha financially self-sustaining. It was a good fit because Ulpotha lends itself nicely as a place in which to practice yoga – as well as a place in which to connect with nature and reconnect with one’s self. The latter being important since Yoga is meant as a means of connecting mind and body among other things. By broad consensus, Ulpotha has become a highly rated and welcoming Yoga centre.
 
As for the what's offered, there are times, depending on the teacher, when there might be meditation, more intensive Yoga as well as silent walks. But this depends on the teacher and on the guests present at the time. In the case of the particular (very playful) yoga teacher you had on your holiday, he strongly believes in the idea that understanding one’s ego and then neither denying nor embracing it but accepting it for what it is is central to one’s own self-realisation. His Yoga teaching is based on this and in fact he gave a very good talk on this subject in one of his yoga classes - unfortunately after you left. We are sorry that his message didn't resonate with you.
 
In the end, Ulpotha is a place to come and relax and practice Yoga, rather than being an intensive Yoga centre - though it has much to offer that is spiritual.  Having said that, all of our teachers are highly experienced and able to freely discuss and adapt to the needs of our guests, no matter what their level of practice. It’s not clear in your case whether you voiced a desire for some of the things you mention and were ignored or whether you kept the disappointment of your un-met expectations to yourself. If it’s a case of the former, we unreservedly apologise. 
 
As for the Yoga mats, we do struggle to find ones of high enough quality in the country, though we buy the best available – hence our recommendation to bring one’s own to avoid disappointment with ours. However, it’s a point well taken and we will continue to look for ones of a standard good enough so that we can feel comfortable offering our own to visiting guests.
 
Thanks for coming.
 
Viren
placeInfo/address: Near Dambulla & Sigirya In The Heart Of The Cultural Triangle, Ulpotha Village 21100 Sri Lanka
placeInfo/addressObj/street2: In The Heart Of The Cultural Triangle
placeInfo/name: Ulpotha Yoga Retreat And Ayurveda Resort
text:
Ulpotha is set in a lovely spot seemingly in the middle of nowhere. It is true outdoor living which is so peaceful and relaxing. Suzie and the team are very helpful and warm and the food is amazing (even for a non vegan!) 

However as it bills itself as a "yoga retreat" I do have some issues.

I would not classify it as a yoga retreat, more a hotel with yoga. It all depends on expectations of course, but to me a yoga retreat should have meditation, spiritual guidance, silent days, discussions....

Ulpotha offers two times a day yoga, but really none of the above. I would think the time here really depends on what teacher is in residence at the time, and is in part my fault for not researching heavily the teachers. I found the one in residence at my time very cold and not spiritual at all...not even one 'om' on a weeks yoga retreat!! There was too much ego for me. 

Also having to bring your own mat is silly...given the prices charged there should be good quality mats available. 

Also there were a lot of children around when I was there - so great for families but perhaps not what I had expected.
title: Mixed feelings

ownerResponse/text:
Dear Francesca,

Thank you for your review, which was generous in all the things you cited positively about Ulpotha - from how gorgeous you found the place to be to how much you enjoyed the staff, the food, the yoga, the treatments and the other guests.
. 
It's unfortunate that you encountered so many creepy crawlies and had rainy weather during your visit. It is not unusual to encounter a myriad of animal species in Ulpotha, mostly benign, during one's stay - though it's more the case of beautiful birds and butterflies and mischievous monkeys that one usually encounters. However I can understand that nature being as close and immediate as it is in Ulpotha has not been to your taste.  

This is perhaps a good opportunity for us, as management, to reiterate that Ulpotha is not for everyone. However those who are inclined to accept nature at its purest and most open will find  a welcoming spirit - both of a human and animal kind.

I wish you all the best and thank you for having come to Ulpotha and for having taken the time to write about your experience - I'm sorry your visit didn't have an happier outcome.

Kind regards,

Viren Perera
placeInfo/address: Near Dambulla & Sigirya In The Heart Of The Cultural Triangle, Ulpotha Village 21100 Sri Lanka
placeInfo/addressObj/street2: In The Heart Of The Cultural Triangle
placeInfo/name: Ulpotha Yoga Retreat And Ayurveda Resort
text:
I was ready to stay ages, I was in an adventurous spirit but reality struck me and made me change my mind.
Tha place is gorgeous and the staff very friendly, the vegan organic food is incredible and the other guests are very interesting people. However it was hard to stay in these huts with no walls, the bathrooms were not too close so a night pee was out of the question. The humidity made everything always wet.
The animals are another problem, we had a large mouse (who we named Ludwig) crawling on the beams above our beds. I had to keep shaking my clothes every time I wanted to put a t shirt on for fear that bugs or mice had crawled into my suitcase.
What really made me leave was a hanging snake on the hut's low roof, that almost touched me upon entering my place. 
Other than that, the yoga is great and so are the other treatments and massages they offer.
title: Had to cut my trip short

placeInfo/address: Near Dambulla & Sigirya In The Heart Of The Cultural Triangle, Ulpotha Village 21100 Sri Lanka
placeInfo/addressObj/street2: In The Heart Of The Cultural Triangle
placeInfo/name: Ulpotha Yoga Retreat And Ayurveda Resort
roomTip: Amazing giant Budda nearby!
text:
You have to be prepared to go here, and be ready to really embrace the lifestyle. A five star resort it is not.
Fantastic food. Great Ayurvedic treatments.
Great wildlife around...too much for some. Beautiful butterflies, dragon flies. Some fantastic views to take in.
You get a lot out of removing yourself from a city existence and experiencing this more back to basics lifestyle. It feels like you are getting a very authentic sense of the place.
Do bear in mind the Mosquitos will get you, take insect repellant, allergy tablets and bite cream! Also a torch!
title: Be Prepared and you'll enjoy it
